Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us traveling so we booked a suite which had one King size bed and couch that I was told when i call the other two could sleep on. No we could not so we had to rent a rollaway for the 20.00 a night. Also there was not mini fridge in the room. Four people and each of us had a lap top and each had to pay for internet service 13.95 a day each. All on top of the cost of the room. The Tower level lounge had nightly snacks but the seemed to have lost interest in them once that put them out. Also a few bad choices on thier part, like just piling a cheese covered appitizer in a chafing dish which then become a mess of melted cheese stuck together.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear84
Reviews.Content: My 13 month daughter and I stayed her in late July. We had a great stay, From Sonny and Christopher getting us checked in quick and easy, to Maria cleaning up after us in the tower lounge for two days and always smiling, security always posted in the lobby ready to answer any question you have, thx Sonny,Christopher,Maria.

Reviews.Title: “DAY STAY WONT BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: geordiedora
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a day stay whilst enroute from maui, as we had 12 hour layover. Were given keys to a room already occupied by sleeping occupants. When returning to the front desk no apology given and a frosty faced colleague served us. The hotel is a nice classy hotel with alovely airy bedrooms but the staff are snobby and unhelpful therefore i would not stay again. After having our onward flights cancelled, we stayed next door at the Marriott hotel which was just as classy but had excellent staff, friendly and approachable we would recommend this hotel, much cheaper but quality staff plus they also have free transfers from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ANDY1888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night as I needed to take a flight out of LAX at 7am. This is a very nice hotel and the front desk staff was nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal travellers airport stop”
Reviews.Author: Narziss
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times recently to recover from flights from NZ and to prepare for flights to NZ, all you have to do is wait for the free airport shuttle which operates frequently 24/7. Has been a great place to stay and for $1.00 you can catch the bus outside to the city and beach of Santa Monica which makes a great rest day activity.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeppeWrangler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a late arrival (11:30 pm) at LAX and checked out early (9:00 am) on the way to the rest of our trip. We had reserved a non-smoking king, but they had none left when we arrived; our choice was a smoking room with a king bed or a non-smoking room with two *full* size beds (which are really small). The location is super-convenient -- free shuttle to/from the airport and a Hertz car rental on-site (where we got our rental car). The breakfast buffett is very good but a bit pricey. Apparently you can get a coupon to get the buffett for free -- we didn't have one but it's worth looking into. The room is what you'd expect of a Hilton, very nice but not outstanding, clean, comfortable (other than the small bed).

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ladyaviva
Reviews.Content: What a first rate hotel! Convenient location, right near LAX, impeccable, friendly, and courteous service, and beautiful views from my 11th floor room! Cost was reasonable, especially when you consider the convenience. Room was beautifully furnished, with quality bathroom soap (always something I check, because too often the soap in hotel rooms hardly even raises a lather) and a wonderful, steaming hot shower! Bed linens were very good quality. If I had one small issue it was the TV ... placed square in the middle of the window and blocking a bit of the fabulous view. With a skyline to gaze at and watching those beautiful planes come in to land, why would anyone want to ruin it with the blinking box?! A very good hotel experience, nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Best and most convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: amaroocars
Reviews.Content: We travel to US once or twice a year and always stay at Hilton Lax on arrival and the day before we depart home to Aussie. Have always found the service excellent even though the hotel is now "aged". Recently upgraded rooms and the higher floor are excellent. Great for the traveller looking to beat jetlag after the flight across the Pacific as its close but so quite, even though its situated between the LAX runways, so great to see the planes comming in but not hearing them. Great shuttle service to airport and have even used it to just go to LAX to check on bookings etc. For those people that use Hertz, the desk at the hotel is staffed by most helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi sucks, food expensive”
Reviews.Author: AirFairy
Reviews.Content: I stay here 3-5 times a month due to work. Wifi sucks! Doesn't matter if you're on floor 5, or the executive floor on 13. Signal drops out every minute. Just gave up and used my 3G on my iphone. Food is expensive, as are most restaurants at hotels in this class. Pool is outdoors, but doesn't have that 'enticing' feel to it. Some nights it is loud in the hallways and I'm wondering am I at a motel? Beds are comfy and room is nice, but you can tell it's an old hotel. Old TV's in rooms, NO flatscreens. Thermostat is old fashioned dial where you're not really sure what the temp is. Just have to guess somewhere between 60-70, 70-80? Shower head is old and not great coverage/pressure. I don't mind staying here for the huge discount I get, but would NOT pay normal rates to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton valet parking service - we will use again!”
Reviews.Author: pismomama
Reviews.Content: I must admit we did have one small problem getting our car parked at first due to the arrival of some dignitary with an entourage of police and CHP. Must be a great place to stay but we only used their parking service. I've seen other complain about the delays so we left plenty of time to make our connections and all went very swiftly. The baggage personnel were very helpful and the driver as well. Only negative would be my surprise at how much trash their was on the floor of the shuttle on the day of our return. We got in at 6am so perhaps that is their busy time. I texted them when we landed per the instructions on our receipt and our car was ready for pickup when we arrived. We were prepared for the wait for the shuttle when we returned. Would be nice if they came by more frequently but as it was a beautiful day we really didn't mind. We did have a fellow passenger on the outbound side of our trip that didn't make her flight. Would be helpful for travelers on tight schedules to know that the shuttle doesn't go directly from the Hilton to the Airport. It makes one other stop at another local hotel. All in all a great, easy experience and we will use their valet parking service again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Toto2Leavenworth
Reviews.Content: Took a room here for the convenience to the airport. This is a first rate hotel. Valet parking was very convenient, front desk staff was efficient and friendly, bell staff was quick and courteous. Room service was too expensive so we ate at the coffeee shop. Very good espresso, croissants, and fresh fruit. Next to the airport I expected it to be noisy.....I was wrong. And the king size bed was excellent to sink into and sleep comfortably all night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport without the airport noise”
Reviews.Author: AL_Bandeirantes
Reviews.Content: I travel often to the Burbank and Glendale area but I stay here always on the last days of my trip becaues of the terrible traffic on the 405 and because this hotel is so close to the airport. The rooms are comfortable and adequate, the business lounge on the 16th floor provides an awesome view of the airport runways to watch planes take off and land. The bar is reasonabily priced for the city it is in and the service is quick. Other than that this hotel is more or less for people "on the go" so you will see a lot of activity at all hours of the day in the lobby due to folks arriving from and leaving for the airport. There's not much around the hotel as far as stores or shops but then again it is right next to the airport. I've never had a problem finding a parking space in the underground garage, although the spaces are quite tight depending on the vehicle you have. What I liked best about this hotel is that even being so close to the airport, you can't hear any jet noise from planes taking off and landing, I've had rooms on the 16th and 17th floors and it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “not bad...but a bit slow at check in”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to an executive floor, room was fine for myself, cbathroom small, but clean and room very quite, but had nothing for a view. Room service speed was OK, food was nothing to write home about. My only complaint was the check in process. Fortunately I got to the desk quickly before the rest of the shuttle figured out where to check in and was #3 in the HHonors line, but the other line was at least 10 deep and only one person at HHonors and the one in the other. Need some staff flexibility during tmes when the guests start lining up heavily.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Parking Mess”
Reviews.Author: shipsealand
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations 3 weeks prior to park at the LAX Hilton for a cruise this July. We arrived 7 AM Saturday morning and had great difficulty finding an available parking spot. We circled around and around down all the levels and then back up. We faced being stuck with 10 days of parking fees and no spot to park. There were no attendants around and we had to catch the flight for our cruise. Fortunately after much frustration we found one spot to park. Hilton needs to get its act together and needless to say we will never use them again. Note we also had used them last year and had difficulty finding a parking spot even though we made reservations but we did find a spot sooner and less stress than this time.

Reviews.Title: “Easy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fab65Roma_Italy
Reviews.Content: I recently had to stop by LA for one night and I picked up this hotel among those close to the airport. The hotel is perfect if you have to spend one night, the shuttle service with the airport is efficient and the hotel is really close by. The executive lounge is nice and practical. The rooms were just for one night so I did not pay attention to the furniture, while the space is really just enough. The hotel has also a pool we didn't use. the breakfast was good and the staff allover the hotel was helpful. So if you are looking for an airport hotel in LA that's could be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: shethang
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before my very early morning flight. The front desk service was efficient and friendly. The service at Landings Bar in lobby area was too. Pleasant surprise! I would rate higher, but for the price I paid there are a few things about the property that I didn't love. The building is obviously older and very highly trafficked since it is so close to LAX. It's been updated, but it's kind of like dressing up an old pig. You can tell its age when the in-room thermostat is an old plastic dial thing from the 1970's and the room just doesn't cool off properly because building mechanicals are old. It was a sunny day and what looked and sounded like raindrops were hitting my window outside. Clearly something mechanical was dripping outside, another sign of the building age. I'd stay again only if I had a very early flight because it is super convenient to LAX. Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Day stay in transit at LAX”
Reviews.Author: ekirsty
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LAX after a 13hr flight and with a 10 hr transit. I walked out of the terminal and hopped on the first free hotel shuttle which happened to be the Hilton's one. I was offered a room for 8hrs with no hassle. $79. The bed was extremely comfy and the room clean as expected. It was the perfect way to have a 6hr snooze, a shower and refresh before continuing on the next part of my journey. Will definitely be doing the same thing when I pass through again next week.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Erica_81
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel to the airport is great! Literally a 2 minute drive. I rented a car but I believe they have free shuttle service. The room were clean and fresh. The BED at this hotel was MARVELOUS! It's amazingly comfortable. Did not hear any airplanes pass despite the close proximity. Our rate included a buffet breakfast which had a plenty of hot and cold food options, pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juices. My ONLY complaint about my stay was the $20 daily rate for self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tresc0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on route from London to Hawaii. The hotel shuttle (which was free) was excellent and on time both inward and outward journey. Check in staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient. Hotel room allocated was on the 13th floor overlooked the car parking area but we had great views of the planes coming in to land. The room was very large, very clean and comfortable with good quality furnishings. We ate dinner in The Cafe restaurant on the ground floor - again staff were excellent and the meal (chicken) was very good and excellent value for money - would well recommend it. This hotel is excellent for the airport and we would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing remarkable -- Better values available in the vicinity”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton LAX for a few hours between flights in the summer of 2010. Room was adequate. Hotel's public areas are attractive, but fairly busy. Parking is a pain in the neck -- both driving through their maze of a garage and dealing with their system for discounted parking for hotel guests. Lines were too long at check out. Be prepared for this if you are checking out before a flight. Would opt to stay elsewhere on future trips for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Staff- Parking, Elevator, Dining Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: hiltonsucks-2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly, especially those working in the bistro dining area. The security officers were very helpful, friendly, and handsome! A+ for hiring those fine men!! The maidstaff was excellent! On the flip side, the parking was terrible. i paid 20 dollars a day and assumed that would guarantee parking, but it did not. Coming in during the wee hours of the morning, we thought parking would be a challenge. But it wasn't just a challenge during the wee hours, it was all day. There were empty spaces blocked off for car pools while we went around and around trying to find places to park, Eventually settling on parking next to a wall where our car could have been damaged. People parked cars in, fortunately that was not the case for us, but one guest was very upset when he could not leave. The elevators were slow to the parking ramp One night it tool us 20 to catch an elevator. The entire hotel is outdated to be a hilton. The entire facility is very banquet looking. The rooms were just alright. Nothing special. The tvs were out dated (not flat screens). The concierge although was helpful gave us wrong directions on two separate occasions. Thank goodness for cell phone GPS. The food in the dining area was not good, and I would recommend eating at the bistro near the front of the hotel. The floors of the hotel needed to be vacuumed and shampooed as they were stained. The elevators that take you to the rooms were also very slow even though there was 6 of them! The pool is small. Don't go thinking you will gegt a good spot. there are about 20 chairs even though there are like 4 hot tubs!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed at in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: TMCronrath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hilton LAX and recieved nothing but fabulous customer service and friendly smiles and hellos from the minute we pulled up in the shuttle until we brought our bags down for departure. I have never felt so "at home" while being on vacation. Day 2 we had an issue with our air conditioner and the service man was at our room within 5 minutes. He even left a chocolate shaped like a wrench and a note letting us know it had been fixed. Great location for us - walking distance to drug store and cheaper restuarant options and we really loved the shuttle to Manhattan Beach! If we ever come back to LA, we will definitely be staying at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: heidigon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton LAX as part of a park and one night stay as we were going on vacation. I called the hotel directly twice on the day of our arrival to confirm our reservation. They could not locate our reservation. When we arrived they were able to find it after three employees searched. We were put in a room that was dirty, dated and opened directly to the pool area (like a motel room), with a sliding door. The room is seriously dated, i.e. dorm room with laminate furniture. The nicest area of this hotel is the lobby. The TV did not function, so we called the front desk four times in a 2 hour period before they finally sent a technician. When the technician said he couldn't repair it, the hotel moved us to another room. The second room was equally dated and dirty. On our return from our vacation, we waited 45 minutes (at 5 a.m.) at the airport for a hotel shuttle to arrive. While others came around every 15 minutes. We will not return to this hotel. The hotel seriously needs updating and better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: StripedFeline
Reviews.Content: I was here from the 23rd to the 26th June '11 for a short event I was attending. I'm a 20-year-old girl who came all the way from England, so I was a bit nervous considering it was my first traveling experience all alone. The Hilton made me feel so welcome and comfortable when I arrived and left. The staff I came across were very helpful and polite, and would go out of their way for you. When I was leaving one of the guys at the front door (I forgot to ask for his name!) noticed I was waiting for the shuttle for a while and had me sit down in the lobby area whilst he waited for it himself, which I thought was very nice of him! Speaking of shuttles, these were very convenient for getting to and from the hotel, and the drivers were very nice and helpful and took my suitcase without question when they saw me struggling to lift it. The room itself was really nice, which I expected since I was staying at the Hilton of course! The bed was so comfy, housekeeping came every day, the room looked out to the lovely pool area... The one thing I got confused about was to how to use the shower! We use it differently in England and I couldn't find any instructions, etc. I figured out how to do the bath, but not the shower. Plus my GHD straighteners didn't work or have power when I plugged them in (which I've been told is because they need a lot of power?). Apart from that, my hotel experience was absolutely perfect. Thank you so much for making my trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobali
Reviews.Content: We had some contact with the hotel prior to our arrival - after a long 10 hr flight we arrived to what we can only describe as a lovely looking and impressive hotel. The foyer area is large and looks lovely with its sweeping stairs, gold and marble fittings and polite doormen. Check in was efficient and easy and we had 2 big corner rooms as promised over looking the runway, they were clean and the fittings were all in good order, the linen quality was particularly good. Yes there is some noise from the runway but we were not affected by it. We spoke with the conceirge and they arranged a day excursion the next morning, good price for what we received but they were late picking us up, when in fact there head quarters were around the corner ? We didn't dine in the hotel but we had breakfast down the road in Dennys which I must say was excellent value for money. On our first night we walked around the corner and caught the Big Blue Bus to Santa Monica which was lovely to stretch our legs and wander around the shops. On our second night the conceirge informed us about the trolley which went to Manhattan Beach from the stop right outside the hotel front door which was nice to also stroll around. We also used the pool during the afternoon, even with the aircraft noise it suited us fine as it was a lovely suntrap. We were very impressed with the Hilton and we would definately recommend it for an over night stay if like us you don't want to drive as soon as you arrive into LA. The free shuttle from the airport made it easy for us to transfer back to pick up our car 2 days later and the day excursion let us see as much as possible without the driving. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “About time they updated”
Reviews.Author: Bethcooks4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as part of a luxury trip, booked by our TA. The first room we were put in was disgusting with major stains all over the carpets. The second room was better but still not as good as the Super 8 we stayed at in a small town in WI where there wasn't a hotel choice. Room and hall carpets all were stained, worn and needed vacuuming. Furniture was cheap 70's styleless and in bad repair. Wallpaper needed replacing. Certainly not a luxury hotel. The first room was on 8 and the second on 10. We were told that floors 10 and above had recently been renovated but not our room and not the halls. We had two meals at the restaurant and breakfast with room service. Those were fine but we learned later that breakfast was included with our room (in our package) if we had gone the the restaurant. No one informed us of that. All in all we will not go back. We are Hilton Honors members and always choose Hilton hotels for the consistency in quality but the hotel falls way short in that.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent airport stay”
Reviews.Author: beachgoers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and convenient to the airport. The free shuttle to and from the airport was reliable and not over crowded. The beds and linens were of excellent quality and I found the hotel to be fairly quiet. The breakfast buffet was overpriced for what it was, but there are few alternatives unless one is prepared to go out of the immediate area. I do recommend the Big Blue Bus #3 that picks up outside of the hotel and goes to Venice beach and Santa Monica. It is only $1 each way (50cents if you are over 65) and is a pleasant way to spend the day if you are on a stopover. There is a trolley to Manhattan beach and a local shopping mall, at $5 round trip this is also a good alternative especially if you want a change from eating at the hotel. The hotel provides a kiosk near the check-in for printing boarding passes for most common airlines; this is a very useful feature especially if you are not checking baggage. Dinner at the more casual restaurant was pleasant and if you are not a big eater I would recommend sharing as the price soon adds up. Coffee I think was $4 for example. There is a free tea and coffee maker in the room and this was a really nice feature that we used a lot. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: MartaA1
Reviews.Content: Typical airport hotel, we staid one night after driving back from Las Vegas. Free shuttle to/from LAX 24 hours so very handy. Room was basic, but comfortable. Staff was really nice. Food was poor, we had dinner in the coffee bar downstairs and it wasn't great. The pool area is ok, but the towels provided were really old and too small. Overall ok for a one night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient to Lax - they have a shuttle and after a longhaul flight it is ideal to try to recover from the jetlag. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are very comfortable - you can always get good online rates too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Hotel, next to LAX Airport, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pasowine
Reviews.Content: For an Airport Hotel, I was pleasantly surprised. The check-in was easy and friendly. Tanya at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. My room looked East down Century Blvd and was quite nice - best of all, quiet. The TV, although not a flat screen, worked quite well. Internet service was superb and decent speed. The bar downstairs was a great place to watch sports and socialize -either in a large group or off in the corners for a more quiet setting. I could sort of hear the jets taking off and landing at LAX, but it really wasn't a bother at all. About the only issue was the self-parking - it was hard to find a place and then one had to wait quite awhile for the parking elevators down below the hotel. A little uncomfortable late at night. All in all - would highly recommend this hotel, despite its size, for stays before/after flights at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Has anything you would expect in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyold
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel that has everything you would expect. It's slightly old, but they do a good job maintaining it and my particular room has everything working as expected. The hotel itself is very big, so often times there are long lines for everything you might need. Some of the highlights include: 1. Stations to print airline boarding pass. This is very convenient especially if you don't have checked baggage, since you could go to the airport and go straight to the security line. 2. Shuttle service from/to LAX airport, a HUGE plus. 3. Valet parking. A little pricey at $33 per 24 hours, but it's worth it. I have to mention that if you do decide to park yourself, the parking lot goes down to six levels underground and even then, it's still hard to find parking, especially in the weekends when there are events in the hotel ballroom. 4. Excellent restaurant and cafe. 5. There is a Hertz counter in the parking lot, which could make your trip that much more convenient. Remember when booking on Hertz website to indicate your pick up and drop off as LAX Hilton, not LAX itself. The only bad thing I could say about this hotel is that sometimes the noise from the hallway is really audible in the room and vice versa. If you are a light sleeper, this might become an issue. Also, the internet here is NOT free. I forget exactly how much it is, but I remember that it was quite expensive, which is why I did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveinant to the airport, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: FlyingMan11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to LAX literally 5 minutes from the airport. They have a shuttle that will pick you up and take you to the hotel as well as they neighboring hotel. The lobby bar stays open untill 2 am. The hotel has a 24 hour room service as well as a bakery and small food shop also in the lobby. Next to the front desk there is a Hertz rent a car where you can rent a car directly out of the hotel. Prices were fairly reasonable. My room was an inside corner room which to be honest was massive. There was 1 king bed, and the room was probably 23 feet by 16. It was easily the biggest hotel room I have ever been in. I had a door on both sides on my room which led to 2 different hallways. The bed was very comfortable, the tv was a basic tube top tv. From here it took me about 25 minutes to get to Hollywood hills and 30 minutes to get to Santa Monica Pier. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: firecracker47
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed at recently. We had an offer to upgrade the room for a small amount each night and we did. We ended up in a two room bath and a half suite. It was wonderful. The bed was better than my bed at home. The room was spotless. And for me, I loved the panoramic view of the LAX runways. I could hardly tear myself away. There seemed to be security everywhere. Going up and down from the garage, standing by the elevators and watching the lobby. About what you would expect from that size hotel. You still have to be your own advocate and not leave things in the room that have value. While we did not have much interaction with the staff since we were out and about most of the time, there seemed to be plenty of people to ask if you needed something. We like the location because it is close to relatives, close to going down to Long Beach and close to the marina. If you are looking to go shopping or walk to tourist attractions, you can't. It is an airport hotel. I can't wait until my next visit to LA so that we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Ron270
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Comfortable bed and quiet room. Lobby was very clean and check in and out was a breeze. The only negative I experienced was that I left behind my cell phone charger and when I call to have it mail back to me they told me that housekeeping didn't found anything in the room. Ok then!

Reviews.Title: “Off to a good start!”
Reviews.Author: emysand
Reviews.Content: Before boarding a ship for a 15 day cruise to Hawaii, I booked 3 rooms at the Hilton for my family, brother and sister in law. The pre-cruise days at the Hilton were just around the Christmas Holiday and I was going to be away from my grandchildren for this time. Thus, I invited my sons and their families to enjoy a few days in LA with their uncle, aunt. They had not seen my brother in over 20 years. It was a wonderful time and the kids enjoyed the trip. My granddaughter especially loved the Gingerbread house in the lobby. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The special dining area for breakfast and dinner drinks was very convenient as we do not like leaving the kids. The only negative thing was it was raining so hard there was water in one of the rooms. We did not appreciate the wet towels in the room but all in all it was a well spent time and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: I will approach this review from a different perspective since I stayed here after missing a connection at the airport. The airline gave this as the hotel I was staying at. A shuttle picked us up at the airport, though this took a while. Once at the hotel, they quickly entered my voucher and I was in the room within 5 minutes. They even informed me that my food vouchers from the airline could be used in the bistro, which I thought was useful. The room itself was clean and comfortable. I was able to see the planes landing and taking off. There is some noise, but not as much as some other airport hotels I've stayed at. The shuttle runs 24 hours a day, which was great, since I was able to get to the airport for my very early flight without any worries. It was an enjoyable, though unexpected stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: chloes1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline - a little weary that we might get a "Priceline" room since it was mentioned in a prior review, but there wasn't anything wrong with it. We were on the 12th floor facing the city. Although we could hear the airplanes, it wasn't cause for concern (although you can definitely hear noise from the hallways). The room was clean, although the A/C & TV were old and the bathroom was TINY - but for the price I paid to stay Sat-Sunday during Memorial Wknd it was definitely worth it. I paid more than double to stay at a 4* in West Hollywood and I thought this was more than comparable. We parked in the lot downstairs - although the elevator was slow, we always found parking. My only issue was that when we got there around 1pm to check in, they wouldn't let us saying none of the rooms were available which I highly doubted since it did not seem full at all during our stay. Based on the location, everywhere we went was only a 20 minute drive at most. I would definitely book in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight LAX Choice”
Reviews.Author: wlb1204
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this place at around $70 for quick LAX overnight. Super shuttle, excellent staff, good room service, clean room. No bug bites like at my return hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: DigitalPRMusic
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this, First off protect your possessions, They have a theft problem and when reported the staff was horrible in dealing with it. I can say some staff was amazing however I would stay at Hiltons again. JUST NOT THIS ONE.. Poor customer service, Disrespectful and overall staff lacks in Customer Service skills. I had to file a police report over the theft. I travel a lot and I do not pay for my rooms, My Record label has promised me that no one from the label will stay here again. I would stay at the Weston or any other hotel by LAX again. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport. Far from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: eddies_advice
Reviews.Content: I liked it, but I wouldn't stay there again. The service is ok, but not very helpful. The rooms were nice, but don't ever get sucked into upgrading it to a larger room to also include breakfast. The standard room is just as good and you're better off having breakfast down in the restaurant. It's close to the airport and the Hilton provides a free shuttle service to and from the airport, but it's far from everything, in terms of entertainment and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great strides”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to the Hilton LAX; and this past visit, I noticed a marked improvement in service, staff demeanor, and product. This is not a hotel where one would vacation to say, Disneyland, it doesn't market itself as a resort, it is a (very large) airport property, with all the amenities that business and frequent travelers are used to: HHonors floors, HHonors lounge, room service, proximity to the airport. Service had fallen off here previously, but I am pleased to say that it has come back with force: with ONE exception: the shuttle. The shuttle is shared with the Four Points hotel, it can be slow, and frustrating. A suggestion to management: have one shuttle for Terminals 1-3, and another for TBIT-7, as the shuttle finds it's way to 7, it is almost always packed, and the passengers who have boarded at 1,2 and 3 are steamed.

Reviews.Title: “I Thought Hiltons Were Suppose To Be Nice!?”
Reviews.Author: Row21Middle
Reviews.Content: Purpose of Trip: Leisure Length of Stay: 2 nights *Airport Shuttle*: I arrived at LAX early in the morning. The airport shuttle came promptly and was wonderful--no complaints there. *Check-In*: Since we arrived rather early (~10 am), we were told by the Front Desk staff to come back in a couple hours. Not a problem. When we came back, the guy working at the front desk honored our request of two beds on a high floor. He gave us a room on the 9th floor, and said that was the highest floor that has two beds. When we went up to it, it was the most atrocious inner-corner room I've ever seen!! This had to have been one of the Priceline rooms (If you used Priceline, BEWARE!!). The window was so small, and the view so obstructed that it really could give someone a claustrophobic feeling. I took one look at it and went back down to the Front Desk. Fortunately, a sympathetic agent gave us a normal room on the 10th floor that had two beds. So, obviously the first Front Desk clerk lied to us about not having rooms with 2 beds higher than the 9th floor. I know this is a really small point to lie about, but the principle of being lied to made me feel incredibly unwelcome during my entire stay. *Rooms*: Our room was really outdated and worn. From the old tube TV to the peeling wallpaper by the window, our room had seen better days. The bathroom was nice, though. *Location*: There were no solid places to eat within walking distance, unless you consider Carl Jr's solid. The hotel has several restaurants, but unless you're on an expense account...yeah. Oh, and I totally agree with the previous reviewer about the elevator drama. Seriously, there was nothing like going to the elevator bank and seeing an out-of-service elevator resting a foot above floor-level. Overall: The bed was very comfortable, and I slept well. There were also some staff who truly wanted me to enjoy my stay. However, as outlined above, the cons outweighed the pros.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY AT HILTON LAX”
Reviews.Author: NJEXIT7A
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 5 night stay while visiting family in LA at the Hilton. The location was perfect for us since we were doing day trips each day - i.e. Disneyland. The Concierge Staff was very pleasant and always had a smile on their face while assisting me with directions or my lost luggage from the airport. Our guest room was very clean and the shuttle service to the Airport was wonderful. I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a symphony of bland and beige”
Reviews.Author: FozzyO
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight over from London to LA for a overnight stop before going up to Canada. So the trip was only going to be very short. We arrived a the airport, quickly through immigration, and then found the hotel shuttle stop. On the bus and a short ride with a few extra stops to the hotel. This is our second stay there and it is trying to hard to be inoffensive in design and decor that it just becomes the most boring hotel on the planet. Everything is beige with the occasional splash of taupe. For more then a few hours it is a very depressing colour scheme / decor. We checked into the room, very large, comfy bed, nice view of some air con units and carparks - but then this is an airport hotel so you don't expect views. We headed down to the 'Sports Bar' for some wings before retiring to bed. They say sports bar, yet more beige everywhere. And the plasma TV's on the bar showing some sport make it a Sports Bar. Still very good friendly service, and excellent wings so we ate and enjoyed. Back to the room and to bed. Jetlag got the worse of us so up early we decided to download the new series opener of Dr Who ... incredibly slow internet connection! But we managed it and plugged the iPod into the TV and enjoyed. So if you need a clean comfortable place to crash for a night on a layover its good. For a conference or any longer it could send me a bit crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed it to be”
Reviews.Author: aussie_possie
Reviews.Content: Arrived in LA at around 10am with 2 small kids, 6 & 3, who travelled well but were still a little tired. After the dash from the baggage/customs run we found the hotel shuttle and were so relieved to have a smooth (and fortunately very easy) transition from airport to hotel. When we arrived staff were helpful and polite. We were given our room which we were told was on the quiet side of the building. Fortunately they were right - we had a corner double room where we could watch (but not hear) the planes landing at LAX - certainly kept Mr 3 entertained while the grown-ups got their bearings. As per below reviews, that hotel is a little dated but wasn't something we dwelled on as we fell asleep within minutes of arriving. When we did surface, the concierge was very informative and was able to help us find a shopping centre to organise communications etc. My only suggestion would be to include some kids meals on the room service menu, certainly that would be my only gripe. Otherwise I would like to thank the staff at Hilton LAX for helping start out our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Handy to LAX, clean, dated”
Reviews.Author: LP70
Reviews.Content: We've all been there - hours of travelling, delayed links, frayed nerves, and the last flight (in my case last Qantas to Syd) missed. It's 12.30am, I'm tired, airline staff are arguing about a hotel voucher, I am starting to sway on my feet and am most decidely over it. A quick call to the Hilton LAX and $120 later I leave them arguing, shuttle bus picks me up and soon I'm showered and sleeping and ready to tackle everything fresh the next day. For what I needed Hilton LAX gets v good marks - quick, efficient, easy to get to from a deserted LAX. Other positives: the lobby area is nice, there is obvious and friendly security at entrances, 24 hr room service and the L1 cafe is open 24 hours. The bed was comfy, extra blanket and pillow in the (very small) closet, room service quick and pleasant (note - gratuities already added), a 5pm check out for no extra charge, internet fast and staff were helpful and generally friendly esp reception staff. The rooms however are very tired. No minibar, the drink machines only take $1 bills . Bathrooms small and plastic feel. No safe in room. TVs are old and not flat screen. Air con seemed a bit hit and miss with the temperature. No extra deadbolt on the door. About a $40 cab ride downtown, shuttle to LAX runs every 15 mins or so and both my drivers were lovely - helped other people with bags etc (of course, I had no bags). So thank you Hilton LAX for being there, for being reliable and for your check in staff and security who welcomed me late at night when I wasn't feeling the best. That said, I reckon a refurb is quite overdue. For the rooms, at least upgrade the TVs, see if you can compensate for the poor bathrooms with some other toiletries or more towels or some other touches, add a keyed minibar (even if just soda or one of those cheap move it and you've bought it models), update the room aircon controls to digital and a safe would be good places to start.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiAndyB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for one night after a long flight. We had a King suite I think and it worked out around Â£140 which seemed about right. The rooms were spacious, clean but a little dated. It is very handy for the car rental companies, although obviously being an airport hotel, not good for visiting the city (Venice beach is about 15 mins by car). Good value, spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Airport shuttle is a problem!”
Reviews.Author: Keepthepace
Reviews.Content: Airport transfers should be efficient. Yours along with the lack of assistance from 5 bellstaff and supervisor are not. Over 40 people waited 30 mins at 7:45am for an import shuttle. When two busses arrived, it was chaos with just one bellman helping load quite a bit of luggage from the mob of people needing to go to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place for short stay”
Reviews.Author: zaneforce007
Reviews.Content: I needed to both visit a client, and then (the next day) pick up my aunt from the airport, and I figured I'd try to squeeze a little bit of recreation in. LAX is two hours from my house so I just needed a place to stay. I bid on priceline for a 3 1/2 star hotel for $55 and got the Hilton Los Angeles Airport. The hotel was relativly outdated. It had that motel style TV with 20 or so channels, and the movie menu. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. A big problem was that I needed the internet for work, and it didn't function. But I have no complaints about that I suppose because the hotel generously refunded the internet fee. The parking price is slightly absorbant but I do recomend using it, as opposed to the cheaper surrounding parking complexes, because 1. It's convienient to take an elevator to your car (even if the car is in a maze 6 floors underground) and 2. The area around the hotel didn't seem like the safest place to be walking around at night. The front desk people were pretty friendly. An important fact might be that you can hear each time an airplane takes off. While this didn't bother me (I might even consider it soothing), the noise has the potential to keep some insomniacs up all night. The bathrooms were pretty small and had a "motel feel". I personally had a nice view of the airport and got to see all the planes take off in room 1147. All in all, It's a decent place to stay if you need somewhere to stay for a connecting flight, or short trip of that type of nature. I however would not recoment spending your whole Los Angeles vacation there. It's labeled as a 3 1/2 star hotel, but It's a little bit more along the lines of a "nice" 2 1/2 star hotel or a "bad" 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Tired Airport Hotel That Only Has Its Location To Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: I am recommending this hotel solely on the basis of its location so close to LAX. If you are a Hilton HHonors member, there are other, likely better Hilton-brand options to consider (like the Embassy Suites North or the Hilton Garden Inn - I've stayed at both hotels and they are good options). If you are not tied to the Hilton family of hotels, there are probably much better options located close to the hotel. Getting to the hotel from LAX is via shuttle bus. The hotel no longer operates its own shuttle, but uses a contractor. Shuttles serve more than one hotel. The buses are old, loud, and uncomfortable. The shuttle makes its first stop at the Hilton; on the way to the airport, you will make at least one stop at another hotel. Keep this in mind when planning out how long it will take you to get back to the airport. When the shuttle arrives at the hotel, it's a race to the checkin counter at the back of the hotel. If you're slow, you will wait to check in. My checkin took about 10 minutes and was handled in a competent if not particularly welcoming manner. This Hilton is tired. When was the last time you had a room with an old-style television with a picture tube? The hotel hasn't upgraded to flat panel televisions. Common areas are worn down. My room was dark and small, with what felt like a very low ceiling. The walls were scuffed, wall paper was peeling away, and the bathroom was cramped and not particularly clean. The room's HVAC system was anemic and the construction of the building allowed noise (jets taking off) into the room, making sleep difficult. My bottom line is that this hotel is only acceptable when transiting LAX (which I was doing) and solely on the basis of its location so close to LAX. In any event, the hotel's owners need to invest in refurbishing/updating this property. The Hilton LAX has a lot of potential; it's sad that it doesn't come close to meeting that potential.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: Greevo1
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite after missing a connection to Australia. Service was great, room was good and very quiet. Food very good. Concierge were helpful and the 3.00pm late checkout was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very big hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: tohellor
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel, it was only $60 a night, so I was pleasently supriseed to find such a large hotel. It has nice big rooms with tea/coffee etc, the rooms are a little dated and you can be walking a long time to your room as the hotel is very big. Overall I was happy with it, but then again I only spent $60 on it so couldnt really go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel. Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Irvine-Robbie
Reviews.Content: I arrived for check-in at 10pm and there was a very short (less than 5 minute wait). The person at the front desk was very nice. The hotel was in reasonably good condition and the room was perfect. I say reasonably good because the carpet in the hallway was a bit dirty. The lobby looked very busy (Friday night 10pm). The only beef I had was parking which was 20 bucks. There is plentiful airport parking all around the hotel for about 12-14. Parking is four floors below ground and spaces are VERY limited. Drivers were circling. I only got a spot because another person was affraid to squeeze into the one I took.... Tiny spaces!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: beritarr
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and abundant. We were there for a conference and there was water, tablets, pens and mints at all the tables. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Because the reasonable rate I expected fair conditions but was pleasently surprised. The hotel is older but still very classy.

Reviews.Title: “More smiles please”
Reviews.Author: doesmeedin
Reviews.Content: No idea as to cost because the hotel was an overnight stop between flights on a package holiday. Initial impressions were good with polite front desk staff, however after checking in it went downhill. The room was large and comfortable, however, being British and having a love of tea, there was only 1 teabag in the room, when enquiring about trying to get some more, no one seemed accommodating, so had to give up on that. Also in the room there was a plug socket that was loose and we dare not use it. The TV was about the same size as the chest of drawers (old style tube) which to me showed signs of no updates to hotel for a long time. We tried the restaurant in the hotel, but wished we hadn't, and the waitress made me feel like I was an inconvenience rather than a customer We got the impression it was 'Look Glum Day', because none of the staff smiled at any time This was my first time in a Hilton hotel, and if this is the standard to expect, it will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OVERNIGHT”
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgedTravlrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at this hotel the night before leaving for a cruise from LA port. We arrived at the airport at about 10:30pm and had concerns about the frequency of the free shuttle at that hour. We were pleasantly surprised by the arrival of the shuttle after only about 5 minutes. The driver was very pleasant and friendly and dropped us conveniently at the front door of the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. The staff was helpful and room service (since we arrived late and hungry) delivered our food hot within about 1/2 hour. Our package included breakfast which was typical of the Hilton buffet: eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, fruits, breads, danish etc. All in all, a nice hotel and a great place to stop before or after your cruise. (Taxi to the cruise port was about $60 and took about 1/2 hour) Rooms were clean and comfortable. The only down side is that it is a little noisy untl about midnight with flights coming in and out of the airport. However, it IS an AIRPORT hotel, so this is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better for stay and staff here”
Reviews.Author: TassMazz
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the service and staff here. MGM Grand in Vegas need to learn something from these guys. From reception right through to table staff in the restaurant helpful and curtious staff everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Most Convenient Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the most convenient Hilton LAX hotel many times for consistently great service and convenience to LAX airport and AVIS car rental returns. As a diamond member I am frequently upgraded to my favorite corner alcove room with king bed. I usually return my car rental the night before so I can catch the morning bus to LAX for an early morning flight return to the NYC area. The hotel is also great for conferences and meetings. The club offers complimentary breakfast and evening snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Untouched since the 80s”
Reviews.Author: chocpro
Reviews.Content: Once you leave the very nice lobby you enter a world where the rooms haven't been upgraded (besides the beds which do rock) since the 80s. Tube television, formica furniture, dated soiled carpet. One day I get back in late to find out my room hadn't been cleaned, the next morning I stopped by the front desk and asked them to make sure it got cleaned. Arrived the next night to see it was now 2 days with no maid service. This time I sat in the lobby while they cleaned my room. Ate dinner one night in the restaurant since I didn't feel like going out. Big mistake. Horrendously bad food. Mushy over cooked pasta, overpowered by bitter powdered garlic. Prawns overcooked to a nice consistent chewy texture. Saw no need to complain since any 'chef' that let that food be served obviously didn't care at all. This Hilton Diamond member will never be back. It's a disgrace to the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “A decent, typical 3 star airport hotel with spacious rooms, a comfortable bed, and some minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: JBSay
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire for a very reasonable price. Overall I was pretty satisfied with my one night stay, although had I paid the full rack rate, I'd have been much less satisfied in terms of value-for-money. The king size bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and the hotel itself was in fairly good condition. A few minor complaints: the room had not been cleaned as well as it could have been (there were still noticeable water marks from the previous guest on the nightstand). The TV in my room was an old CRT (rather than a flat panel) so no HDMI input for my laptop. A slightly annoying amount of noise emanated from the hallway outside my room throughout the evening and morning, but as a Hotwire user I'm accustomed to getting rooms in subpar locations. The complimentary shuttle to LAX was painless and took about fifteen minutes (for one of the later terminals). The hotel lobby area was very busy in the morning, as was the dr+iveway in front of the hotel. A 24hr Carl's Jr is a few minutes' walk, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Nice enough hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4Ohio
Reviews.Content: I was wary after some reviews of this property, but found it to be fine. My wife and son commented that it 'smelled'. It smelled like a hotel to me. The hallway carpet and walls need a refresh. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The concierge was very helpful, although I wish he knew some routes better.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: ZosiaT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just for one night and had a really good deal through Hotwire. Very clean, nice pool and gym. There was little noise from the nearby airport, but this was to be expected. 24-h free airport shuttle was very convenient. What I didn't like was no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member my family and, I received a corner room (9th floor) and Towers concierge level privileges. The corner room was quiet and better than expected. It was clean and room temperature controls were easy to make comfortable. As for housekeeping--we had 3 in the room and it should have been obvious that we were in desperate need of shampoo, conditioner, and lotion in the midst of our stay. But we did not receive replacement bottles during her cleaning. Thankfully I had a bit of shampoo left over from my previous trip. The front desk staff was actually quite friendly and accommodating. The entire first floor was a rat race because of a conference held there, so it wasn't exactly easy to get around. Getting an elevator was crazy at times. The most disappointing aspect of our stay: Towers Level Concierge breakfast. We did pay more for a concierge level room. With that, guests should have had fully stocked breads, pastry, fruit, and juice choices. Upon our arrival, the platters were wiped out. We could have selected some wheat bread for toast and I saw 5-6 slices of cantaloupe. The orange juice pitcher had enough juice to fill 1/2 glass. We looked for a table or lounge area to wait for more food to come out, but every empty table was stacked with used dishes, etc. After about 10 minutes, the croissant platter was refilled and the orange juice was refilled, but the other platters remained empty. We moved dirty dishes and wiped the table clean ourselves so that we could sit down. This sort of experience is easily found at a budget motel, not at a concierge level service where guests have paid to be there. I found it inexcusable. If in the LAX hotel area again, I will definitely look for a different place to stay. There are many choices along Century Blvd. ALSO: a safety note---our business was 3 blocks down at the Westin Hotel. We walked there & back each day. While enroute, we did not always feel completely safe.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: BusyTrveller
Reviews.Content: The lobby and restaurant areas look very nice, but the hallways and guestroom seemed worn around the edges. Nothing seemed actually dirty, just worn. I arrived very late in the evening, and was pleased that I was able to get something to eat in the lobby at a cafe counter, which I believe is open 24 hours. There are also two sit-down restaurants on site. Service at the check-in counter and in the restaurants was good. Internet access is available, but not free. I would stay here again, but there are other hotels near LAX that I like better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service and value”
Reviews.Author: Timandra_42
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel late on a weeknight, after a very long flight. This hotel is *huge* with four interconnected towers, yet seemingly had about half the staff they should. Checking in took about a 20 minute wait in line. Then when I got to my room (finally) and got to bed, the cleaning staff started cleaning the room next to mine, which shared a connecting door. I could hear their conversation and the loud chatter of the walkie talkie. Parking is likewise a nightmare. It cost $30/day for their valet service and each and every time took about 15 mins to get the car. In an attempt to avoid the overpriced breakfast buffet (which of course isn't included), I ordered a simple sandwich and coffee from their cafe - $15! When I returned to my room, housekeeping hadn't come during the day. I called down and asked them to please come in 1 hour when I would be at dinner, but of course that was too complicated a request. The cherry on top was when they failed to put my bill under my door, causing me to have to wait in another long line to check out. When I finally got a copy of my bill, they had charged someone's $18 lunch to my room. When I told the desk clerk it wasn't mine as I was at work all day, she pointedly said "Well, I will have to get a manager to approve taking off the charge and that's going to take a while". I replied "Well, I guess I'll just have to wait" at which point she left. Argh! The room itself was reasonably clean, although the bathroom fixtures were old and there were a few stray hairs in the sink. The airplane noise was sometimes audible, but not as bad as I thought it would be and I did sleep well the two nights I was there. Overall, though, I will avoid staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the food like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Karen0211
Reviews.Content: The last stop on our world trip, My sister and I were looking forward to spending a little time in LA. We both ate a deli sandwich and coffee in the self service restaurant. The following morning we were both violently ill and this ruined our planned excursion to Hollywood. Where my sister spent every stop in the bathroom. On our return to the hotel to collect our bags en route to the airport we asked if we could have the use of a shower as my sister in particular needed to freshen up. The request was declined despite our explanation and we were told we could complain to the manager, this complaint fell on deaf ears as the manager said there was nothing he could do, Very angrily we hastened a retreat to the restroom where I assisted my sister in freshening up and changing. Not an experience we would ever wish to repeat. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: webster117
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport. Great Hilton hotel, what you would expect from the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,”
Reviews.Author: gabdy
Reviews.Content: HIlton Hotel was all lovely to look at - great service at holding bags prior to check in for us to enable us to drop car off at rental place and not have to carry luggage back to hotel. Room entry was spoilt by a hand written note stuck to the toilet saying "does not flush". A call to front desk and maintenance straight up to fix it. Room was very comfortable and no noise from planes despite being right on flight path. The biggest complaint was no free Wi-fi access,even down in common areas. All the hotels we stayed at right across USA had free access if not from room, in the lobby areas, except for this one. And another complaint - come on Hilton, $4+ for a tiny bottle of milk????? The prices in the bistro and the restaurants are way over the top and would suggest that it is much better to take the short walk down to Denny's for an evening meal. Good shuttle service to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Stop-Overs”
Reviews.Author: odyssey_1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LAX whilst enroute from Australia to Mexico. We were happy to find that the room was very comfortable, welcoming and clean. The room was a standard queen size, which we had booked for only around $80 using Hotwire. We did not expect much for this price, and would have been happy with just a comfy bed and a hot shower. The bed was very comfy, the bathroom was modern and came with lovely Crabtree & Evelyn toilettries. The hotel itself offered a selection of restaurants as well as room service. We could not fault the room in terms of cleanliness, and it was very well maintained. I would definately stay here again, and certainly recommend for anyone wanting to stay close by LAX. The courtesy shuttle from LAX is fabulous too. The hotel definately does have noise from the airport, but this has to be expected from an airport hotel. It didn't bother us, but if you are a very light sleeper you may need ear plugs. Check-in staff were very friendly and helpful, as were the bell staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works!!!”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: I normally wouldn't write a review about a hotel I spent such little time in but this is outrageous! The check in was fast and easy but that's the only good thing! The TV doesn't allow you to watch movies or TV! The phone has the bottons to allow you to connect to room service ect but none of the bottons work! The TV and thermostat are both from 15 years ago and most of the people I called to fix these issues either didn't give a crap or were totally clueless as what to do! The hotel is so cheap the rooms don't have mini bars! I highly recommend you never stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FinnishGirl83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while on a layover. I knew staying in an airport hotel in L.A. was very practical while being a tourist, because you have to travel anyways to the attractions and you have to be sure you wonÂ´t be late from your flight. This hotel was very good value for money, as it was affordable even to medium budget travelers. The rooms were practical and yet charming. The bed was very comfortable -- I canÂ´t remember where I have slept in a better bed. The pillows and blankets were stuffed with feathers--to which IÂ´m allergic--so the housekeeping lady came to change them even though it was midnight. It was very easy to book a tour, as the bell desk took care of the reservation. There was a souvenir shop in the hotel from which you could also buy some snacks and water. The only con was that the restaurants because they werenÂ´t open when we wanted to eat at 3 oÂ´clock.-- the restaurants wouldnÂ´t serve meals before 5 pm. It was only the bistro that was open. We had to go to the next-door CarlÂ´s jr. instead. The staff was very friendly--the staff of the bell desk and reception, not to mention the housekeeping and maintenance staff. We had an evening flight so we got a two-hour extention for charge, which was unbelievable. After giving our keys away, we got to keep our luggage in the lobby for no charge and went last-minute sunbathing to the outdoor pool area. This hotel had a cosy and friendly atmosphere largely due to the incredible staff. In fact, I fell in love with the Hilton, so after this itÂ´s hard to believe I ever want to stay in any other hotel than the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exhausted travelers”
Reviews.Author: GCF3060
Reviews.Content: Our flight to Las Vegas from Connecticut was cancelled, and we were rerouted to LA for the night until our early-morning flight to Vegas. The airline put us up in the Hilton by LAX, and it couldn't have been better for our needs-- to sleep for a couple hours and clean ourselves up before flying out again. Check-in was a breeze: We picked up a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, spent about two minutes at the front desk checking in, and the guy who helped us was incredibly nice and helpful finding us stuff to do to kill time. The beds were so comfortable, however, that we crashed the minute our heads hit the pillow. We weren't there for more than a few hours so I can't judge the hotel's amenities past what we experienced, but we got everything we needed: comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, helpful service, free shuttle. It was the perfect place to just pass the time until our next flight, I couldn't have asked for a better hotel for what we were there for.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel. Ask for room not facing the airport”
Reviews.Author: rockyviewmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Dec (28-31) because we'd visit Getty villa and Getty center. We bidded it from priceline at 55USD/night. This hilton is rated as 3.5* under priceline. I'd say its lobby looks like 4 star. Its room is 3 star or lower. It is very close to the airport runaway. We asked for room not facing the airport and we did not hear anything noise from plane taking off. Actually, parking is not an issue if you book parking through LAX airport online. I booked 3 nights at Marriott for 9.9USD/night. I booked it one night each not 3 nights altogether. Marriott is only 100m away from Hitlon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfect Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: kelownacruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice around Christmas after/before transpacific flights. We are Hilton Honours Silver members and we got upgraded to a nice tower room. The room was fine and the service was great. The breakfast buffet is very good too. The shuttle is hugely convenient and the Carls Jr is right around the corner if you don't want to eat in the hotel. The airplane views are really great too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No parking!!”
Reviews.Author: runlolaLebanon
Reviews.Content: There are only two reaons to stay in a hotel by the airport: early flight or to get free parking, and we didn't have any of the two! we got our room, again, through priceline, we chose the airport area because we were sure that we won't have any problems with having free parking. To our surprise, the hotel parking was $24 (and it was full anyway) and the nearby parking was $19.50, that just ruined our mood. The lobby of the hilton is nice and clean, the rooms are nice, clean, and the coffee served was Lavazza (love it). Our intial room had two beds and I asked for one king bed, and the front desk changed it immediatly. The next day we moved to the doubletree which was only couple of blocks away, and it had free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't bother again”
Reviews.Author: Wicked00
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on our way from LV to NYC, but I wouldn't bother again. The welcome was luke warm and the room was nothing special. The room service was average. We discovered after about 1/2 in the room, and after turning the TV off, that the window was leaking (it was raining). This was a big 'drip drip' leak and obviously was not a new leak as the carpet and walls were soaking. I think they expected us to ignore it but we were finally moved into another room - very late at night. I am really disappointed in this place and if this is the attitude of most Hilton Hotels I won't bother staying with any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing for such an established name!”
Reviews.Author: MonopolySlots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Travelled with husband & 3 kids. Didn't have adjoining rooms, but were next door to each other. My room's bathroom room; shower didn't work, the plug in bath didn't work and black grit came out of bath tap. Asked to be moved..obviously wanted to stay next door at least to other room rented. Got moved up to another floor, my key didn't work for my room, no one could get in. So told to wait in another room. Then were told that through our hassle we were getting a large suit so we can all be together....got there, was the same size (2 small double beds) as the previous room. Then we had to wait to be moved again. This all took about an hour and a half (about 8/9pm). This was the 2nd night of our stay, exhausted with our 5 yr asleep, carrying her and lugging all our suitcases from one room/floor to another....never got an apology!! In the "new" room....again, the plug in the bath didn't work and the water was very slow coming out of the shower!! Not impressed at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: kellycm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton LAX for two nights for business. Was not impressed by any aspect of the hotel but it works if you need to stay by the airport on something of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere if you are diamond”
Reviews.Author: perthguy6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel overnight after a long trip from Australia, the kids were exhausted but were very excited to see a gingerbread house in the lobby for Xmas. Check in was easy at the Honors desk and internet details were sorted so I could get on upon reaching the room. The room was nothing special and we headed down to the Executive lounge for Canapes and drinks. They were renovating the lounge so we headed to a small conference room with food all over tables and the poorest choice of nibbles I have ever seen from a Hilton and drinks I had to pay for. When questioning what was happening the staff advised that if I didnt know the economy is bad in the states and they have cut out the services to Diamond members hence no free drinks and food you wouldnt want to eat in a tiny little room with too many VALUED CLIENTS to handle. I left in disgust and had to go there in the morning for our COMPLIMENTARY breakfast, after looking at the line out of the sqalid room and watching Diamond members trying to eat cereal standing up I went to the front desk and complained. There I ran into a lovely lady who gave me vouchers to the buffet and also printed out my boarding passes while I ate breakie. I cant remember her name but Hilton should give her a pay rise or she should move to a hotel where they look after staff and guests! You would figure if the economy is bad you would want to look after your repeat customers!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SJHOK
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly satisfied with our accommodations, parking, and airport shuttle. We also enjoyed the restauarant facilities in the hotel. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess”
Reviews.Author: luxurytax
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! And the staff are a bunch of high school kids that could care less about customer service. The parking is a sub level labrinyth. confusing, frustrating, and inconvienient! The room was ols and worn down, they have tube televisions and feel and smell damp. Im accustomed to housekeeping speaking little english, but none at all was a first... thanks Hilton! The bathroom is not appointed well and VERY small. I booked the room for $57 and totally see why! The bed ironically was quite comfy and the linend clean. I stayed for 6 days and only had my room cleaned twice. both were because i requested it. Then when it was completed they failed to empty the trash both times.... DONT STAY HERE. THEY DONT CARE ..THE GM DOESNT EVEN READ OR RESPOND TO RANTS RAVES COMPLIMENTS

Reviews.Title: “Nip Tuck?”
Reviews.Author: jetalcott
Reviews.Content: Have you ever run into someone who you knew in their youth, but had not seen for some years? That's how I felt about my recent stay at the the Hilton LAX. I still recognised the vibrant hotel I once knew, but could see its age, the years having taken their toll. I must say that the spirit was still there. The staff were fantastic; friendly, helpful and considerate. But the signs of age were hard to miss. The rooms felt tired. Old fixtures, large boxy CRT televisions, no mini bar and an "oldish" phone. Some of the floors (the pool level) had a lingering cigarette smoke odour. As with many hotels, like the Hilton, it seems the more you pay for a room, the more you'll be asked to pay for extras. Internet? $13.00 a day (even if you get 7 days as a package). A warm soft drink from the machine in the hall? $3.00. Park your car? $20.00 a day. Print a colour page from the computer? About $5.00. Of course, all these things don't make the hotel bad. I'd stay again. It's location is great. Service is top notch and the rooms are comfortable. The weight room is modern and large. And the outdoor pool and spas are heated. The water pressure in the bathroom showers was surprising refreshing! If there is a water shortage anywhere in the Western USA, I'd look to the Hilton as a possible cause. The hotel is relatively well soundproofed, although you will know when planes are taking off if your room is located on the East-facing side. So, like an old friend, you can forgive some of the lines around the eyes. But it may be time for the Hilton LAX to "have some work done". They are in L.A. after all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, getting a bit rundown”
Reviews.Author: wombat18
Reviews.Content: In the six years since I last stayed at this Hilton, things have slipped a little. The carpets are a bit stained, the elevators a bit banged around, the doors chipped and scuffed, the plywood looking a bit dated, and the staff distracted. I guess this is what happens in a high-traffic hotel, but it is nevertheless disappointing. Pro's: 24 shuttle service from airport, calm decor, good dining options, and spacious lobby. Con's: Expensive on-site parking, expensive food options for an airport hotel, high-traffic facility, current temporary executive lounge is abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX - Good stay”
Reviews.Author: tomfrench
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and for an airport hotel I had a great sleep, great service, good food fast easy check in, busses to and from the terminals ever couple minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and not worth the $15 upgrade to "tower"”
Reviews.Author: KarenB_007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I had a conference in the same hotel. Had just come from another conference where I stayed at for $70/nite at a LaQuinta about 2 blocks away and frankly I preferred the La Quinta for service and value. Not quite sure what it is about the "brand name hotels" that requires you to pay more for the room and then pay again for everything on top of that. Want to dial a local call or a 1-800 $2 to start and then another charge per minute. Want the internet - pay $12 something per day. Want one stamp from the convience store on site for a letter - no problem but you can only buy in packs of 2 and for almost double stamp face value. No fridge. No microwave. The shower was worse then the one at La Quinta... the bed however was definately better as was the view. Hint for you all though, be sure you are not given a room ending in the 01-02-03 range on any floor here or you will be beside the nexus center of all wings of the hotel for laundry chute, garbage and housekeeping which means lots of doors, clanging, noise and social chatting early morning - late afternoon. Night was okay... I did mention the bed was nice though right ? The thing that really pissed me off though this stay is I got an email after my initial reservation asking me if I was willing to accept an upgrade at time of arrival if available. Sure. Nicer room, view and free executive lounge access. So I arrive, its my lucky day, I get the upgrade but then Im told that the executive lounge is closed for renovation on my floor and a temporary one is on floor 2. I ask if I can pull out from the deal as that isnt what I signed up for. Nope - its too late. Whatever. The "special room" seems just like everyone elses room - nicer headboard but not sure what else ? The view was definitely stunning. Full marks for that but Im at a conference - I get to look out of it for 1 min in the morning and 1 min in the evening before bed.. so the real upgrade, was for me all about the executive lounge access. But the temporary "executive lounge" turns out to be a small meeting room with zero ambience and far too small for the number of people using it. Routinely people are standing up to eat or just leaving and eating somewhere outside of the room as there is no available table space. Breakfast is fine - bread, pastry, cereal, fruit and hard boiled eggs (LaQuinta's was far better!!!). But the evening snacks were a problem. Although advertising as available 5- 7pm they routinely were emptied out early on and there was little to no interest by staff to request refills so night after night I arrived to bare cupboards with nothing left to eat at all .... Frankly, I just dont get it. Although many were in the lounge for free as part of their points reward system... I PAID FOR THIS and I simply didnt get what I paid for.. in fairness though - at 7 they would bring out desserts and they were usually to die for and extremely yummie... but... I usually dont eat desserts ... I wanted food ! So at the end of the day what the "upgrade" turned out to be (after taxes) was $17.10/day for a hardboiled egg, toast and fruit for breakfast... not a particularly good deal... one would hope things are better than this when the lounge renovations are completed....but in the mean time.. not worth the upgrade... The conference facilities were nice and the lobby area of the hotel is very homey with lots of places to sit and mingle. The rooms are okay. Nothing bad but nothing to die for. Too noisy for my liking but that was room location...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, POOR exec lounge and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I had a late arrival into LAX and decided to stay here that night and get my rental car and drive to the city for the remainder of my stay. The wait was only about a minute for the shuttle at LAX (as well as leaving the hotel the following morning) and there was no line at all at the HHhonors check in (it was around 11 pm. though). I was given the free internet password with my key without asking which is always nice at a hilton property. They told me I had a third floor upgrade but then told me that room wasn't available and put me on the fourth floor. Wasn't a big deal since I was only going to be there 12 hours but would have been if it was an extended stay. Room was nice sized and clean.
