The free breakfast is in their executive lounge which is just a conference room (I think they are redoing the exec lounge and this room is temporary). It was only open until 10 a.m. and at night so there is no place for things like bottled water, diet coke, etc during the day (again no big deal since I left at 11 a.m.). there was an employee checking room key holders to make sure only authorized guests went in and this guy was very friendly. The breakfast /exec lounge was my complaint I had with this hotel. It was a conference room and every table top had stained table clothes on it. The selection of items was poor (I wish they would have just given out vouchers for the main restaraunt) and the "attendant" working in the lounge just sat there and didn[t speak to any of the guest or offer to clear off plates, etc. If you want a hiltonproperty close to the airport for just one night this is a good location. If you are looking for a property to stay for a few days I wouldn't recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: CamillaP
Reviews.Content: We spent at Hilton LAX 3 nights and it was great. Big and beautiful rooms, free heated swimmingpool, free self laudry, nice people, ... It's 5 minutes away from the airport and there's a 24/7 bus service (free) from and to the airport; this means that once you're at the hotel and you want to visit the city, you can go to the airport, catch a bus to Main Station and from there you decide (it takes a while, but this is the con of being at the airport). The consierge is very good at giving advice and very very helpful. I would raccomend this hotel to anyone who is staying in LA for a few days, doesn't want to spend very much and wants a welcoming situation.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the Airport”
Reviews.Author: BigBruv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice recently either end of a cruise. Excellent location for the airport with a free shuttle service, the rooms were clean,comfortable and spacious. We turned up early both times and went straight to our rooms when expecting to have to wait. Managed to get VIP tours direct from the hotel to Universal Studios and also did the LA city tour both very good although one driver did overdo it a bit about relying on tips for a living. Also caught a local bus to a shopping mall very easily. Restaurant meals were very average and not cheap, found better value and taste at the Denny's 5 mins walk down the road.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Travelfanatic033
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at, and enjoyed, a short stay at a Hilton Garden Inn, I thought I would be quite safe spending a week at the Hilton LAX. Not so. From arrogant, unfriendly and wanna-be unhelpful front desk staff to rude bell hops to housekeeping staff who did not know sufficient English to understand my requests, the stay was just one unpleasant experience after another. (The security staff were, without exception, friendly and helpful though.) My initial impression of the rooms I was in was of dark, and a faint smell that I finally identified as smoky. The bathrooms were tiny and uncomfortable, given the star rating of the hotel, and I certainly expected better space in the room itself. Although the nightly rate is good, once you're at the hotel, everything costs. Local phone calls, refrigerators, laundry etc. all cost far more than other hotels of similar class. And they don't even necessarily work properly: the fridge in the first room that I had froze everything that I put in it. Although the website does state that there is a smoking floor in the hotel, it does not indicate that non-smokers on other floors will still be required to share the smoking experience in the form of smelly bed linen. The towels in the bathroom stank of old kitchen oil. Having asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel, I was given a room on the floor that serves the airline trade. Apparently the staff were doing me a favour by giving me a room 2 hours ahead of the usual check-in time (I had been travelling all night and was tired of falling asleep in the lobby). But until midnight, I had to listen to knocking on doors and 'Housekeeping', 'Housekeeping' calls. I eventually asked for a different room and was given one on a quieter floor. My booking was for a room with a king-size bed at a specific rate. At check in, I was told that this was my preference only, and that it was subject to availability. First I've heard of this. Most insulting of all, however, are the constant reminders around the hotel to please rate them a 10 out of 10. This extends as far as separate boxes at the check in desk to drop your room keys in: one if you rate the hotel above an 8, and the other for less than 8. The final bill that is slipped in under the door also has a long discourse about rating the hotel favourably. No surprises which box my keys went into. I will certainly do everything I can in the future to avoid staying in a Hilton-affiliated hotel. There are better hotel chains around.

Reviews.Title: “good AirPort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Royalfalcon1
Reviews.Content: convenient Location with good Shuttle Connection. Friendly Staff good Restaurant. clean and convenient rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: robinpark
Reviews.Content: Good location near the airport, with a convenient shuttle service. Hotel is satisfactory, and has everything you need at a good price. Restaurant breakfast was average, but the added bonus of a Starbucks coffee shop with deli in the lobby was a good alternative. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn rooms at Hilton prices”
Reviews.Author: Neversaidnever
Reviews.Content: Sadly, you're trapped at LAX as all the hotels are of a similar price. Having missed a flight and forced to stay over, I took the first shuttle bus to the Hilton, looking forward to a decent night for $169+++++++tax etc. What I (and everyone else) gets is a Holiday Inn calibre room. No stocked mini bar, no flat screen TV, view of the walls of the next building and amazingly overpriced food - Room service for a 12in plain cheese pizza (terrible), 2 Budweissers and a V&T was almost $50. The place is fine, the staff are friendly but it is absolutely NOT worthy of the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBlonde323
Reviews.Content: The Hilton LAX is a great place! We found it at 2am after we ended up in a bind at a pretty bad hotel downtown. The staff was super nice and even though we ended up checking in super late, they still let us sign up for room service for breakfast that was delivered at 8am!! Great place to stay - worth the money for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, comfort and consistency.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnTheMove_5
Reviews.Content: The Hilton LAX offers this and so much more. Convenient to the airport, freeways, beaches and downtown this hotel is in the perfect location. From enterning the lobby, to having a pint in the pub, to a meal in the restaurant and to relaxing in your room the entire property is comfortable. I have stayed at this hotel many, many times over the years and the service is consistently fabulous. All of the staff, especially Ava, one of the managers, and Ricardo, at the Concierge Lounge, are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl6570
Reviews.Content: The room appears to be nice and clean. The bed is clean and comfortable. Had some odd issues...the shower tends to control itself, as in gets warmer and the handle has to be reset a few times during the shower so as not to scald yourself (this is the 2nd room here with months apart where this happened)...housekeeping took it upon themselves to dispose of my hanger/dry cleaning plastic although it was left hanging so that I could use it to repack the next day....the sink takes all night to drain. I actually found the front desk and hertz desk to be very nice - unlike my first stay months ago. Great for the early am flights back to the east coast!

Reviews.Title: “Always comfortable, good service and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: KayL49
Reviews.Content: Booked online, great room, quick check in, shuttle to and from airport. Comfortable, well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Fitness Room”
Reviews.Author: catwoman00
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, just about ready for a facelift to the decor. Stayed twice in October, both times 10th floor and above that has internet access in the room. The room itself is fairly ordinary and the bathroom is a bit small. But it is clean, and smells clean. Lobby is pretty, food choices are not bad - they have a bar, a coffee shop, and a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: captainbeaky30
Reviews.Content: not the greatest hotel in the world but certainly not the worst. Good points are that it is very handy for that early morning flight out of LAX, there is a free shuttle bus and their concierges/ room staff are excellent. Rooms are typical Hilton and clean. Bad points are that some of the front desk staff could take a lesson in customer service from their room staff. Also there is very little to do in the area in respect of bars or restaurants so you are stuck with the limited choice and expensive choices at the Hilton. Finally the worst aspect to this hotel is the VIP facility. It is completely worthless. What is the point of accruing Hilton loyalty points or paying for an upgrade when all it entitles you to is a lounge with a few nibbles and soft drinks. Unlike the Hiltons in Europe - this one makes you pay $9 for a bottle of beer. I always thought that a complimentary drink in a Hilton lounge was a nice touch after you had spent so much money with the chain. This hotel thinks different and i dont think i'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “a family should never be put in smoking rooms.”
Reviews.Author: keza1_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night as our flight had been cancelled. We were put up at this Hilton Hotel. Walk in to the foyer , beautiful, walk in to our two suites and you would think you were in a differnt Hotel! We had two rooms. Both rooms 3104 and 3105 were smoking rooms?! They absolutely stunk of smoke. Adults and certainly not children should be put in these rooms. When we checked in we were not told we would be given rooms on a smoking floor, there is no way we would put our children in a smoking room. We didn't want to be there, I have never smelt anything so bad in my whole life. When we left Our cases of clean clothes all stunk like the room did. In New Zealand you would be had up for child abuse for putting your children in this environment. Not acceptable! The walls and carpet on this floor were old discoloured and definitely drenched in smoke fumes. Wall paper peeling off the wall in 3105. We did complain to reception, they just said well that's all we have. If it hadn't have been after 11pm we would have shifted our family of 6 elsewhere. The next night we stayed at the Westin down the road, their rooms are far superior. I think Management need to sleep in room 3105 for a night and perhaps they might then want to put their family in there...... I don't think they would last the night! We stayed at five Hotels in the USA and yours is the only one I would never stay in again! Your Hilton San Diego Liberty Station is fantastic, I give them a 10 out of 10. May be you should take a leaf out of their book. Don't ever put families in that situation, they deserve much better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for airport”
Reviews.Author: silvertravellers_10
Reviews.Content: Good shuttle bus pick up and check in by very pleasant staff for our 2 night stay. Huge room and bed. Yes there is some noise from the airport but it is an airport hotel! Couple of eating places nearby and bus stop for Santa Monica just outside. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey1107
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. Our room was on the 16th floor and the view was spectacular. The morning breakfast and evening reception was also great - more than anyone expected. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jkyon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tastefully decorated and neat and clean! I love Hilton beds because they are so comfortable... although the Las Vegas Hilton had even more comfortable beds that the one at LAX. The staff were courteous and polite. Worked out in the gym and was also able to print airline boarding passes for free! Only thing missing was a refridgerator. Bathrooms could certainly use a makeover.. would be better if they were larger and had nice tubs/showers with granite etc. Overall, had a very positive experience and loved the energy and central location, along with free shuttle service to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: Meganl003
Reviews.Content: swimming pool, jacuzzi and more.,, i had fun with my baby love it!

Reviews.Title: “OK but pretty stingy”
Reviews.Author: RelentlessTraveller2
Reviews.Content: For a name hotel charging a higher rate I was surprised at what was NOT included here. The parking is $20 p'day. We had no bar refrigerator in our room and they wanted $25p'day for one! (After complaining we got it free). The newspaper is charged for daily? 75cents - really? You couldn't throw that in? Complimentary small water bottles were provided only once in our 4 day stay even though the room rate was the same each day. Stingy!. The room we booked wasn't the room we got. We booked a Queen room and got a room with two double beds. (After complaining we got upgraded to a King room). The room was comfortable, large and a comfortable bed and good bathroom. The restaurants downstairs are pretty average. Go out to eat. Go to Manhattan Beach or Venice for good food and good prices. And the bistro has a Starbucks which was rated by our conference as the worst coffee ever. Pale weak coffee spewed out from an automated machine by grumpy European backpacker staff. Lift your game Hilton. Won't stay here again till I hear better stories.

Reviews.Title: “pick somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: LiznRichard
Reviews.Content: What a disaster! We booked separate rooms for ourselves and then another for the kids - and paid for the upgrades. But we got the room where a group of men were partying in the interconnecting room - and the non soundproof door. Then, about midnight, alarms went off and we were woken from our fitful doze (it was a good party next door) Then for the next half hour a voice over on the phone reassured us it was a false alarm. Terrific. We got it. And all after a 13 hour night flight from Australia, facing another 5 hour flight in the morning to Boston. Restful? Refreshing? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend for short stay or stop over”
Reviews.Author: thelawsons_nz
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for one night on Sunday 3rd October. We chose to stay near LAX as we had been in Anaheim over the weekend and had a morning flight to our next destination and didn't want to risk the LA morning rush our traffic between Anaheim and LAX. After reading all the reviews of LAX area hotels (they all seemed of a similar standard and price) we took a chance and booked on Hotwire.com and got the Hilton for $59 for the night. Check in was busy - a tour bus arrived at the same time we did and all the check in staff seemed to be attending to the tour bus - ourselves and 4 other guests had to wait 15mins for service. Not great - one of the 3 check in staff could have helped the non-tour bus people. The hotel is clean and comfortable. We had room on the 8th floor facing the LAX run way. With the curtains opened we enjoyed watching the evening flights come and go. The rooms have quite heavy curtains so once closed it did muffle the sounds of the runway significantly. We had no trouble getting to sleep and slept soundly. The beds and bedding are good quality and comfortable. The pool is open until 10pm and has four surrounding whirlpools which are nice to relax in. The only thing I would watch out for is the Valet - $30 per day! Overall I would recommend this hotel for a short stay or a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Third floor= more space and freedom to smoke”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near LAX airport. If you are a smoker, then I recommend the third floor rooms that open to a large courtyard where you can enjoy a cigarette or even the open air. Their executive lounge has a breathtaking view of the LAX runways and its bustling takeoffs and landings. Also the availability of self check-in kiosks at the lobby is a plus if you want to bypass queues. The colours chosen for room interiors are very smooth and relaxing so is their beds. However, their courtesy bus frequency to LAX airport needs to be increased.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff let down by noise and poor heating”
Reviews.Author: loumcd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister after a long haul flight. Check in was smooth and staff were friendly. We pre-booked an executive suite so expected a very good room. It was huge with massive windows and great beds and spotlessly clean. Unfortunately it was really cold in the room and the heating system did not work properly. Additionally during the night there was a lot of noise from the pipes - clearly the system is antiquated - it sounded like there was a poltergeist in the building! This resulted in a very poor nights sleep - not great for the jet lag! We ordered room service, which was prompt and the food was delicious. We ate breakfast in the restaurant the next morning and the staff were lovely although the food was average and over-priced. Overall we were somewhat disappointed with the Hilton LAX and would try one of the other hotels in the vicinity if we stayed at LAX again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluecheez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton LAX with my wife and son for a few days before flying to Hawaii and again after returning before our flight back to the UK. We had a rental car and used the valet service which we found to be efficient, our bags were unloaded and taken to our room by friendly staff. The lobby was very busy as you would expect of a airport hotel, but we got checked in quickly thanks to a dedicated HH desk. The checkin desk staff were fantastic and made us feel very welcome. We had a top floor room which was a good size and very clean, although the decor is a bit dated. The beds are of the usual Hilton standard, very comfortable. We used the executive level lounge for breakfast which was good and plentiful. It does get busy and can be difficult to find a seat. There is a good view of the airport from here also. There are some nice restaurants in the lobby and a nice bar area too which we took advantage of after tiring days touring the sights. We had used room service late one evening and it arrived within the estimated time. Very nice and refreshing too. There aren't any room safes but there is a secure area by the check in desk with saftey deposit boxes which are free to use. Overall we had two pleasant stays at the Hilton LAX and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate as an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at the Hilton LAX before an early morning flight. I arrived in the late evening and was checked in quickly by a very friendly front desk agent. The room was purchased through Priceline so I wasn't able ot collect Hilton Honors points on the stay but the front desk agent added my Hhonors number so I could collect points on my incidental costs. My room was clean, decent sized and pleasantly furnished with modern furniture. The washroom was adequately sized, with two sets of towels and basic free Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. Shower pressure was strong on my high floor, though it took a minute for the hot water to come through. Internet was about $11 to 13 a night, though I didn't purchase it. The early morning shuttle was prompt and quick. I've stayed in other LAX hotels and they didn't have the same shuttle frequency. It did clearly hear the airplanes taking off but it wasn't enough to disturb sleep. Drinks in the hotel lounge are expensive but my cocktail was free poured and more than just a standard one drink serving. One small quirk I learned was that some of the entrees served in the lounge are just Stouffers frozen entrees that you can purchase in any supermarket. Also, the beverages in the express cafe are priced high even by an airport hotel standards --$5.75 for an orange juice? I stay in a lot of Hilton hotels and am a Diamond member of Hilton Honors. It was just a coincidence that I won a Hilton on Priceline and I wasn't treated any differently from booking on Priceline vs purchasing the lowest possible rate on the Hilton website. The hotel easily meets the service standard of being a 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport stop hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Undercover
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel this ticked all the right boxes. I was only staying one night. Arrived to a warm welcome having taken the shuttle from Terminal B. Given a nice room on the 14th floor. Good choice of places to grab food or drink within the hotel. All the staff I came in to contact with were friendly and helpful. They even allowed me to extend my check-out the following day until 4pm!

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel, Plesant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: Arrived at LAX Hilton very early, front desk staff was very helpful. I waited short time to get a room. Hotel lobby is large and pleasant. I was at hotel for one night but the service was excellent. All questions were answered in a professional and friendly manner. My room was clean and even smelled refreshed. Hotel has a shuttle to and from hotel, runs about every 20 minutes. There is a Kiosk in the lobby to print your boarding pass. There are more than one restaurant in the hotel. I did not get a chance to eat at any of them. You can also arrange for a tour from the hotel. The tour service is VIP tours, with city tours, Universal City tours, etc. The tour shuttle picks up from hotel and returns you back. There is a cost for internet service at hotel. I did not use the business center. Pleasant stay and would stay at hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! If you like getting nickel and dimed to death!”
Reviews.Author: Chilipal
Reviews.Content: This was probably the worst Hilton I've ever stayed at. Small rooms, tiny bathrooms, HORRIBLE parking and way too much security presence. Parking $20, Internet $12.95, Evian water $6.50. Save your money and stay somewhere else no matter how cheap you find it on Hotwire or priceline. The rooms don't even have flat screen TV's... Very surprised that a Hilton in LA would be so average. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy and Free airport shuttle - A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: rbtravel
Reviews.Content: Hilton was exactly as expected...clean, good service and convienient location. We stayed 1 night and were able to extend our checkout from 11am till 6pm for only $50.00 We found the room to be very comfy, however the bathrooms were'nt great - clean and did the job but they were tiny, and considering how much unused space there was in the room this seemed very strange! The hotel opperates a free airport shuttle, every 20 mins or so. This was excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful - we told him we wanted to do something cheap for the day and he recomended the trolley to Manhattan beach. I highly recommend this. The trolley leaves on a loop every 30mins from just outside the hotel (about 1 min walk) and is only USD$5.00 for the whole day. It took us to Manhattan beach. Where the bus stops there are lots of beauty salons and boutique shops. There was a really cool old fashioned ice cream store also. The Beach looked nice. We didnt go in the water, but there were heaps of people at the beach. The trolley also takes you to 2 different shopping centres. We only stopped at the first one, Manhattan shopping village. It was pretty small, It had Macy's and then a few other stores, but quite a few restaurants. We went to a place called Islands - which was kind of Hawaiian themed, but the food was good and 2 of us had a full meal each for under $10 p/p. We very much enjoyed our stay here, and if we were stopping over in LAX for a night again I'd stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very nice hotel and right at LAX.”
Reviews.Author: teford
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice fitness room, convenient location, and is on the whole very clean and upscale. The beds were very comfortable, and made for a great nights sleep. The only downside is that parking is a bit overpriced for hotel guests, but such is life in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Really knows what Customer Service truely is”
Reviews.Author: Robertd346
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, sister-in-law and brother-in-law, were planning a cruise down to the Mexican Riviera, celebrating our 30th anniversary. We arrived in Los Angeles a day prior to boarding the cruise ship and spent the evening at the Hilton Los Angeles. Everything was going wonderfully. We checked in, hung a few clothes in the closet, called our niece who lives in the LA area to join us for dinner, had a night cap, and then bedded down for the night. The next morning we packed up, checked out, got all our luggage loaded up and headed out to the cruise terminal at Long Beach. So far, so good, right? Well, after checking in for the cruise, once in our stateroom, we started to unpack and put everything away for a wonderful week at sea. Upon opening our suitcases, I start wondering where my suit was? Where were my wifeâ€™s dresses which were hanging up? All my dress shirts, and dress slacks? After the panic subsides, I start retracing our steps in an attempt to figure out when I last saw them. I realized I hung them up in our room back at the Hilton so they would stay pressed and fresh. I now realize, I had forgotten all about them and left them hanging in the closet in our room at the hotel. After some prior bad experiences with my wife leaving some clothes at the Hilton in Pensacola, FL, which we never received back, I was certain these would be gone by the time we returned from our week long cruise. We didnâ€™t have much time from when we disembarked off the cruise ship to make our return flight back to DFW, so we did not get the opportunity to call, let alone stop back by the LAX Hilton. Again, more reason to believe the clothes were gone for sure. But I want to tell you, I was very pleasantly surprised when we got back home and I called about the missing clothes. From the front desk personnel who said Security would be the place to check, to the Security personnel who had them and once I gave my room number and date of stay, he knew right where they were. I would like to give the Housekeeping person doing up the room to everybody else involved right down to the Security person who mailed the clothes back to us, the biggest thank-you. If there were some way for you to track down the individuals involved and provide them with some form of recognition, you should really do that. It is employees like these that provide the right kind of customer experience. We too frequently focus on individuals only when they do something wrong. If we focused on their positive practices, the positive experiences would continue to multiply. I know that I will be choosing to stay at a Hilton hotel when provided the opportunity. If I have a choice, and believe me I do, your hotel is the place for me. Thank you again for listening and having such a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flight cancelled put up in the hilton”
Reviews.Author: Missy_Aussie
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop before a long haul flight so we were seeking a quiet relaxing hotel. Free shuttle to and from LAX made the trek convenient, however there was a long wait for the shuttle from LAX. Incorrect directions from staff to catch the shuttle were also frustrating as we missed it because we were waiting in the wrong place even though we were told it would pick us up from the spot we were in. We were then bumped from our flight and stayed here again for a second night. a full A380 was put up in the hilton and they only had 4 staff on. Considering they were propbably unprepared for masses (480 people) that walked in they coped pretty well and put on a full buffet for all passengers. Most people waited between 1-2 hr to check in but i assure you this is a likely once off (unless your flight gets cancelled too) Rooms were clean, big enough (bathroom is a little small) and definately quiet, considering how close it is to the airport. If you want to do anything other than just stay at the airport this isnt the area to do it. Theres nothing around other than some hotels and the airport. The trolley to manhattan shopping centre & manhattan beach is a bit of a joke, might be easier to grab a cab or stay somewhere closer.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JulesBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night before travelling to San Deigo. Never stayed in a Hilton before but expected good things. The lobby is lavish and makes a good first impression. Howver, our room was disappointing. Small and basic. It does have a restaurant but it is expensive. The only other place to eat is a burger bar just down the road. I expected better from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortbale and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Holidayguy70
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the moment we boarded the courtesy bus from LAX right through to the moment we sadly had to check out. The staff were very welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Lovely heated pool and 4 hot tubs on level 3. Very comfortable room. Plenty of amenities. Minimal noise from airport despite close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel, Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastTravelr
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute reservation here for a 7 day park and fly (one-night) stay, and then paid for a couple extra nights of parking at a very reasonable rate. It is a beautiful, high-quality hotel with a nice interior and very clean rooms. There was a bit of confusion on our arrival... when asked, we were told by a bellman standing outside that we should immediately pull into the garage for our stay, park and fly package rather than temporarily park outside the lobby to register and unload our bags. Well, that wasn't quite correct, and we were faced with having to try and carry all our bags through the garage and take an elevator four floors up to the lobby from the parking garage. We decided to leave our bags in the car and check in first... and the front desk was very apologetic when we asked for a bell cart. They sent a bellman all the way down into the parking garage with us to help with the rest of our bags we'd left in the car. They recovered very well from this oversight. We felt completely safe and very taken care of here. A few things to note: the garage ceilings are VERY low.... our Ford Explorer barely made it to the regular parking spaces. There is a sign that states if you have a high profile car, you will have to use the valet parking. Food in the restaurant and cafe is a bit pricey, but there are plenty of choices to be had. They offer complimentary printing of boarding passes in the lobby, which was great! We had no problems catching their free shuttle to the airport at 8AM, but when we returned to the hotel, it seemed the outbound airport shuttle had at least a 30-40 minute wait. Plan appropriately to get to the airport on time during busy shuttle hours. There is an outdoor pool on one of the upper levels, but it's quite small and of course there's lots of airliner noise to contend with. Still, it's a great place for kids to burn off a little steam... and they have four hot tubs surrounding the pool, which is great for parents. You can keep an eye on your kids in the pool while getting a little relaxation yourself. All in all, I'd highly-recommended this hotel if you need to stay near the airport for a flight in or out.

Reviews.Title: “OK. Not great, not awful”
Reviews.Author: tywwia
Reviews.Content: It's a Hilton, a bit older than some. I notice that it was supposedly renovated, but I am not sure I saw too many signs of that. All in all, for $130, it was not a bad value, but not anything I would write home about either, if I was going to write home about an airport hotel in the first place. The room looked nice and was clean, as was the small bathroom. The bed was comfortable, and the AC worked. So it certainly accomplished all that was necessary. The elevators seemed small and slow, and the hallways were a bit dreary - they really helped identify the hotel as "old". Of course, you don't stay in the hall, so that's not a big deal. I was not happy with the wet carpet which I discovered when I went down the hall in my socks to get ice. I *hope* it was water. Check-in went quickly (though I noticed a lonnnnnnng line to check out the next morning.) The business center is pay-for-everything, including printing and internet, with a $3.00 minimum. Kind of nickle-and-dime for a good hotel... Room Service was fast, but rather expensive ($37 for a personal pizza and a house salad, no drink). The pizza was OK, the salad was good. Self-Parking was not great - small spots, tight turns. But I found a spot pretty quickly both times I entered.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and works well for park and fly”
Reviews.Author: Nitepainter
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, room was very nice and the extended park and fly program worked well for us. The airport shuttle was easy to catch both coming and going to LAX. Except for the front desk clerk, all other staff were very helpful. The front desk woman was very business like but when I would as a question such as when she recomemded what time we shoud catch the shuttle for our flight, to this and several other questions she would only say "I can't comment on that", I had not idea of how long the shuttle took to get us to the airport and how often it ran and didn't think it out of line to ask. Maybe she's had some bad experences.

Reviews.Title: “View of Runways Not Exactly Breathtaking ... Unless You Like Watching Planes Take Off”
Reviews.Author: dustymar
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Hotwire for this hotel. It was close to my son's apartment and pretty easy to get around to restaurants. The room itself was very comfortable -- multiple pillows on a great fluffy bed. I have become really picky about choosing rooms that have duvet instead of bedspreads, so the bed made me quite happy. I'm also picky about the thickness of towels, and again, the Hilton did not disappoint in this regard. My husband enjoyed watching the planes take off from our 14th floor room, but in the morning we got to look out on miles of asphalt. The first room we were given smelled mildly of smoke -- the front desk was immediately courteous and accommodating in giving us another room. All-in-all, a great night's sleep ... mmmmmmmmmm! We weren't thrilled to have to pay $22 (incl. tax) for parking, but that seems to be status quo -- at least in Southern CA).

Reviews.Title: “Descent hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: igang
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay- without any frills, it's a good hotel for a stopover. The room was clean, close to LAX and offers free shuttle bus. But it's very near to the airstrip so that I have to hear airplanes taking off every 5 minutes- and the noise didn't stop until the very late night.

Reviews.Title: “Must be the worst LAX area hotel”
Reviews.Author: docred
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because the "Park and Fly" package seemed like a good deal. WRONG!! Having stayed at many of the LAX area hotels over the years this place ranks at the bottom of the pile. Their website promised a $10 million dollar renovation....you have to wonder where they spent the money. Check in was slooooow, and we were initially denied the $20 dining certificate that should have been included. After we found and presented a copy of our reservation the coupon was finally provided (a trainee registration clerk was said to be at fault). !4 days parking included in rate...yes, but in a non-secured self-park area. Hallways are dim and shabby, and the overall ambience is one of a property that has not aged with any grace. We were "upgraded" to a room that we had in fact already paid extra for... a refurnished high floor King. One cannot imagine what the room was like before the remodel. As it was the toilet seat was broken, the shower temperature varied from cold to hot (?depending on the use of other guests?), there were no wash cloths, hand towels or bathmat. And the much touted free bottle of water was non existent. Pillows consisted of small foam slabs, though the bed itself was comfortable. Worst of all the AC unit was one of those old fashioned through-the-wall units that cycle on and off with a huge racket, and, when on, blast a jet of air straight at the bed from a distance of about 3 feet. Finally, the Landings Restaurant. Attentive if slow service. The morning breakfast buffet is a good deal, but food in the evening (at least during our visit) varied from cold, inedible, straight-from-the-can clam chowder (how hard is it to heat up prepared soup????) to ho-hum burgers. Skip it and go to the next door McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient and all needs covered”
Reviews.Author: JLS300
Reviews.Content: Needed a place in the LAX area for a long weekend. Ended up getting the hotel through a blind bid, well worth the $50 a night. This is a very large property. As mentioned previously, the parking is tight (and $20 per night to self park) but always found a space with little circling. Busy crew hotel, so loads of people in and out at all times. The pool is miniscule and void of any attractiveness. Caution the decking, it is very slippery - I slid barefoot and with flip flops. Given a nice big corner room on an Executive Level after giving my HHonors number, which was very nice. That being said, the room was huge, but lacked a safe (on the executive level? Really? No safe?) and lacked basic upgrades like a flat screen TV. Check in was actually very easy as was check out. Did not eat on property so cannot comment. All in all a good stay. Nice big King bed in a clean room overlooking the runway (noise was not that bad, but noticeable).

Reviews.Title: “Parking is awful!!”
Reviews.Author: Swim4speed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Hotel a couple of nights ago. I will grade the Hilton based on two things: hotel and parking. The hotel is right next to the airport. The planes didn't bother us when we were awake or sleeping. (We did sleep with earplugs though.) The lobby was big and looked good. We got upgraded to a suite. It was big and clean. 2 full bathrooms, 2 TV's, king size bed, and a couch. The parking was awful! It was super-crowded and the parking spaces & driving lanes were kind of tight. They charge guests $20 per night. One of the reasons it was super-crowded was because they allow airport parking there. They charge these non-guests only $12 per night. That's less than the actual guests pay!!! Hilton: please take note! The parking lot was too crowded so you should NOT allow airport parking! Also, guests should pay LESS than any non-guests. But nevermind that.....don't allow airport parking! Cars were parked in non-spaces, along walls that made driving by them tight! Overall grades: Hotel room and lobby, B and 4 stars. Parking and pricing, F and 1 star. We will not return because of the awful parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jah7373
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty standard, beds were nice, fluffy towels and staff was very kind, but I spent about 30 very frustrating minutes looking for a parking space in the overcrowded, claustrophobic garage. Not a great first impression after a long drive in.

Reviews.Title: “Dated average”
Reviews.Author: Brian72
Reviews.Content: Just good for sleeping, but nothing else. Clean but dated rooms, good beds, small bathroom, Exec Lounge with a poor food selection. Friendly staff, sometimes overcrowded front desk with huge lines. 10 Minutes to the terminals via shuttle. High floor southbound rooms have good view to runways 25R/L.

Reviews.Title: “Noise what Noise... Soft Beds...”
Reviews.Author: WallStreetx
Reviews.Content: I think this Hilton does live up to its name, we booked 2 rooms and both were in great condition,, even though we were close to the airport. there was no noise at all. nothing and the bed was super soft and big.. every night in that bed was amazing.. the food at the hotel was expensive but it was great. the parking i'm going to lie its a maze down there! but i'm from NY and used to having to battle it out for parking. the service was very friendly in the Hilton and the concierge knew his stuff recommenced a great club for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Englishviajera
Reviews.Content: In a big city its often easier to stay near the airport if you are on a stopover. I spent 2 nights at the Hilton and found it clean and comfortable. The bedroom was spacious and the bed very comfortable, important when your sleep pattern is disturbed by a change of time zone. Food is quite good and the staff are friendly and efficient. I took the Ocean Express Trolley to Manhattan Beach, $5 for the round trip with a stops near the beach, restaurants and two shopping malls. I had a pleasant afternoon shopping and I'd recommend it if you have a few hours to spare.

Reviews.Title: “Close In”
Reviews.Author: emcman
Reviews.Content: I went ot the Hilton LAX to surprise my wife who was on an international flight and had an overnight layover there. It is close to LAX and there is a 24 hour shuttle. The pool I have to say is not deep and is smaller than the pictures suggest. Everything else was fine. It is close to the airport so I would not want to spend a week there but I would stay again for a short time. It sure beats sleeping in the airport. I would not consider a resort kind of hotel but it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose well as an Aiport hotel, but little more”
Reviews.Author: Brocko25
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at this hotel, but convenient shuttle direct from terminals and very friendly check-in. It was a Saturday night, 12:30am, and the lobby was manic - very noisy. Its an older style grand lobby, with a 24 hour bistro/cafe serving Starbucks coffee. We were on the 4th floor, and the lift area stank of rubbish. The room was large, but the bathroom was tiny. The decor was in need of an update, tired but clean. The beds were however, very comfortable. The room had a small (old) fridge, which we were thankful for. The hotel has a small pool, and 4 spas if you are there during the day. It was quite good for an airport hotel, and serves that purpose very well. Its very convenient to the terminals, with the shuttle. If you are staying in LA for longer though, then this is not the place for you. If you are needing a place to sleep between flights, then definately consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: mikej54321
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in late June travelling from Australia. Hotel was very nice in features and appearance. Carpark an absolute nightmare. Had terrible trouble with the night staff checking in and especially with James(car park boy), who was very condescending and seemed only interested in helping if you were waving money at them. The morning staff made up for this, were more than accomodating, however did let me struggle out of hotel by myself with a suitcase, 2 surfboards and a skateboard with noone asking me if I needed assistance except fellow hotel goers. The shuttle was fantastic though, extremely big and spacious and did run every 5 minutes. Made mention of this experience to Hilton as they wanted to make sure we were 100% satisfied, no response and don't expect one, was a nice hotel but wouldn't stay at the Hilton again based on this experience or the lack of follow up.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby; impressive staff”
Reviews.Author: Balcwm
Reviews.Content: Not often I praise a hotel when things go wrong, but this is an exception. The lobby is really splendid - not many airport hotels I've been in have looked like this. We had some glitches - eg, just as we were going to bed, the air conditioning failed - but the speed with which problems were fixed was impressive. We had a different room in a short space of time, a hand to move luggage, & free breakfast vouchers. The staff we found, without exception, were friendly & good humoured, & eager to help. On our way into America & on our way out, the rooms were impressive - very spacious, clean & comfortable - & quiet, considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: oztravman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few airport hotels and they have always been pretty basic so I was quite surprised by this one. It was a full Hilton and I almost could have stayed there for an entire trip to LA, we only spent 1 night there as we had late flights in and didn't want to drive to vegas after a 14hour flight. There is a free shuttle from the airport to get you there and back. Check-in was quick, there was no queue. Room was nice, well maintained and clean. The bed... super comfy was so nice. We got a pizza from room service and it was nice, but small and super expensive but there is a Denny's down the road. We could see the runway, but noise wasn't that bad from planes. Every now and again you'd hear them takeoff or land but it was brief and didn't bother me and I am a very light sleeper. Otherwise rooms were quiet, I didn't hear anyone else or doors slamming or anything like that. Check-out took a bit longer as there was a queue and it wouldn't let me use the express checkout for some reason. I'd happily stay there again, maybe even if I was spending a few nights in LA on a budget, as there are shuttles to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Busy Lobby, Nightmarish Parking Garage”
Reviews.Author: Scooter1111Maryland
Reviews.Content: Lobby is great. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice, as are the bathrooms (despite being in California where I would expect low-flow showers, the one in my room had a delightfully strong water flow). The underground parking garage is the stuff nightmares are made of. Tight turning radius, poor visibility around corners, very difficult to navigate aisles, hot stuffy air...my pulse rate goes up 20 points just thinking about that parking garage. I never want to be six stories below ground in a maze like that again. While the hotel is decent overall, they do nickel and dime you. $20 to self park. $13 for internet. Take whatever price you get and add $33/night if you have a car and want to check e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Seen worse”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the airport. Check-in process was quick and efficient, nice customer service. The room doesn't live up to expectations when compared to main hall. My first room didn't have a functioning LAN cable, and wireless wasn't stable enough. Asked to move, which they agreed to without questions. Second room didn't have any internet problems. The corridors had a nice perfume, not the usual musty smell of huge hotels. The bathroom is the most disappointing part of the room. A/C wasn't noisy, which is always nice in a hotel room. I couldn't get to any TV free channel. It seems like modern trend is to charge for anything and everything.. Newspaper service is USA Today, but you can get a real newspaper (Financial Times) in the Hilton Club on the 16th floor, or in one of the restaurants. I tried their restaurant ("The Cafe"): the salmon was just barely ok, but the veggies it came with were great. Again, good customer service. What I don't like is this modern trend for dimly illuminated restaurants.. They should invest a few $$ and call a lighting PRO. Breakfast buffet mediocre, I'd rather go with the free continental breakfast at the Hilton lounge if you have access to it. Bar is expensive like any hotel bars..

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bad Restaurants, hasn't been updated in 30 years”
Reviews.Author: mwallack
Reviews.Content: Carpets stained, shower gross, the hotel is ugly, I wouldn't have stayed here if it were free

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Property”
Reviews.Author: mcgahat
Reviews.Content: I have not been at this property for several years but was going to be in LA for a couple of days on the way back from Hawaii and the great getaway rate was $89/night and included breakfast. Shuttles: We ran to catch the shuttle before it pulled away but the driver signalled it was full. As I looked up there was another shuttle pulliing up so no wait. The shuttle is shared with the Four Points LAX that is very close by. The path seems to be LAX Arrivals>LAX Hilton>Four Points>LAX Departures. The schedule is posted as every 15 minutes from the hotel. Check In: Hilton Honors line was short and the agent was friendly enough. Since my rate included breakfast I slected internet as my Hilton Honors Gold property ammenity. This created confusion as the check in lady said I would not get breakfast as my rate was too low and she upgraded me to the towers floor. I told her to check again as my rate did include breakfast and I didnt care about the towers level. She did find the info and gave me the breakfast certs. She did not downgrade me to a regular room though but it did not matter as I consider US lounges useless. Room: Nothing special here...same old room I remember from before only with a little newer carpet and a much more comfortable bed. Dining: We arrived late and the bar is open late but has a limited menu after 10PM but enough for us. The service has always been good at the lounge and the prices pretty reasonable for a hotel. There is fast food within walking distance but not much else unless you want to walk over to the Four Points. Breakfast was standard Hilton buffet fare and again nothing exciting but they will make eggs to order for you if you ask and the service is generally pretty good in the cafe. They also have a 24 hour cafe that is basically pizza, sandwiches and coffee which is also convenient. Car rental: I used the Hertz that is located in the lobby on this trip and have used it in the past as well. I got a rate of about $25 all in for the day and always had pretty good luck with the person running the rental desk as Hertz Gold member he basically tells me what he has and lets me pick. I was expecting problems when I checked out as the internet was on my bill but it was quickly removed upon check out. This property is great if you want to see what the Hilton were like 20 years ago and need late night food etc. I still prefer the HGI in El Segundo but nothing wrong with this property if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are flying, not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHockeymom
Reviews.Content: I was torn on how to review this hotel. If you have an early flight the next day then it is probably perfect for you. We weren't. We got the room on Priceline and were excited that it was only going to cost us $50 a night. Well after the fees it was $65 a night. When we checked in we were told our truck was too big for self park so we were required to use valet. So now it is $85 a night. (We also factored in that there was no included breakfast which basically brought our rate to about $115 because we had to buy something to eat). We paid the $20 self park rate instead of the $30 valet rate, which sounded like a great thing. Until we needed our truck. We were in and out of the hotel all day each day and the wait for valet was not terrible, but very inconvenient for what we needed. Factor in the fact that this hotel is big so it took us longer to get to lobby from our room. Getting into our car took us about 10-15 minutes. Which may not seem like very much time, but if you think about how long it takes you to get from your house to your car it is an eternity. Not to mention we were lugging hockey equipment along with us. The hotel was very busy both nights we stayed. They were having some kind of convention and when we walked into the lobby around 9:30pm it was like walking through a nightclub. Crowded and loud. Food in the cafe was pricey and line moves very slowly. We won't stay there again simply because it was too inconvenient for us. However, the staff seemed nice enough. We decided that for us, staying on the other side of LAX in El Segundo is more our style, there the hotel may be $90-$115 a night, but no valet, no conventions and breakfast included. And for 5 of us that sounds easier. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you have a flight to catch, or if you are sightseeing and have no time table. It's not a bad hotel. Rooms are actually quite nice. No fridge though. Also, I doubt I'll use priceline again for a hotel. Not sure if the deal is really that great.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded by United (again)”
Reviews.Author: jberns
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Kauai we encountered an issue with our flight on United, and were given a voucher for the night. The curbside service from airport to hotel and back again was very friendly, and convenient. The dining choices inside the hotel were decent, given that we had to eat there as a stipulation on our meal voucher. (++Meal vouchers do NOT cover room service.++) The entryway was completely immaculate, and the shining opulence almost made the hellish day we had at the hands of the airline worthwhile. But after getting off the elevator on the way to our room, we found ourselves in a maze of narrowing hallways, dingy outdated carpet and flickering lights. I was worried we had stumbled into a horror movie. The room was at the END of a twisty, turny, scary hallway and the door was in a state of minor disrepair. (Being that it didn't seem to open properly.) But the inside of the room was acceptable... and the pillows... Those pillows are what dreams are made of. (They do charge full retail price for stolen pillows, so don't get any ideas.) All in all it was a place to crash, I would not recommend an extended stay, or even a full week. But when you have no other choice it isn't a bad place to hang your hat for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to airport, too noisy and busy.”
Reviews.Author: dolphinreview
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Los Angeles after a grueling 11-hour flight from London, eager to crawl into a comfortable bed at the Hilton, and we were not disappointed. We waited less than 5 minutes for the complimentary shuttle to the hotel and were greeted by lovely, helping staff in a huge, beautiful lobby. Our rooms were clean and comfortable, with a full-sized bath and plump beds. Soon, however, we became tortured by the endless taking-offs/landings of planes, (as the hotel was situated less than 400 meters from the runway. All in all, the hotel is clean and comfortable, but can be excessively noisy, as most of the guests are trying to go to sleep after their flights.

Reviews.Title: “The bed and shower make this place shine despite annoyances!”
Reviews.Author: everyshadeofblue
Reviews.Content: The Hilton LAX airport scored big in 3 categories for me which outweighed all of the nickel and diming and outdatedness of the hotel: 1) Bed was extradordinarily comfortable...one of the best hotel beds ever. 2) Curtains truly blacked out the room...it was so dark I didn't know what time it was 3) Fantastic shower with amazing water pressure.... seemed illegal almost! I got this property for $47 a night on priceline for a 3-night stay in LA. Wanted a somewhat central location to venture out to various areas. My joy was shortly tempered when I realized I'd have to pay $20 a night to park and $13 a night to use the internet. Thus, the room quickly becomes $80 a night. The location is ok but would have preferred something closer to the 405 and without a horrendous parking garage with spaces so small you could literally park and not be able to open your doors. I don't know who designed parking garages in the 70s and 80s but this is one of the worst. Check-in was relatively fast and friendly. Got a great room overlooking the airport on the 13th floor so I could watch the planes land and take off...wonderful view! If you don't like some plane noise I'd advise against a room here but it didn't bother me at all. Once you closed the curtains you couldn't hear it as much. Oh...and those curtains! They almost completely black out the room! Best hotel curtains ever.... I woke up at 10:30am and thought it was the middle of the night...excellent if you want to sleep in! The shower was incredible in the recently remodeled bathroom. You could practically hear the reservoir draining which made me feel a bit guilty so I tried to cut them short but the pressur and flow was amazing...best hotel shower ever! Unfortunately they use Evelyn and Crabtree bath products so you can smell like your grandma all day long. The hotel is busy and there are several annoyances.... fees, getting to your car, etc. There is no fridge in the room, not even a mini-bar. My room seemed pretty fresh and clean and maid service was good. Would hesitate to stay here again given all the fees. If you are overnighting before a flight it's ideal but if you just want a central place in LA I would select something in the Culver City area of priceline. The hotels there usually charge less for parking and have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loftysurg
Reviews.Content: Recent stay in executive suite- great value, booked online with Hilton. A great, spacious room with 2 bathrooms, lovely bed and lounge area. All spotlessly clean. Very peaceful despite overlooking runway. Lounge great- nice breakfast and free soft drinks- though alcoholic drinks a little expensive. Staff generally very helpful and welcoming. Pool and 4 hot tuns- really nice. Very happy and great value all round. Highly recommmend and worth a bit extra for executive floor/suite.

Reviews.Title: “Badly outdated room”
Reviews.Author: OldGrayGrammy
Reviews.Content: Our room needed to be completely redone - stained carpet, sagging mattress, no in-room safe, no minibar, windows that allow in far too much outside heat and airplane noise. The bathroom came straight out of a 1950s motel - small, cut up into strange, uncomfortable spaces, old tub & shower combination with cheap plastic shower curtain, inadequate towel racking, no bars of soap provided, no bathroom glasses. Room service was efficient and the food was tasty, but the dirty tray was still outside our room 12 hours later. Bottom line: there are many other hotel options at LAX, so we will stay somewhere else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 and would stay again. We caught the shuttlebus from the airport to the hotel, which was convient and easy. Checkin was smooth and we got straight in to our 1 bedroom suite. Had great views of the airport which made our 2 year old very happy...he got to watch the big planesï�Š. The room size was fantastic. Enough for the 3 of us to have our own space. We got an extra rollaway put in the living area for junior so he had his own room. Beds were very comfy, pillows were very comfy. Plane noise was noticed but not annoying...it didnâ€™t effect our sleep at all. The rooms are not new, however this is a good thing if you want the extra space like we did. The buffet breakfast was ok and we were glad the price was included in with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel accommodations with outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwiththai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for one night in May 2010. We had a large room (seemed recently renovated) on the 15th floor with a great view. Although we could see some airplanes landing on nearby runways, our room was quiet enough for a restful sleep in a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but clean, with plenty of towels. Our very reasonable military rate included access to the Tower Lounge and one breakfast. The Lounge had a excellent view of the airport, with complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages available. Obviously, this benefit would have been more valuable if the wine and beer had also been complimentary, as is the case at their sister property Embassy Suites. The breakfast buffet had almost anything one could imagine. (If you donâ€™t see your favorite item, just ask your waiter, and he may be able to special order it for you!) Hugo was our waiter, and he offered superb service for our table of three (my wife and I were joined by our niece). The adjacent lobby was huge and beautiful, and I have heard that wireless Internet there is free (management may clarify that??). The airport shuttle was free, fast, and convenient. The â€œicing on the cakeâ€� was the outstanding customer service. I have been traveling for almost 50 years, and I have never seen better. One example was the Front Desk. Christopher was extremely efficient at check-in, solved a parking dilemma that occurred â€œon the spotâ€�, and he allowed early check-in, as our flight arrived in the morning. At checkout, Ava reviewed the charges on our bill to make sure that we received all the discounts to which we were entitled. Okay, I have to admit there was one small glitch: I asked for a 5:30 AM wake-up call, but my phone did not ring until 6:30. But being light sleepers, my wife and I were up early anyway. (And yes, I could have used the alarm clock.)

Reviews.Title: “My room was huge and the bed comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: My room was huge and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was outdated and dirty. I noticed a lot of toothpaste splatters on the walls surrounding the sink. Not up to typical Hilton standards. The gigantic lobby is quite lovely but I didn't spend anytime there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but no free internet access”
Reviews.Author: kylieoz-born
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel before and chose to again as it has THE most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. The Hotel has easy and reliable shuttle access to and from the airport. We arrived off our 14 hour international flight from Australia at 9:00am and the Hotel, as they also did on a previous visit, allowed us early check-in to our room for a much needed shower. This is much appreciated for very bleary-eyed travellers. This also enabled us to leave our luggage and head out for the day sight-seeing. We were only in LA for one day but if we were for any longer we wouldn't have stayed at this Hotel as it is quite a distance from Hollywood etc. Breakfast in the restaurant was amazing, with everything imaginable to eat. In the morning the gentleman directing the shuttle commuters was very helpful, making sure that people who arrived first, got on the shuttle first. The only thing I do not like about this Hotel is that there is no complimentary internet access. For international travellers this is very important as we need to let our anxious family members know that we have arrived safely at our destination. We ended up having to use the business centre, where we had to swipe a credit card to use and it was quite costly. As international travellers we are charged additional bank fees whenever we use credit cards outside of our country and cannot justify these extra fees for just a few minutes of internet use. Of all my travels, this is the only Hotel that did not offer free internet access, which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL LOCATED VERY CLOSE TO LOS ANGELES AIRPORT, FOR 1 NIGHT IT'S PERFECT CHOICE.”
Reviews.Author: BORIS1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to stay 1 night close to Los Angeles airport, arriving late in the evening from Honolulu and taking a rental car in the early morning. Our choice was the Hilton Los Angeles Airport Hotel. This was absolutely the best decision ! This hotel is extremely close to the airport, with a free shuttle bus service, located just outside arrival area, easy to find ! Check in was fast and efficient, probably as we arrived very late (around 23:00 local time, no queue !). Our room (nbr 9005) was a standard double bed room, with a normal quality and clean as it should be. Minibar was not available and fridge absolutely empty. This hotel is absolutely perfect for 1 night stay in between 2 flights or after a long haul flight. We also enjoyed breakfast and should say that staff were helpul and friendly. So, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in Los Angeles Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a layover”
Reviews.Author: kkekert
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to LAX but wouldn't recommend it if you'd be doing some city sightseeing. Free shuttle service to the airport. Helpful staff, clean, good food. Had a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton LA Airport fullfills all requirements of the best top *****hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: SafirahLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Los Angeles Airport fullfills all requirements of an top *****-hotel, the rooms are top clean - the service fantastic - the restaurants absolut excellent - the service of all people extreme friendly, helpful. The location of the hotel besides the airport is very quiet, the shuttle bus to the airport very convenient. The lounge on the 16th floor, the main restaurant, the Italian restaurant are highly to recommend. Following Managers have given us in the past 20 years excellent service: Mr. Ricardo Catubig / Mrs. Theresa Snjwind / Mrs. Pilar Galvez / the manager of the main restaurant Mr. Jung / all people at the entrance (helping with the luggage) and even all the service ladies cleaning the rooms - everybody is very kind and absolutely cooperative. We spend every year 1-3 months in Los Angeles and we ONLY go to the Hilton Los Angeles Airport. We have travelled the world and we have seen all the other big and famous hotels in LA, but the Hilton LA Airport is the best *****-Hotel of Los Angeles. Very highly to recomend to everybody who wants to travel with class !

Reviews.Title: “Of all the hotel choices at LAX, don't choose the hilton”
Reviews.Author: hotsyd22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the LAX Hilton before an early morning flight out. Whilst no-one expects grand things of an airport hotel, this Hilton was substandard for what would be expected of a Hilton. The service at check in was pitifully slow and unfortunately it didnt get any better from there. The room was desperately dated with dirty walls and lights not properly working. There was a disconnected old brown bar fridge in the corner of the room just sitting there unplugged. If I weren't so late at night and I didn't need to be back at the airport in five and a half hours I would have complained, but alas, I just put up with it!

Reviews.Title: “ok...”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at the airport is just another typical airport hotel. There was a beautiful lobby, lots of restaurants, a 24/7 bistro. The room was nothing more than ok, it was very dark and had paperthin walls, so i couldn't really sleep at night. Our room was on the 3rd floor so we could walk outside to the patio, which was very nice! Overall the rooms are very aged and need make over! The restaurant however was a disaster, we went there for dinner, i ordered chiecked by a risotto al funghi with winter vegetables and what i git was chicken with some old rice( certainly not risotto) with carrots and bean as well as boiled carrots. It was the first time I actually sent a dish back to the kitchen, i mean i took this dish because of the rissotto al funghi...i don't know maybe the cook wasn't used to people who actually understood teh menu or something but it was uneatable! After sending it back, i got some rice with mushroom, but somehow i was having stomach ache for the rest of the evening after that dinner...we also had some problems at the reception because during checkin we were given a different room rate than the one which appeared on the bill later on, bu somehow we managed to sort that out! Also the charges were way too high (13 usd for internet, 20 for parking etc!) Next time I will try out a difefrent airport hotel at lax.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight to catch an early morning flight the next day, Check in was a breeze and I was quickly in my room. However, I did have noisy neighbors across the corridor, who I think were using the hotel as a base for their night on the town (it was a saturday night). All in all, a good hilton hotel with rooms that seemed larger than the usual hilton rooms. Will be back when i'm flying through LAX next.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: viaggiat0re_felice
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a one-night stopover. Rooms were clean, nice bed, and surprisingly quiet, except other lodgers. The night we stayed there was an Anime party/convention in the hotel and they like to party until the wee hours! Lounge was odd in that it seemed so outdated but bet they do a brisk business. Staff was very friendly and helpful. For an airport hotel, this was decent and we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its Purpose Admirably”
Reviews.Author: MacVol
Reviews.Content: The LAX Hilton is convenient and the service has been outstanding. I have been staying here with some regularity over the past five (5) years. The hotel is showing its age in some areas. The rooms are a little dated and the carpet is wearing thin in common areas and hall-ways. However, the restaurants are open late and the quality of the food/beverage is above average. Checking in, I have always been welcomed back. The Executive Lounge is a nice perk here, and it hasn't been overly crowded. The pu puus are pretty good too. One thing to be wary of, however, is the fact that the Hilton LAX is the hotel of choice for distressed travelers. I have seen two occasions where Trans Atlantic/TransPac flights (747s) were cancelled, and the airlines sent their customers to the Hilton. This creates chaos where the lines have extended out the door. I don't know if there is any planning around this, but generally the hotel gets very busy, every day during the early-to-late evenings (5:30--8:00pm). I've never had any issues checking in mid-afternoon or late in the evening (after 9:00pm). Thus, if at all possible, I would recommend trying to avoid the rush hour or prepare for a bit of a wait. This property is also a magnet for mega-conventions. All in all, though, it offers great convenience and serves its purpose well as an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton”
Reviews.Author: scrabblequeen11
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $55 from hotwire. I was SO glad it wasn't the Westin. I almost booked the Westin but then when I checked their reviews on TA I couldn't help but notice all the 5 star reviews were written with a specific employee mentioned and they were ALL by someone with one contribution. Hmmm very fishy. I hate it when people do that to try to fluff up their rating. Anyway...I was only in the hotel for about 10 hours total, so didn't really get a chance to look around much. Hubby told me the pool area was very nice. I thought the room and bathroom was very clean and comforable. Nice plush comforters and pillows. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the window was small and you could only see out if you look around the corner. It was weird...made me kind of claustrophobic! You should request a room with a view. But I had gotten the room for so cheap I didn't really care about the view. There is a Carl's right next door and we grabbed burgers for our room. Parking is $20 (which is about the same as all the lax hotels) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a night's stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: misslcp
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight, and 2 hours in LAX waiting for luggage/customs, the last thing you want to do is wait in yet another line. But unfortunately when we arrived we had to wait around 30-40 minutes to check in (something that seems a common theme in reviews of these hotels). There were only 2 staff at check in and the quick check in tills were not working... It took forever. No appology when we finally got to the front desk. As this is probably a common occurence, you'd hope the hotel would put extra staff on their front desk, but no.. Anyways, apart from the wait - no other complaints. The room was clean and a good size. The bed was also really comfy. The hotel is also very close to the airport - and has a free shuttle service to and from. The pool was closed, which we weren't told about when we booked, but it looked really pokey and small so I don't think we missed out on much. I've also stayed at the Rennaissance hotel near LAX and if i was going back, I would choose the Rennaissance over the Hilton. The rooms are a little smaller but found the service much better and the beds were much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX /Blackstone Has Personnel Issues - Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SteakSnob
Reviews.Content: Simply put - this hotel property has all the amenities to make it a quality 3.5 star rating. What destroyed the experience was the check in process. I arrived at 9:30 PM on a Friday night and the line to check in went from the front desk almost out the front door in the lobby. If you have been to this Hilton, you know the length of the lobby is a good distance. The line was 1 hour long to check in. The automated check in kiosks kept bombing out and would not let me check in. The front desk was simply way understaffed and overworked. For the weary traveler, this just made the entire experience all the more unmemorable and left an incredibly bad impression. Due to the fact that the vast majority of the reservations are made in advanced and the hotel is aware of how many people need to check in on a given day, the Hilton LAX management should have been on top of this issue. While we are on the complaint wagon - a general warning. You do not want a room anywhere near the eleveators. I was the second room over and I heard the elevator cars running all night long. If you work in a mine shaft and enjoy the background noise, you may be ok. Otherwise insist on being in a room away from the eleveators. One other thing to note on this property - this is not a deal killer, but if you experience the aforementioned hassle, parking is not cheap. The parking garage is extremely tight and is $20 for self park and the garage clearance is only 5' 8". You may not use the airport parking rates as they impose a minimum stay and of course if you move your car, it voids the rate. Hilton and its private equity owner, Blackstone, need to realize the branding and service is all they have to win over the business and casual traveler. Due to the number of other properties around LAX - consider those before getting trapped in the mother of all check in lines at the Hilton LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad guest services”
Reviews.Author: Chenster02453
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying I only booked at this hotel but ended up canceling my reservation 3 days later. I booked through hotels.com (which I use all the time for reservations) and when the search offered up this hotel as an option, I felt the price and location was very reasonable. I also independently googled this hotel to get a more detailed description of room accommodations. On Hilton's website, they list every room as having WiFi access. There's no mention of any additional costs. So, I completed by booking on hotels.com. The next day, I happen to read a review online indicating that there's a $13 charge for 24hr internet access. While I was willing to pay the $20 per day parking fee, I was not about to pay $13 for 1 - 2 hours of internet connection that I would need each day. Thus, I called Hilton's front desk and guest services. I informed them of the fact that their web site does not indicate that WiFi access in each room would cost an arm and a leg. They acknowledged that there's an error on their site and it should have stated the cost. They further informed me they would take care of it. By taking care of it, they said they would notify their 'web guys' ASAP to put a note listing the WiFi charge. I asked if there was any way they could either wave or reduce the charge for me as I would only need to use it for about 2 hrs each day. They said no. My only consolation was that they assured me they would fix the web site to list the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: Flew into LAX late and stayed at the Hilton. The shuttle service to and from LAX is the best. The room was a double/double, which was perfect. We did not stay too long because we were meeting someone in Santa Ana, but I will definately stay at the Hilton again for a quick nite in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: awigg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Hilton February 26 and again March 6. My daughter and I were en route to and returning from Hawaii. We appreciated the convenience of the shuttle. As for meals, there is a little cafe in the lobby that is open 24 hours. How we appreciated it on our return at 11 p.m.! The breakfast buffet was very good. Easy access to meals is important these days when airlines no longer serve meals. The staff was courteous and efficient. The hotel amenities and decor were excellent. We enjoyed our brief stays and will certainly book rooms there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No safe in room means we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: pleasantpeninsula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LAX for one night on the outbound leg of an international flight. The hotel is very convenient to LAX and the free shuttle service was excellent. We got a good rate which included a very nice buffet breakfast. Check-in and Check-out were fast and efficient. The employees we dealt with were friendly and helpful. There were, however, some downsides: the bathroom was very small and cramped feeling. There was mold on the tile in the bathtub. The room had not been vacuumed--as evidenced by debris on the carpet. And, finally, there was no safe in the room. This meant that we had to keep such things as money and passports with us all of the time, which was inconvenient. Since there are many hotels in the LAX area, next time we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: biff33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton LAX at the start of our vacation and again on the way back. The first stay was great. We forgot an item in the room, contacted the hotel when we arrived at our destination to arrange to pick it up on the way back....... item was never found despite it being left on the counter. The stay on the way back was not much better than a cheap Motel, the only thing missing was being able to park your car right outside the door to the room. We stayed somewhere on the 4th floor which was definitetly an older rundown section of the hotel with dated furniture.
