The windows are large, and offer a good view from some rooms. The TV reception was excellent. The public areas are upscale and nicely decorated. The free shuttle to/from the nearby LAX airport is handy, and runs on a frequent schedule, but it's only fair to tip the driver for moving heavy luggage. Now the negative points: jet takeoff and landing noise from the nearby airport continues all night long, and intrudes into the room. While internet access may be free in the rooms or public areas for your laptop (I don't know), there is a heavy charge for use of the hotel business center computers. The three restaurants, including the Bistro sandwich shop, are very expensive. The elevators, while attractive in appearance, seem to operate with excessive noise and vibration. The guest room alarm clock is wonderously complex and counter-intuitive, confounding any attempt to reset it. Ours went off at 4:13 a.m., courtesy of a previous guest. We finally gave up on the clock and used the automated wake-up system. Bottom line, I will not again pay $239 per night to lie awake while listening to jet noise. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Avocat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to NZ from Dallas Tx. The room was small but still very nice. The location, free shuttle, very friendly staff, made this a very pleasant stay indeed. The pool and hot tubs were also great and the rooms were very quiet with little or no noise from nearby aircraft taking off and landing. The view of the airport runway was a bonus! I suppose the only complaint was the over priced food at the hotel restaurant ($16 for cereal!) and the rather cold and unfriendly staff at the brasserie downstairs. And must they serve that awful Starbucks coffee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch!”
Reviews.Author: tricia28
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children decided to spend a Friday night at the hotel prior to flying out saturday morning. I booked the hotel on the Hilton website the same day we were to arrive (OI am a Hilton Hhonors Gold member). I paid for and received an e-mail from Hilton for the Concierge Level floor I had booked which included an ugraded room, and a private lounge for evening hors doeuvres and breakfast. (We have done this in the past and the kids love to watch the planes take off and land from the lounge while having evening cookies and morning breakfast). Upon arrival after waiting in the Hilton Hhonors line over 20 minutes(!) to check-in (the regular line moved faster) we were told the lounge was closed and had been for the past week. We were also told we couldn't stay on the Hilton Hhonors floor because "the floor was closed". We were given breakfast vouchers for the restaurant and no apology for missing any of the amenities we had paid for. Then we were given the keys to a small cramped room (I have stayed at this property over 10 times in the past and I have never received a room this small). We called back down and insited they open the Hhonors floor rooms and give us the room we paid for. They relented and gave us a standard room on the Honors floor which was deserted so at least it was quiet. The next day we had to go wait for a breakfast table and of course tip our waitress (I won't cheat employees working hard despite the hotels bait and switch). This was nothing short of fraud and we should have been given an apology from the management and our room should only have been charged at the standard rate (not the concierge rate at $40.00 more!) What a rip-off. Beware, the Hilton has been bought out by a private investment company called Blackstone and they are hell bent on ruining the Hilton name in pursuit of profits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Expensive Dining”
Reviews.Author: Exploretheworldnow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my return from an international flight. The hotel shuttle leaves from and to the airport every 15 minutes. The check in at the hotel was efficient and I got to my room that overlooked the runway in what seemed to be no time at all! My room was clean and had a very comfortable bed. The bathroom had all the amenities that one could want even though it was a little on the small side. In using the closet you did have to be very careful not to trip over the hidden door stop which happened to be right in front of door to the closet. The hotel has a kiosk that enables you to check in for most airlines and print out boarding passes â€“ that is a really nice benefit that the hotel provides. I had dinner and breakfast at the cafÃ© and the food was okay â€“ but it was very expensive. The service at both dinner and breakfast was really good. The wait staff were attentive and did a good job in filling up your water glass and refilling coffee cups â€“ almost too good a job at breakfast as they kept clearing your place even if you were just going to the buffet to get more items!

Reviews.Title: “I was Surprised”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting here, otherwise I generally prefer other hotels. I have been in some Hiltons that were in need of some TLC. I was surprised by the comfort of the beds, the soft towels, the ease of a very late night check-in, and the cleanliness. No doubt the hotel manager cracks a loud whip! The only complaint was the cost of the food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton Ever”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Hiltons over the years and this one was surely the worst. The lobby is nice, but once you get past it, the hotel is dingy: poorly lit hallways, stained carpets, chipped furnishings, sagging closet doors. Bed was okay and it was quiet, but those were the only good things. Would not stay again and would be more skeptical about Hiltons in general in the future. Hotels like this do a real damage to their brand.

Reviews.Title: “Rev. and family”
Reviews.Author: G1956
Reviews.Content: I would like to say this hotel is very clean and I felt very safe there. The guest services was wonderful and accommodating. My room was very comfortable and it was amazing to be so close to the airport and not have the the planes distrub my rest. The location is great for travelers who like getting to and from the airport in a short time ex-specially at a busy airport like LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent stopover, beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anton2000
Reviews.Content: After our wonderful layover in Hilton Hawaiian Village Beach Resort & Spa for three nights in Honolulu we arrived at 9.30 pm in LA. We were waiting rather long for the shuttle, but our stay at the Hilton Airport in LA was wonderful, a very nice, calm and clean room and a great breakfast on the following morning in a nice restaurant. We payed about $ 205 per night for a room which we thought excellent value. There were 2 double beds so we slept incredibly good. Overall I would say this is probably the best airport hotel we have ever stayed in! The staff was very friedly and allowed us to stay a little longer (til 1.30 pm) because our plane to Germany left by 5.30 pm. We enjoyed it very much and will recommend Hilton Aiport Los Angeles for future stopovers. Hanns-Peter Randel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the reverse park & fly package experience”
Reviews.Author: amildon
Reviews.Content: Dropped our car off at the hotel and was promptly transferred to LAX by schuttle. A week later we returned from Maui at 10:30 pm and checked into the Hilton using their electronic quick check-in. Our keys were issued within minutes and we were on our way to our lovely room. We were treated to an executive continental breakfast the next morning which was terrific. Sorry we could only spend one night. Our stay capped off a wonderful vacation. Thanks Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY Liked this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: Liked many other contributors we stayed here at the end of an LA trip prior to an early flight home. We arrived about 7pm exhausted after a long day of "tourist activities". The lobby size and check-in desk was somewhat overwhelming with alot of people (we usually stay at smaller boutique hotels). I was glad we had reserved a tower lounge room and it was great going up the 16th floor to the lounge check-in where there was no one else. Our room was perfect - large, nice furniture, very clean and a great view. The only disappointments were the small "70's" bathroom and the older-style TV. The tower lounge was great - very personalized, quiet, great view, good food and drinks. It is definitely worth the additional cost. We had dinner at the hotel and the food was pretty good, but the service was rether inconsistant and slow (perhaps because is was later in the evening). The shuttle to and from the airport worked out well. All in all it was a real enjoyable stay for a short time. The hotel had a great buzz.- everyone seemed to be having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: Craig0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had an early flight out the next morning to New York. We booked it on wotif for about $126 US I think. They let us check in at 9am in the morning, which was a great help. The rooms were clean and tidy. Staff were helpful in giving us advice on how to get to Santa Monica by bus. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but there is a Denny's about a 5 minute walk away for an authentic American meal! The shuttle bus was a good service, and got us to the airport with plenty of time. Overall, a pretty good hotel for the money and location to the airport. And yes, you can hear the planes!

Reviews.Title: “old and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Evgeniya
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a standard room for one night on September 23, 2008 and paid 106Â£ via hotels.com. The hotel was definitely not worth the money. When we arrived around 8-9pm in the evening there was a long queue for check in although only 2 desks out of many more were open for check in. The furniture in the rooms was old and generally the rooms looked old and worn out. They were clean though. All in all, though I do not have any major complaints, it was definitely not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great crash-pad”
Reviews.Author: LPKent
Reviews.Content: Booked one night here after landing at LAX. Fairly easy to find and park, although you will have to pay for parking. Room was slightly "tired" for Hilton but bed was very comfortable, room was quiet and we had a good night's sleep. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice hotel near LAX for a weekend trip, and after checking on TripAdvisor and seeing that this hotel looked pretty good, I booked an internet rate for $99/night. This was for a two night stay on a Saturday and Sunday night (rate was fully pre-paid and non-refundable). The good: -Right next to the airport -Free shuttle service 24 hours a day -Beautiful lobby -Clean -Nice restaurants -24 hour bistro located in lobby for hot food, snacks, drinks, coffee -24 hour room service (menu is limited between 11PM and 6AM) -USA Today newspaper delivered to your door -Room service breakfast was very good, and delivered to my room 15 minutes after the call on a busy Monday morning The bad: -Right next to the airport (bring earplugs) -Look at my photos.....This was a very weird room with the smallest window in a hotel I've ever seen. How do you like the view? -The free shuttle service runs at random intervals. When you call the Hilton and ask about the shuttle service, you will be told that it runs "every 20 to 25 minutes after the half hour". This is absolutely false--do not rely on this. The shuttle service is not a Hilton shuttle. It is an LAX shuttle, and many of these mini blue buses serve most of the hotels and motels around the airport. When you catch your bus curbside outside of baggage claim, many of these buses will drive by---you need to look for the bus with the bright orange digital display that says, "HILTON LAX FOUR POINTS LAX". This bus stops at both the Hilton and the Four Points by Sheraton around the corner. -When the bus drops you off at the hotel, be prepared to stand in line to check in. Everyone on the bus is doing the same thing you are---checking in. If there are 25 people on the bus, then there will be 25 people in line. (My advice if you don't mind spending a few extra bucks is to skip the free shuttle and instead pay a taxi 10 bucks to take you to the hotel. Same thing for returning to LAX because the shuttle bus shows up "when it gets there"---there is no set schedule). -If you are flying on Virgin America Airlines, you can not print your boarding pass from the kiosk in the hotel lobby. For some reason, they do not have this airline in the system yet even though VA has been in service for over a year. -In order to understand my strange room, you need to picture how the hotel is built. Imagine a big "plus" sign, and this is the hotel. On each floor, there are four rooms (on at each corner) in the middle where the "plus" sign meets. All four of these rooms (on each floor) will be small and have the weird window as shown in my picture. My room number was 1042, so make sure you ask when you check-in if they are putting you in one of these rooms. I asked the clerk at check-in for an "airport view" so that I could watch the planes takeoff and land. He said "no problem"---and look where he put me! What a joke. I might try this hotel again, because it was clean and the service was good. The downstairs coffee shop was good also, and they have both a breakfast buffet and a dinner buffet. The steakhouse is only open Monday through Friday (to my disappointment). Housekeeping also did a great job. Besides the strange window and the horrible view, my last gripe would be the bathroom. Take a look at the picture and you will see that not only is it small, but the wallpaper is peeling and there are black mold spots throughout. It is a very old bathroom, with a water knob like I have never seen before. The bathroom was the only part of the room that did not seem updated.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: stainedglasslass
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had an early flight so we elected to spend the night at Hilton at LAX. It was wonderful from the first moment to second we left the shuttle at the airport. Check in was a breeze! It was fun to read the name tag and learn a little bit about the young woman behind the counter, a real ice breaker. Within minutes we were on our way up to the room, which was quite large, in the Tower. This gave us access to happy hour and breakfast in the lounge, both of which were lovely and a good value. But the best part was the bed. It was like sleeping on a cloud with plenty of pillows; no matter how many you like to use you won't have to call for extras! Wireless internet. Clean bathroom with great toiletries. I'll definitely use this hotel over all the others when I have a flight out of LAX. The only problem we ran into was the room service staff not knowing the difference between a gin and tonic (white) and whiskey and something (yellow). It took quite a while to get a replacement. All our problems should be so minor!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, well-cared for hotel”
Reviews.Author: BogStomper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles Airport overnight during a business trip and found it above average all around, and especially so given the price. So many times when I travel to a major city I end up paying around $200 for a stay at a decent hotel near the airport, and often those hotels aren't any better than the $99/room ones I find near smaller city airports. But this was an exception, well worth the price. The staff was plentiful and attentive to detail (quick to remove even a piece of lint on the lobby tile). The desk staff was very courteous during my stay. You do get your money's worth here. The hotel has well-trafficked exercise facilities, a 24-hour Bistro/Starbucks, and a reliable shuttle to and from the airport. Room service was not responsive at first (I had to call multiple times to get through), but once they took my order it was delivered quickly. I ordered a salad with salmon ($18.50), which was tough on the top and side. The apple pie was just OK; no "wow" at all for $8.95, so I regretted ordering it. The coffee maker worked well; the basket was nicely stocked with chamomile tea, three Arabica coffees (all caffeinated) and one decaf. The sink was lower than a person of my 6-foot height prefers, but it held water OK. The shower was in good condition and drained at a normal rate. The bed was very comfortable and clean; in fact, the entire room was very clean. The towels were soft and clean. There was real Kleenex in the bathroom (that is, the soft kind, not the variety that you can write on). There was a lamp on the desk with two electrical outlets in the base; there were no other free outlets near the desk. Wired and wireless Internet access was available for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Leetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hilton for 1 night to catch an early flight the next morning. The Hilton Hotel at LAX airport in Los Angeles was extraordinary in every respect. Not only was the staff attentive at check in, but the room was quiet, comfortable and above all, clean. The hotel bar was buzzing with visitors, but the service was prompt and attentive. The best thing about the service at the Hilton was the promptness of the airport shuttle both going to the airport and arriving back in LA. We parked our car for 2 weeks and picked it up with ease. On top of that we got a very special Park and Fly rate considering the high quality of this hotel. We would definately stay there again for all our early morning travels by air at LAX and would highly recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shumate45
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the LA Airport Hilton and very impressed with the quality of the Hotel. They have an excellent breakfast buffet and the rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-night stay at the LAX Hilton. The lobby is clean, modern and nice. We arrived after 10 pm and were made to wait in line even though we are Hilton Honors members. Had, what felt like, a good 10 - 15 minute wait. Check in person was ok - not super friendly nor overly welcoming. Our room was ok. It was spacious but felt like it needed to be painted or remodeled. Beds were comfortable. We had breakfast buffet at the Hilton Cafe. Food was quite good at $20 per person. The hotel was convenient for one night but I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night, if you donÂ´t mind a slightly old building”
Reviews.Author: HamburgSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton after we arrived by plane from London, so it was a typical 1-night stay at a typical airport hotel. The building is probably from the 70ies, which means that the hallways are a bit fusty and have these typical, old-fashioned carpets which do not smell nice, in my opinion. Rooms are relatively modern, even though I thought that the bathrooms looked somehow cheap, with lots of plastic everywhere. Overall, not what I expected from a Hilton. We didnÂ´t have breakfast, but it looked good. For dinner, there is a fast food restaurant next door if you want to eat late and do not want to pay the Hilton prices. Location is not "close" to the airport, if you are used to European airport hotels, but if you have a car, it is okay and easy to find. DonÂ´t use the valet parking, it is expensive and you can just drive a few meters further and then you can park your car yourself. Overall, I believe that the other airport hotels in LA are not great either, so the Hilton is probably okay for one night, just donÂ´t expect a really good Hilton standard.

Reviews.Title: “I higly recommend the Hilton Los Angeles Airport”
Reviews.Author: ManufanQuincy
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal with my job and recently stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles airport. I have never experienced such fantastic customer service as i did at this hotel by everyone who worked there. Checking in was easy and quick especially after a long flight. I was greeted with a hello and a smile by all members of the staff, the front desk were extremly helpful and answered every question i had. I experience many hotels on my travels throughout the U.S and this ranks amongst the best. The rooms were very clean and smelt fresh, the restuarant served outstanding food and the gym was filled with all the latest workout equipment for those who wish to work out during their stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to experience an enjoyable stay. I cannot say enough about this Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1HeartNevada
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent service from the valet parking to room service. Every encounter with the staff was personal, warm, and friendly. We loved the soft green tones used in the decor of the room because it created a tranquil relaxing atmosphere. The king size bed was incredibly comfortable. The Hilton exceeded all of my expectations because I have never found a hotel near an airport with great prices, great service, and outstanding quality. I highly recommend the Hilton Los Angeles Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hilton Get away!”
Reviews.Author: KevinSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Hotel personel, Professional, Courteous, happy to be there! Housekeeping staff made our room a castle of comfort and cleanliness. Front desk personal gave excellent advise on convenient inexpensive shuttle to local shopping and Manhatten Beach. Manhatten Beach is a must visit for fun,food and entertainment. At departure bellman, Joseph will make your departure cordial and easy! Looking forward to next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & great location for our requirements”
Reviews.Author: Cool_couple46
Reviews.Content: We had cause to use this great hotel twice in our recent holiday, we were first introduced to this hotel by our airline after an uncheduled delay in our ininerary and subsequently needed a complimentary overnight stopover. We were not happy about the situation but on arrival at the Hilton in our aggitated state we were immediately put at ease with the swift checkin and cleanliness of our room. The use of the swimming pool was an added bonus and the 'hot-tub' was relaxing. Our evening meal & breakfast had a great choice and all looked freshly prepared. The courtesy shuttle bus to the airport runs continuously 24/7 and if you just miss it a 15 minute wait is very acceptable. Towards the end of our vacation we altered our plans to spend time in Mexico & immediately decided to book ourselves in the Hilton for our required overnight stay between flight connections. Our second room was larger than the first and all amenities were in place, again we were very impressed with the overall whole experience & would not hesitate to book this Hilton again if we return to L.A. We booked direct online and chose the 'cheap' option of 'any available room' on arrival and it all worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Convience of Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: 1fitz
Reviews.Content: I am American living in Australia. I make approximately 2 trips per year to the USA. I usually stay at Hilton LAX for the convience. As a woman travelling alone I feel comfortable and secure and do appreciate your helpful and friendly staff. I enjoy using the Trolly facility to the local shopping center. I will continue to use Hilton in my travels. Wanda Fitzgerald

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lizmusic
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton was very comfortable and easy. The staff were pleasant and extremely helpful, and despite the huge numbers of people coming and going at the hotel, we felt that we were well taken care of and not anonymous. The convenience to the airport was also a plus. I would definitely feel comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park and Fly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smart_bird
Reviews.Content: We frequently use a park and fly hotel near LAX, but this was the first time we'd used the Hilton. The price was almost the same as the other hotel but it was so much nicer! The bed was wonderful, the hotel is very comfortable with most amenities, the valet service was excellent and prompt. We're definitely staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Definite change for the better”
Reviews.Author: hhvdragon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton LAX before and have found it wanting on each occasion. This trip was entirely different. The front desk staff was extremely polite- a big change. There was, however, still a huge line if you are not a Hilton member. Recommend reserving online and using zip check in. The hotel itself has undergone a renovation and it really is beautiful. Our room was very nicely appointed, newly decorated, clean, and very comfortable. The new pool and whirl pool area is a very nice addition. No complaints this stay. Very nicely surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel..needs upgrading in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eldorado500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for location to the airport, it was clean, and the restaurants were good, breakfast was great. Sadly the rooms are very run down, and need upgrading. Good for the price for a one night stay. Great hamburger place a few doors awa\yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: CPInut
Reviews.Content: I spent just one day in July at the Hilton Los Angeles on my way back to the east coast. I have stayed there before, and the service was just as excellent as always. Check-in is quick, they arrange for your parking lot ticket, and then I am off to a great room. It is close to LAX and the rental car locations, so I can drop off my car the night before and take the hotel shuttle. The staff is friendly and helpful from the doorman to the check in to the shuttle diver. They have several choices off the lobby to eat and drink. The Hilton has the best variety of all the hotels near LAX. I use the shuttle to go to the airport. I do not remember a driver that was a pleasant and worked to help everyone with their luggage and make sure they got off at the right stop. I know it is hard to stand out as a shuttle driver, but this person did. The attitude of all the staff is just great. In my travels I stay at a lot of hotels, and I look forward to my stay at the Hilton. The staff is great, the rooms are always clean and comfortable, there a lots of choices to eat and drink, and the internet access works every time. I highly recommend the Hilton when you are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Hilton is a convenient "layover."”
Reviews.Author: Wasabe126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were scheduled for an afternoon flight to Tokyo on a Tuesday. Even though we could have driven to LAX on Tuesday morning (about 90 minutes), we opted to spend Monday night at the LAX Hilton. We wanted to get the CA freeways out of the way before the day of our long flight. The LAX Hilton has always provided a pleasant, convenient "first stop" on our overseas sojourns. We've spent the night there prior to long trips several times and will do so again. We have found the beds to be notably comfortable and the room service surprisingly delicious. We arrive at the airport on hotel-provided transportation , calm and rested and ready to stand in those long crowded lines at the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over at Hilton LA Airport”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an overnight stop between a domestic and international flight. We arrived late at night, however the room type requested was still available, and check-in was quick & easy. The room was very clean & and spacious for the price paid. Room service late at night was of excellent quality and arrived quickly. We were able to delay our check-out as we had a late flght the next day, and therefore had a good nights sleep before the next leg of our journey. I needed to purchase some extra items & had no idea where to find them. The concierge came to my rescue within seconds, directing me to the exact place, which was only minutes away by taxi My experience with staff at all levels was positive & I would recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Very Posh”
Reviews.Author: cjocolumbus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family onway to Austraila for 48 hrs. The entance was beautifull, The staff were polite and helpfull at all times. It had a Gym, Sauna and swimming pool. totoaly great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far and close”
Reviews.Author: ALEXIM
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable and practical. Actually, I had a very pleasant stay. Being at the airport area, it could seem to be far of everything but you're really close to any trip purpose: business, leisure, pleasure, shopping, tourism, etc. With a car, you're moving and getting a very good hotel at a very reasonable cost. It was a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Verdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a junior type suite (bedroom, living room, 2 baths) on the concierge floor. My husband was there for business and myself and two teenage daughters joined him. We found the property lovely. Well appointed, good service, pleasantly decorated. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. The housekeeping was excellent. The concierge level's lounge was fantastic. We enjoyed having a continental breakfast there and drinks and appetizers each afternoon. True the hotel is right next to the airport (good for business), but I found it really easy and fun even to drive into the LA downtown/Beverly Hills sights. Overall, I was happy with our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: highpitcheric
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay for the price and is very kid friendly. The beds are very comfortable, the curtains black the sunlight completely out for those days you want to sleep in. The pool is heated and there are 4 hot tubs to soak in. Now of course you have to take the good with some bad, don't even think about getting a drink at the bar unless you are rolling in dough, the drinks are very expensive and don't let me get started on the $17.00 a night parking fee they charge. So I make sure when I leave I take all the crabtree and evelyn shampoo's and soaps. But all in all this place does make you feel comfortable and appreciated, a good feeling when your away from home. Highly recommended. One more thing, we stay here when we go to the beach, its about a 15 min drive to the Santa Monica Pier and Beach, but the money you save compared to staying closer and the quality of Hilton makes this place a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a One-Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: BigP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton LAX hotel both going and coming from a two-week vacation in Hawaii and though there is nothing that makes one want to shout praises about the place, it is cefrtainly perfectly acceptable for a one-night stay. The beds were, in both cases, comfortable and restful. It was also nice to have several choices of tea to choose from in the morning and a free and convenient shuttle to the airport that leaves every 15 minutes all day and night through was certainly a "plus." The cleaning staff was, the nights we were there, inconsistent. The first night, for instance, the bath had not been cleaned very well (there were a number of hairs in the tub) but the second night was far better with every thing neat and clean. One of the most disappointing aspects of the Hilton LAX is the fact that though there is a so-called business center, even the use of the computers to access the Internet require an additional charge. In this day and time, such a failure to be traveler-friendly, is rather ridculous. But would we stay again? Probably. The Hilton is convenient to the airport and though there are few restaurants other than a Carl's Jr. within walking distance, a one-night stand at a reasonable (for Los Angeles) rate make it at least a strong possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was great”
Reviews.Author: Sruta
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Next to airport and got a great deal on priceline. Clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Orlando_Fam
Reviews.Content: Beware when staying at this Hilton branded hotel. The hotel service and employees are very friendly and cordial but I wouldnt consider this hotel a 4 star hotel . It closer to 3. My family and I stayed there at the end of June for 2 nights and were dissapointed in the decor of the rooms. The rooms are dated from the 1980's. It was obvious that the room had not been updated since then. The floor tiles in the bathroom were cracked the furniture was that fake oak particle board and warped from water damge, the carpet in our room had stains througout. I was also a Hitlon Honors Silver member and asked for an upgraded room only to be offered one for an additional charge. Not sure it would have been better......... Bottom line 2-3 star hotel with a Hilton logo on top.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton....pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night (July 3) due to an early AM flight out the next morning. This is a fine hotel. The lobby was pretty busy with check-ins, but it went as quickly as can be expected. The room was surprisingly quiet considering airplanes landing on both sides of the tower. The room was furnished with typical Hilton furnishings (seems that most urban Hilton hotels have the same curtains, carpet, and use the same marble in the bathroom). The only negative comment I have is that the tile in the bath did have mildew stains in various parts. We did have dinner at one of the restaurants. The presentation was nice and the food quality was pretty good (not the best...but certainly not bad either). The bill was a little steep, considering there was no alcohol ($130). We would consider a return to this hotel if we needed to be in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Suprise”
Reviews.Author: melargo
Reviews.Content: Booked my one night stay through Hotwire for $70. We drove all day from Reno on 06/01 to catch our flight to Honolulu the following morning. Arriving somewhat tired...check in did not take very long and we were assigned a room on the 6th floor somewhat near the elevators. I was concerned at first but after lying on the bed after a minutes...I knew I would get a good nights sleep. Didn't hear any planes taking off that some other reviewers mentioned. We tried the buffet dinner at The Cafe in the lobby...$20 per person. It seemed just ok...but maybe I was too tired to enjoy it. If you're looking for a place near LAX for a few days...book through Hotwire and cross your fingers. A few blocks away is the Marriott which seems to be a nice place too. Parking at the Hilton is $17/day but it seemed to be a secure underground garage. I would definitely stay here again but only if I booked it through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects. Rooms very comfortable, location for airport is perfect with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: JFann823
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while on vacation in LA. I am normally a business traveler but this time I was staying in LA for a vacation. I chose this hotel based on price and location. I normally HATE airport Hiltons and I was frankly worried about the quality of this hotel based on prior airport hotel experience and the reviews on this website. However, because of the incredible price I got, I was still willing to stay here. I have to admit that I actually enjoyed my stay. The bed was comfortable and the room was semi-updated. My room was clean and when we asked for special requests from the housekeeper, they granted them. The service was acceptable and I enjoyed that they had 24 hour room service and a 24 hour cafe. My only complaint about my stay was the shower. The bathroom sink was updated but the shower had not been. It was clean and mold free but the shower had difficulties keeping temperature and the fixtures were extremely old. As for noise, I honestly did not hear any airport noise but my room did not face the runway. I am a Hilton platinum member so I have executive lounge priviledges. The executive lounge was very nice and comfortable. I could have spent hours there. The location was great and convienent to Santa Monica, the Getty, and Dodgers Stadium. We had no problem getting around. I know a lot of reviewers complained about the $17 parking. I guess I am just used to staying in big cities like Chicago, DC and New York that $17 overnight parking does not bother me. Warning though - if you have a very tall car, you will be unable to park in the structure and will have to do valet. We had a Toyota Highlander though and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Aging, but still elegant and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Boppster
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Hotwire for $69. It is an older hotel, but everything was in good condition. The rooms were huge and clean, the beds were comfortable with newer bedding and pillows and the pool and four hot tubs were just the ticket! The room was quiet and though it was very close to the airport, the air traffic noise wasn't nearly as bad as I expected. I was able to sleep very well and I am a light sleeper, especially in hotel rooms. My kids loved the room, too, since we usually stay in 2* hotels. The lobby was beautiful and there's a cafe and a very nice restaurant in the hotel. One word of warning, parking is $17/day (not stated by Hotwire), and there is a charge for internet usage which did not work in our room. There is a parking structure right next door that charges $13.95/day for rooftop parking. We saw an SUV scrape the ceiling of the parking structure at the Hilton - another drawback to an older hotel. I would definitely stay there again for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave me Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: rzl
Reviews.Content: On a Saturday night in Los Angeles, I would say the crowd was 'funky' and the hallway does have a few stains on the carpet but luckily the rooms are a breathe of fresh air. Speaking of which, I like a window that can open but I don't know if that's possible in this style of a building. The workers were all definetly hospitable. But In general, if I could, I'd LOVE to stay here over any other place I've been to (in it's class...)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For One Night”
Reviews.Author: OCragazza
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel because I had to wake up early in the morning for an event held there (I live about an hour south and didn't want to risk sitting in traffic in the morning). Everything about the hotel is pretty average - not shabby but not spectacular either. The restaurants inside looked good, but all I had was a croissant and coffee in the morning, which tasted pretty standard. Other than the airport, the surrounding area is a bit sketchy (there's a nude bar two doors down - enough said, eh?) and definitely not safe to walk around at night, especially if you're traveling with young kids. I would recommend this hotel only for those who just need to spend the night to catch an early flight or if you're attending a meeting in the hotel (convenience factor). Otherwise, if you're purely vacationing from out of town, there are plenty of other nicer hotels in better locations to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “nice deskclerk”
Reviews.Author: viejolucio
Reviews.Content: We booked by the hilton site on the web, from a 15 minutes and $5 rented computer in Las Vegas. Once you put your credit card number, the confirmation is easy and quick; Two days later, we arrived at 11:30 P.M., the staff was handsome and the room was ready and clean, with a bathroom plenty of little bootles of shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, soap, and that stuff. After a quiet night, our 8 year old daughter wanted to go to the pool all the morning, so the checkout time was coming. We went to the front desk asking if it's possible to keep for an hour or two our luggage in the service room meanwhile my young lady enjoyed the wet area, but in a really charm gesture of courtesy, the lady wrote down on the computer that we could leave the room at 3:00 P.M with no extra charge and not needing to take the suitcases off there. For us, that nice behavior paid for the whole stay, despite of the $17 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few hours sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrArthur
Reviews.Content: Sent here after AA cancelled our flights, and spent <6 hours getting some rest. The "buffet" at which you can use airline vouchers is a not-so-glorified Starbucks. At checkout, there were delays because "their computers were starting for the next day". I was overcharged, and despite offering for them to email me my invoice, they sent the wrong one. The bath/shower in the room was hard to operator (the bath didn't work), and the small cupboard in the room had a broken door.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel convenient to the airport. Frequent shuttle or you can walk to it in 15 minutes. Nice rooms, but not exceptional. Contrary to some other comments, I found the hotel to have quiet rooms. I think I was on a housekeeping training floor because they seemd to stop working on my room when it was half done. I ran into the supervisor when I was leaveing and mentioned this, but she did not seem to care. Overnight parking is expensive. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place / Super Dinner Buffet”
Reviews.Author: charlotteguy
Reviews.Content: American Airlines paid for my stay since I missed my connection to Hawaii. The hotel lobby and rooms were extremly nice...way more than I expected for an airport hotel. The airline food voucher was good for the hotel restaurant. I expected typical "hotel food" but was extremly pleased with the dinner buffet options. A large salad bar and hot items included fish, steak and chicken. All of the items were soooo good. The rooms were typical with a comfortable bed and shower. The hotel offers a free shuttle from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Clean and a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: I have to say I do not agree with some of the other opinons about the Hilton LAX Hotel. I guess it's always possible that some others have had a bad experience. However, my experience was fantastic! I booked on Priceline for $80. Yes, you do have to pay the daily $17 parking fee, but that is still much cheaper for this class of hotel in the LAX area than any others. My check-in was very quick and polite, they added my stay onto my hilton honors account and made absolutely no mention of me booking on Priceline. I asked for a quiet room as I had to be up the next day very early and desparately needed a good nites' sleep. Also I should add that I have a VERY sensitive nose and allergies and am very cautious about where I stay due to the all too common "stinky" hotel rooms that we've all encountered! My room was on the 13th floor, the insulation was outstanding and I heard no noise from the airport or street below. I was very impressed with the luxurious feel and cleaniness of my room. There was no smell at all. Shower worked great. And the A/C worked just fine. I slept like a dog! In the morning, I did hear the usual hotel mornings sounds, some doors slamming and maids outside in the hall, but I don't know of any hotels that don't have that. Overall it was a fantastic stay and for $80 I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX dangerously off course”
Reviews.Author: Snappyinchi
Reviews.Content: Hilton LAX room decor was in style approx 20 years ago (I stayed in room 1469). No upgraded finishes and not particularly clean. Guest room carpeting had some stains as did the guest corridors. Public areas are very nice but LOUD. I found Hilton food in the Cafe and via room service very good. VIP Lounge (or whatever it's called) on 16 is nice but they have a hard time clearing tables quickly. Parking is nice but a very time consuming ordeal. Bottom line while Hilton does have great beds, great in room coffee (Lavazza), and appealing bathroom amenities--this is an older airport hotel. I strongly urge you not to stay here unless you must.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: AGM78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Hilton for one night and enjoyed a great nights sleep after a long journey from the UK. Hotel was easy to find (Regular free shuttle service from all terminals), check in speedy & friendly, room was spacious, clean & comfortable, and very quiet despite close proximity to the runways! I had breakfast brought to my room first thing in the morning and this was fine. All in all, a good experience - met my expectations. My travel agent managed to get me an excellent rate for this hotel, so overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it unless you are in transit”
Reviews.Author: Business_Asia
Reviews.Content: Skip this hotel unless you are only in transit. I used my Hilton points to stay two nights and would have felt ripped off otherwise. There was a long line for check in at 12:30 AM and I had to ask if there was anyone availabel for H-Honors check in. Even when I did get someone, it took 10 minutes for a confirmed reservation. The first night my room was an "upgraded" room facing the active runway at LAX. The windows are only single-unit glass and they shook violently for 747 take offs and landings and a mild "roar" for all other aircraft. No-sleep even with ear plugs. The second night I was switched to another room on the opposite side of the hotel - much better on the Aircraft noise but the walls are thin and I agree with the other writers comments. Checkout in the arly AM is also time consuming as they only staff with one or two people yet this is a busy time for traveler check out. This was at 4:30 AM. Caution: If you plan to take the shuttle to the airport, plan about 30 minutes for the ride as the busses fill up, they stop at the Four Points Sheraton and stop at several places at each of the 8 terminals. If you don't have a Premium Airline card or access plan to be in the airport check in line two (2) hours before your flight AT LEAST. The hotel is clean and everything in the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Annoyed at some things.”
Reviews.Author: HL950
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this room for $65. Was pleasantly surprised. Getting up early for a flight out of LAX and decided to spend the night closer to the airport. Did the HIGHLY convenient computerized check-in - no problems. I most definitely checked off a 'non-smoking' room for our stay. Got to our room (3rd floor), and were immediately hit with that stale, disgusting old cigarette smell. I decided to wait it out - perhaps the entire hotel smelled like this, and while definitely undesirable - we were exhausted and just wanted to go to bed. The smell became worse as it was apparent we were on a smoking floor. Decided to switch rooms, and began on my quest to get a hold of someone, ANYONE at the front desk (or management). To my horror, the phone rang ... and rang ... and rang ... and rang. I sat with the phone to my ear, calling various extensions, for a total of 20 minutes ... no one ever picked up. Furious, finally I marched downstairs to tell my concerns to an extremely unprofessional young man at the front desk. No apology, just switched rooms as fast as he could. I know this isn't the Four Seaons, but come on. Terrible customer service. Our room on the 6th floor was lovely and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate through Priceline otherwise we would have felt ripped off”
Reviews.Author: PolkaDotLady
Reviews.Content: I think other reviews have covered the $14 parking which certainly ups the price of the room. We found the room to be clean and functional; however, it was extremely noisy thanks to the airport proximity. Also, every voice or sound from the hallway was amplified and there the crackat the bottom of the door kept the room from being totally dark. We would never pay the rack rate for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I've had better stays here”
Reviews.Author: Female_Traveler5689
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is my normal LAX airport hotel choice. I've had very good stays in the past but this one was lacking as far as rooms go. The first room I was given was on the Executive Floor. It was tucked in a corner, near the elevator(contrary to the what I always ask for) with a very small window on the side wall of the room. It seemed that this room was almost an "afterthought." I went down to the front desk and very politely asked for a different room. The woman who helped me was very nice. Due to the hotel being very full, she offerred and I accepted a slightly smaller room on the 4th floor. This room had another very limited view but this time it was of what appeared to be a courtyard between the towers. It was again very close to the elevators which I don't like and they were doing construction on the tower I was in. The floor was covered in plastic and they'd laid plywood over it. Everytime someone walked by it was noisy. I didn't hear any construction noise but this set-up was "low-rent." The room looked ok on the surface but after being in it for awhile I noticed some deficiencies......it was very humid and the room never did cool down to my preferred comfortable sleeping temperature. The TV needed to be repaired or replaced - - the sound was awful. The shower in both the original room and my second and final room needed to be cleaned or have the caulk replaced. One suggestion I have for the hotel if their representatives read this is to reconsider the placement of the small table they have which holds the coffee pot and ice bucket. The placement of it is in the direct line you make from the bed or desk to the bathroom. I ran into at least twice. Finally, despite my displeasure with the room situation, the staff at that hotel is wonderful. The bartenders are great! One of them very kindly gave me a book he'd finished reading. The breakfast room service delivery gentleman was polite and kind as he'd been for my previous stays. The staff that work the front desks are alway pleasant and do their best to be accommodating. I will stay here again as I'm hopeful my room experience was just a "one-time" occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Statikfeed
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business trip and was very happy with the location and cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel was very well decorated and the rooms were well appointed. The only complaint I would have is the lack of good restaurants in the hotel (Marriott near by had better choices) and the smell of jet fuel exhaust when you walked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andriyko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel to ctach an earlt monring flight out of LAX. The hotel is conveniently located, and the property offers free shuttle from/to the airport. The check-in was a breeze and we were in our room within a few minutes. The room was of an average size and offered basic amenities (although no mini bar!). The bathroom was really small. As we had to leave rather early we did not get to ahve brekfast. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, large corner room”
Reviews.Author: Flippitti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a trip. We had a corner room on the 15th floor. Great view. The room isn't all that much larger but the windows on two walls made it seem spacious. The king bed was very comfortable. There was a regular tv in the room, not a flat screen. Bathroom is quite small and counter space is limited. We used the hotel shuttle to get from the airport to the hotel the and had no problems. Didn't even have to wait for it. At check-in the front desk clerk told us the shuttle runs every 15 minutes, 24 hours a day. However, the next morning, when we had to get to the airport to catch an international flight, we waited at least 30 minutes for the shuttle and when it didn't arrive, we opted to take a cab. (It was $17.50 for the cab, by the way, and we barely had to drive 2 blocks.) The hotel's shuttle service definitely needs improvement. We had dinner at the bistro restaurant below. Service was outstanding but the host and hostesses like to seat diners so close together and leave huge sections of the restaurant empty. Why? This doesn't make sense and can be uncomfortable to have a private or casual conversation with your dining partner. Food was well-cooked although unimaginative. I had the BBQ ribs and it came with coleslaw and fries. It was liking eating at Cracker Barrel only three times more expensive. The lobby of this hotel is also a bit confusing. You have to walk a ways past restaurant, cafe, stairs to get to the front desk. The best thing about this place is the location. It's a comfortable place to stay when you have an early morning flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: Reggie3cl
Reviews.Content: I'm glad this was a freebie from Airmiles! Usual Hilton thing- quite nice lobby, scruffy room. Shuttle took forever to pick up at LAX, and if we'd had luggage we wouldn't have been able to get on. Check in was OK, although clerk was disinterested. Room service food was average, although it was delivered by a cheerful chap. BA had lost our luggage and the shop downstairs couldn't even sell me some shaving foam.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jekajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Year period. As far as a hotel goes, Hilton was way above average. However, the meals are below what I would have expected. Breakfast is $18.50 and quite limited in selection for that type of price, with some food quite dried. We got a very good rate, so felt that our value for the rooms was excellent. The beds were comfortable and everything, rooms, foyer presentation was of a high calibre. We found the LAX Hilton excellent value for money - except for the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hilton LAX for one night to catch a plane in the morning. Room was clean, beds were very comfortable, linens were nice and crip, bathroom outdated but clean and hallways ugly but clean. Nice lobby, decent Italian restaurant. Very good soundproofing â€“ even though we could see the planes landing, we could never hear them. Got a good night sleep and was on my way the next morning. I think as far as the airport hotel goes, it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: jj435
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the beds - the mattress was large and comfortable and had numerous fluffy pillows. I got a great night's sleep for being right next to the airport, and could hardly hear the planes, which didn't matter at all given how comfortable the beds were. Wake up calls were on time and easy to program. Housekeeping did a good job. The room and hotel were kept clean. The shuttle to the airport is convenient but does get crowded - be sure to plan enough time to catch your flight, otherwise you might consider taking a cab instead of the shuttle bus. A word of advice - skip the 24 hour bistro. The staff doesn't make the coffee up to par of a regular Starbucks, so if you're looking for a quick breakfast or cup of coffee, I'd recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “There's a nice Marriott right next door”
Reviews.Author: Ragoczy
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably nice looking hotel located very close to LAX, but I had several problems. First, when I went to shower the night I checked in a large, nasty clump of hair floated up from the drain. I took it down to the front desk the next morning and they handled the situation, but it wasn't an auspicious start to my stay. The second thing that happened is that I got food poisoning four days into my stay and spent a day vomiting (among other things). Since I had only eaten one meal anywhere other than the hotel (and that three days before), my belief is that the illness was caused by the hotel's food. Again, the hotel staff tried to make things right, and if my stay hadn't ended so badly, I'd actually be writing a positive review. The worst problem I had was that they got my rate wrong (to the tune of $350). I had originally booked at a rate of $209, but called the hotel a month and a half before my stay to change it to a rate of $139 that was available because of the purpose of my trip. When I explained this at check-out, I received the worst customer service experience I've ever had at a hotel. The front desk manager on duty was surly and unresponsive, despite my opening the conversation with a smile and cheerful "good morning", she never cracked a smile. Well, when I angrily asked her "Is this how you want a guest to leave your hotel?", she did shrug and smirk a bit. Ultimately, she refused to adjust the rate and I had to catch a plane. I faxed a complaint to the hotel the next week and spoke to someone who actually seemed responsive. He asked me "What can we do to make it up to you?" and I thought he'd correct the issue, but, ultimately, he too refused to adjust the rate, despite it being the hotel's screw-up to begin with. The "explanations" I received had to do with policies and the computer "not letting" the rate be changed. If this is truly the case, I question why Hilton employs human beings at all, since they're either unable or unwilling to exercise judgement and discretion. Their actions are, frankly, nonsensical, since I estimate they'll lose over $7000 in business from me and my colleagues over the next year. This is neither good customer service nor good business. Like the title of this review says, there's a nice Marriott right next door and a perfectly good Crowne Plaza up the street. Stay at one of those and save yourself some headaches ... I will.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Czyz22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The services that we used worked very well, including the shuttle to the airport. The room service was delicious and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Another airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistercee_uk
Reviews.Content: Hilton LAX is ideal for a one night stopover when arriving or departing from LAX airport. Decor is quite dated, but rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Always busy, used a lot by flight crews on stopover. Bar and restauarant off lobby are nothing special but adequate. Shuttle to/from the airport takes about 10 minutes. I wouldn't want to use this as a base for exploring LA, a cab to downtown is about $45.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Believe This is a 5 Start Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fiveoclockcaptain
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough this Hilton property. It is clearly a well managed property. The staff are on the ball, the public areas are spotless. Promises made were delivered. The rooms are well furnished and quieter than you could imagine. The shuttle bus driver handled a difficult situation remarkably well. An 18 year old "surfer dude" who was going to Hawaii had an 18' surfboard. The driver pointed out that he could not bring the board onto the shuttle bus as it would block the aisle for passengers in the event of a crash. The surfer flipped out, but the driver stuck to his guns and the passengers on the shuttle cheered his actions. The hotel feels different, more like a resort property on the beach in Florida, not in a random airport alley. Do yourself a favor and stay here if you need to layover at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: manzoorf
Reviews.Content: First and last time staying at a hotel this close to LAX. The room was excellent and very clean. The bathroom was spotless. Around 11PM, as I was about to doze off, the first of many late night flights began to take off. I was too tired to change rooms so eventually I did fall asleep but talk about a bad choice location wise ! Unless you are too exhausted to roam farther afield and find a hotel away from LAX, I would NOT recommend this or any other hotels on W Century Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: stace120
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months earlier and thought the hotel was okay, so the next time I had to spend a night by LAX, I booked this hotel again. Big, big mistake. I stayed here because I didn't want to drive the hour and a half home that late at night (around midnight). When I tried to call to gaurantee check in that late, I was transferred no less than 7 times and hung up on twice before they finally figured out how to get me to the front desk. When I arrived at the airport I called the hotel to ensure that a shuttle was running. I specifically packed for that trip so I would not have to wait for baggage claim in LA- what a joke. Everyone had claimed their luggage and was waiting for the shuttles before any showed up. Actually we waited and waited and waited and waited. After over a half hour another shuttle driver for a different hotel took pity on us and dropped us at the Hilton. Then there was the check in. There only appeared to be two people ahead of me in line so I thought it would go smoothly. Over an hour later I was checked in. The man at the reception desk kept helping people from a tour bus that pulled up after we got in line before he helped us. Whe it was finally my turn, I commented on the wait, all I got was an extremely surly attitude. Way to treat any customer, let alone one of your gold members Hilton! Then the bar closed early- luckily the bartender took pity and made me two drinks to take out into the lobby. All the poor people behind me in line who tried to get a well needed drink were turned away. Needless to say I won't stay here ever again. By the way, I could have been home sooner than the Hilton got me into a room right next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline bargain near the airport”
Reviews.Author: LoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The area around LAX would not be my first choice for a location when visiting Los Angeles, however, this was the most convenient location for a family visit. I've stayed at the Radisson, Westin and Hilton near LAX now and they all rank pretty evenly for my purposes. I bid for a 3* at LAX, and got the Hilton Los Angeles Ariport for $60 per night plus taxes. The Hilton is one of many hotels located along Century Boulevard just a few minutes away from the airport. They run a free shuttle to/from the airport. The check in process was quick and they gave us a 2 bed room as we requested, for checkout they slip your room charges under the door and you can just leave the keys in the room. The room was spacious and clean, the beds comfortable. I requested two double beds ahead of time since I was staying with my dad and they accomodated my request. There was a TV with a limited number of stations, iron and ironing board. No in-room safe or refrigerator. The shower was fine with plenty of hot water and pressure, toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap, towel were thick. There was a hair dryer and coffee maker in the bathroom. There was an outdoor pool (too cold to use it) and a health club in the basement with treadmills, stationary bikes, ski machines, climbers and some weight equipment. I grabbed a very expensive snack at the coffee bar one morning, $5 for a muffin and water. Dad had breakfast at the hotel every morning and it was over $20 each day, you can obviously do better going outside the hotel. Parking, as with most of the LAX hotels, is an extra $14 per day with in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Will be our 1st Choice”
Reviews.Author: puravida2
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on Priceline for the Hilton and did not know what to expect. We were very pleased! Though we got in late and were only there for one night, the room was wonderful and just what we needed after a long day of travel. The beds were extremely comfortable, the amenties were top notch (I too love the coffee machine) and the staff went out of their way to help us resolve a minor issue. I will note that the "extras" are pricey - I do think they should provide free wireless, the breakfadst buffet was $18.00 and parking is high, but I think that is everywhere. Overall, minor and typical complaints for a big city hotel, but certainly not anything bad enough to keep us from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton the night before we caught a flight out of LAX. It turned out to be the perfect hotel for us. We arrived rather late that night after our drive up from San Diego. When we checked in we were given the option of a "corner room" that faced the runways. I like to watch airport activities and airplanes taking off and landing so we jumped at the chance. The room was rather large, as well as the bathroom, and clean. We ordered room service for dinner that night as well as the next morning before catching the shuttle to the airport for our flight. The next time I need to fly out of LAX I will for sure be staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Even more impressive given its at LAX!”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: Quick Summary: A+ Hilton - Thanks for a great stay, I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. I spent one night at the Hilton LAX Airport. In comparison to most airport hotels, this Hilton is a real Gem. Walking into the lobby is the first sign that this is a well maintained Hilton with lots of Marble and a roomy inviting lobby. Check in was smooth and easy for both myself as a Hilton Diamond member as well as my coworker and customers who did not hold any status. I would recommend this hotel, it rivals any Hilton on the US I have stayed at. (This was a welcome change after a few nights at a very unacceptable Doubletree in Torrance) I stay at many hotels during work travel, and not many hotels get glowing reviews from me like this. The elevators were quick and plentiful. My room was of adequate size and given I was on the top floor, I was very pleased that there was no disturbing noise from overhead aircraft, nor from any rooms around me. The room was very clean and appeared to have been updated rather recently. The room had both feather and standard pillows, a comfortable bed, small sitting area, and a nice sized work desk. The bathroom was not huge, but had plenty of room for toiletries and other necessities. Of course the view was nothing to speak of, but it is near the airport. The hotel has a rather nice gym that rivals any that I have stayed at (other than resort / spas of course). There are about 5 treadmills, 5 elliptical, and 3 bicycles, all with individual TV screens. There is also a nice area with weight machines, free weights, etc. The only negative of the gym is that there most cell phones will not work there. The hotel also has an acceptable outdoor pool and 4 hot tubs. Though I did not partake, I understand that the hotel has an affiliation with a bus that provides free transportation to Manhattan beach if you are looking to get away from the hotel for short while. They also have a Hertz rental car location on site, if you want to rent or return your car to save a few dollars on parking or an extra days rental. The business center is rather small, and the charges are high, but copiers, faxes, internet access, printers, and computers are available for a fee. I did not try to use the high speed internet access, as I have my own broadband card. The hotel has 24 hour room service, and a nice selection of dining options. They have a more upscale Italian dining room, a bar / casual dining, and a 24 hour bistro / coffee shop. Airport shuttle service runs about every 15 minutes 24 hours per day. Though I did not take the shuttle from the airport, the shuttle to the airport was prompt and efficient. If you stay on the executive floors or are a Hilton Gold or Diamond member, the hotel has a very nice hospitality lounge, and it is in a controlled access room so that it is not overrun by guests who should not be there. The lounge has a nice breakfast in the morning with standard continental and one hot item, evening hospitality with two hot items, cheeses, fruits, etc. They also have a two hour window with very nice desserts available. They also have non alcoholic beverages as well as bar service. All items are complimentary with the exception of alcohol. The hospitality suite has a nice view of the runway if you are interested in watching the planes take off.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexUKTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton LAX on August 26th. I booked the "kangaroo rate" which allows you to have late checkout time of 6pm. You have to pay more, but it was well worth it as our flight was 9:30pm. Although we didn't have the disaster with the shuttle bus as other people have it wasn't as prompt as I would hope for the Hilton. I was surprised the hotel didn't have a sauna although the gym, outdoor pool and jacuzzi's were ok. We had an evening meal, breakfast and an afternoon snack, which were nice but a bit pricey. I used the internet in the business area, which was also over priced. We had a top floor room, which had great views. There was some noise from the airport although not enough to stop you sleeping. The bathroom was a bit smaller than other Hilton hotels I have stayed in. Overall a good airport hotel although a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Hopeless shuttle to LAX.”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly reception staff, probably due to being a busy Airport Hotel. Nice big room & comfortable bed. Loved the Lavazza coffee machine. Bathroom was tiny. Worst experience was the shuttle to the Airport. Concierge tried his best. However, we waited ages. When the bus eventually arrived, it got full quickly, some people pushing on, a passenger shouting at the staff etc. Lots of people standing. Nearly missed my flight. If you stay allow plenty of time & a calm attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, But They Try Hard”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: Just say the words "airport hotel" and for most people it probably brings to mind mundane cookie-cutter hotels full of airline crews and weary travels. It's true, in general, and fits the Hilton LAX to a degree. This is a big hotel. Maybe a bit too big. I parked at the hotel and while others have said the parking signs are confusing, I found clearly marked signs to the Self Park area ... but you have to go down 5-6 levels before reaching the self park area. When you take the elevator to the lobby, you feel oddly out of place if you aren't wearing a uniform from an international airline or if you aren't carrying bags from lands afar (and bags under your eyes from long overseas flights). I checked in about 10:45pm and was attended to within 3-5 minutes. I was given a room on the 4th floor and found that it was as far away from the elevator as one could get. It isn't what I expected for being Hilton HHonors Gold, but it was late and I figured they ran out of rooms. My first room (foreshadowing!) was cavernous. With one teeny-weeny window, the rest of the room looked like a basement ... low ceilings and lots of wall. Oddly, at the very end of the bowling alley ... err, room ... was an itsy-bitsy bathroom. But, after having kicked off my shoes and heading to said loo, I found the carpet to be absolutely soaked. "Yikes!" I thought ... and pushed out any thoughts of potential liquid substances that could be on the floor. I called to explain and was transferred three (1, 2, 3!) times, explaining my story each time. Finally, the third gentleman apologized and said he would move me to the club floor if I would go back to the front desk and get my new key. I did that, but upon reaching the front desk was told that a bellman had just been sent up to my 4th floor room with my new key to take me and my bags to the 12th floor. That's impressive ... but I wish I had been told that in the first place. So, they issued me new keys there and off I went to push button "12" in the elevator. Upon exiting the elevator on floor 12, I met a bellman. He looked at me, I looked at him. This knowing exchange could mean only one thing: he was the one sent to move me in the first place. We exchanged info and, indeed, it was he. But he had been sent to another room on floor 4, which he told me was occupied by a China Airlines flight crew who knew nothing of moving to floor 12. "A" for effort ... but the devil is always in the details, Hilton. The room itself, like that of the fourth floor room, was fine. It's a 3-star airport hotel, so my expectations were not overly raised to begin with. The furniture is d-a-t-e-d! The bed is quite comfy looking and modern-ish in a hotel bed-esque sort of way. It was a mismatch to the otherwise plain and cheap other furniture in the room. The bath, too, was dated. Plastic countertops and a cheesy showerhead didn't make, or ruin, my day. It should be noted that this hotel's lobby is drippy elegant for an airport hotel. Lots o' marble here. Hmmm ... I think they should have put some of that marble in the guest room bathrooms. Overall, it is what it is. The LAX Hilton isn't anything I'm itching to get back to or anything I would necessarily avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at this Big Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: Well, when i arrived via the airport shuttle i walked into the large front entrance/lobby area. The restaurants are on both sides of this area. I walked up to the front desk via the VIP line and was greeted nicely by the staff. I was given a room on the 17th floor (Room 1760 to be exact) a large room with a comfortable bed and distant view of Downtown LA. There happen to be a wedding there that night but there was no problem up on the 17th floor just a little crazy down where the wedding was taking place with all the people and kids running around. The 16th floor Lounge was nice, good bartender and great view of the airport. They have heavy o'douevrs from 4:30 to 7pm and then are open till 10PM. In the morning there is a contiental breakfast in the lounge. Staff was good to the exception of the morning lounge attendant since the night before i had asked to have him call me in the morning and after coming up the next morning and seeing my business card right next to where he was with a big note on it i still wasn't called. Even after i asked for a copy of my room bill he still didn't seem to notice the business card. Anyhow, the stay was nice, a little pricey to park your car if you bring it. The pool was comfortable on the 3rd floor. Allow 30 minutes to get to LAX terminals because they stop at the Four Points Sheraton as well with the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: Colchester_Ali
Reviews.Content: We arrived late afternoon and were advised by a friend to book into an airport hotel for the night rather than picking up the hire car and finding a hotel away from the airport. We took his advice and found the Hilton to be very good value for money (room Only) Â£50 per room per night; booked through Purely America. The free hotel shuttle was easy to find. We booked two rooms and both were very similar, we found the rooms to be clean, in excellent condition and the beds to be very comfortable. As this hotel is near to the airport and just off the main flight path we found it to be very quiet. The swimming pool is outdoor and OK (a little Small). This is not a tourist hotel and as such you will not find any restaurants near by, however, there is a Pizza Hut and a MacDonaldâ€™s within a 10 minutes walk or you can eat at the Hotels restaurant. We were pleased with this hotel and would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC bed, great airport/overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: FussyChinaGirl
Reviews.Content: flew heathrow to LA & would definitely recommend this hotel for an overnight. there was a bit of a wait for the complimentary shuttle from the airport but that's expected on a friday night - the driver helped us on with our luggage & we went straight to the hotel. prompt & friendly check-in, spacious bedroom, room service arrived quickly, and most importantly there was an enormous & fantastically comfortable bed! the bathroom is very compact, but functional - if a little tired & in need of re-furb soon. otherwise, everything clean & tidy as expected. it's an airport hotel (great view of the runway during breakfast in the exec lounge if you like that kind of thing!) so of course there is a little noise from planes overhead but it's fairly muted.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for short stays. Rooms are very well maintained and clean. Parking a bit overpriced but it was to expect since it is near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX - much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MHtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and extended day/late check-out. I needed a hotel near LAX for a Sat night for easy get together with friends traveling elsewhere at same time as me as we all passed through LAX. and being joined by locals. Booked through Hilton site (after comparing rates at obitz, etc.) $140. One king bed, non-smoke. Hotel was nearly full, most others nearby were sold-out. Didn't do priceline/hotwire as I wanted location right by airport and those sites' close-by hotels are in 1-5 mile radius so includes Manhattan Beach 15 minute+ drive further which would have made schedules too tight with friends. positives: Desk said in phone call that shuttle from airport only comes by every 20-25min. But it came as promised, my wait was only 10min. Check-in was quick, very friendly and helfpul. It was a crowded time, but there were four or more working desk, so went quickly. I needed to 4pm check-out and had been warned by phone reservations that would likely be a $99 charge for anything after 1pm check out. (Standard check-out is noon.) However, at check-in I was able to get 4pm check out for $25 charge. Biggest positive: Room was cleaner, more attractive, more comfortable, more plush than I'd expected. Linens and mattress, in particular, were excellent , visually and pleasing to the touch -- really wonderful. Comfortable furniture, including a great high-back swivel leather desk chair. Robes in closet. Better compimentary toiletries than usual for this price room. nice view of runways. 15th floor. I think because I had Hilton Honors membership (their frequent traveler program I barely remember signing up for, but desk staff found my membership), I was given room on one of a few floors served by a guest lounge on the 16th. Lounge nicely appointed, complimentary continental breakfast was typical but sufficient, fresh fruit was good. I didn't get back there again, but apparently snacks and tourist tips offered there all day, warm cookies provided at night before 11pm closing. Good exercise room on lower floor, below ground level registration level. Lots of machines, a number of treadmills w tvs, etc. 24-hour snack/pizza/deli shop on registration level.
