Room service expensive but not overly, just like every other nice hotel. Appealing lobby area, comfortable furniture, marble and fine art, la bit of a luxury hotel feeling. mixed: pool had bonus of four hot tubs seating four each , one at each corner of pool. Pool was clean and lots of chairs, towels provided. Pool was on 3rd floor sheltered from wind. However sheltered from wind also meant no sun on pool until sun is just about directly overhead. So I'd guess pool in sun only from 11:30am to about 2:30pm. (For some that could be a plus.) To get some sun for a few minutes at 11am I sat in an outdoor chair in another patio on same floor as pool,. That area was kind of empty and was not that inviting. Negatives: Online access, hard-wire or wireless, costs $10/day. Maybe that kind of charge made sense a few years ago, but with every cheap hotel offering free wireless now, Hilton should offer this free as well. No refrigerator/mini-bar in room. (But used ice bucket provided and ice-machine at elevators to chill water. Also, two free waters provided.) Not much in the neighborhood. Not a resort, just a travelers lay-over hotel. Next door/walking distance: Carl's Jr fast-food, open late. Next to that: Nude female dancers/sextoys and porn shop. parking is additional cost, underground-covered self-park: $14/day for hotel guests. more for valet. Friends visiting: $5 first hour, $10 second hour. after 2 hours: $14/day. More for valet. interestingly: In the block past Carl'sJr/Nude dancing is Parking Spot business charging $17/day for covered self-park for LAX travelers. Summary: much nicer room than I expected at OK rate on night when not much available at nearby hotels. Fine place for business or travel lay-over.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecty OK”
Reviews.Author: C_K_2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after an 11 hour flight and the clean and comfortable room was most welcome! The hotel itself was in a good location, about 5-10 minutes on the free shuttle bus from the airport. The only bad thing I can report on was the cost of the breakfast (almost $50 for 2 people). Apart from that, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: bijou2006
Reviews.Content: There is a complimentary shuttle bus from LAX, but the hotels are sharing the buses so you'll not arrive direct from the airport, and this could be frustrating at 11pm. Front desk was always busy, several people waiting. I'm HH Gold but had to wait >15min to check in. No upgrade. Room was okay with standard Hilton amenities. HH Gold gets to use the lounge at the top - continental breakfast - very standard (nothing impressive) - lot of people. Internet connection was fine. If you are staying here because of Hertz on site, be extra careful -- I was downgraded from a full size 4 door to a compact. I'm Hertz Gold so didn't care to check the details at the counter, and went 5 floors down to parking to find out. There was only 1 agent at the counter, and he was out for 15-20 minutes, and thus I could not pick up my car as efficiently as I could have at Hertz LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Who Are Parking and Flying Beware”
Reviews.Author: RelocationLady
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Hilton Airport LAX mid June for a vacation to peaceful Hawaii. The room was great and staff excellent. no gripes about the room but the hotel advertises the shuttle will pick you up at the airport and runs every 15 minutes 24 hours a day. That was what sold me because our return flight arrived around 1 AM at night and I did not want to have to worry about a shuttle not coming. The flight landed early and I got to curbside at 1 AM. At 1 45 AM with no shuttle in sight I caught a cab to the hotel. When I arrived back at the hotel I queryed why no shuttle and why not every 15 minutes and was rudely told by valet that it runs when it runs and not to count on that 15 minute rule. At 2:30 when I finally got my car from the hotel. I waited at curbside while hubby got car there was still no shuttle. Also a perfect ruin to a wonderful vacation So from 1 to 2;30 no Hilton Shuttle at the airport or dropping people at the hotel. This is a disgrace shame on you Hilton. So travelers I would advise parking elsewhere if you want a quick pickup at the LAX airportl. Especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: stace2007
Reviews.Content: This Hilton was fine for a one night stay before a flight. The first room they gave me was sans linen, but they gave me a new room right away. When I checked in there wasn't a line, but later that night there was a huge line and only two people checking in. By huge- I mean at least 20 groups waiting to check in. The food in the Italian restaurant was just okay. And they did run out of room on the morning shuttle, so get in line early. But in the hotel's defense, there was a huge group that all checked in at the same time and left on the same time because they were on a flight that was cancelled and this hotel is where the arline gave them vouchers for. Parking can be confusing. But overall a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Lackluster Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trakker
Reviews.Content: - We asked for a quiet room on a high floor - We got a room three doors down from the service elevator on a smoking floor - I know there were availability issues. But, the front desk clerk didn't try too hard to fill our request, given that he activated our room keys b/f he even looked - Although we checked out a day early, no one bothered to ask - And, we were charged for the valet twice! - I will not stay in any Hilton locations again!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK I guess if you want somewhere near the airport to stay. The room was OK, the decor reasonably up to date. Staff were reasonably friendly and the executive lounge pretty well equipped with a cool view of the runways and a good breakfast. The complimentary evening nibbles were very tasty. The bed and pillows were very comfy and the room was a good size. Food is very overpriced. A banana cost me about $4!

Reviews.Title: “where's the shuttle?????”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: I had to fly in the day before an early morning flight in order to make the connection. I have to do this fairly often and usually stay in one of the mid-range chains (ie Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn). This time I saw a good rate for the Hilton and thought I'd give it a try. One thing I noticed was they offer 24-hour shuttle service with pick-ups every 15 minutes. After waiting for an hour at LAX for the shuttle I was not a happy person and neither was the large crowd also waiting. I was at terminal 7 so when the shuttle finally arrived it was pretty packed but we all crammed ourselves in fearful we'd never see another shuttle. When we finally arrived at the hotel the check-in line was obviously long but actually went pretty quickly. I mentioned the shuttle problem to the desk clerk and she said "thanks for letting me know--we hate our shuttle company and hope to change"--I thought perhaps a little more should have been offered after I waited an hour (perhaps a drink coupon or something). The good news was my room was very spacious and comfortable although the counter in the bathroom had a couple of chips. I had dinner in the cafe and it was okay. The shuttle to the airport the next morning was on time.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: javisq
Reviews.Content: Like most everyone, I stayed one night while waiting for a flight at LAX. The check-in was quick and I was on my way to my room. Room was spacious and faced Century Blvd and the airport, but it was pretty quiet considering what I was looking at. The room was good sized, though the bathroom was small compared to the room. Everything was clean and looked fairly new. The shuttle, as promised, left about every 15 minutes. They do stop at another hotel, so plan a few extra minutes. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Luis_and_Renata
Reviews.Content: Excelent room, bed, bathroom, service... An excelente hotel. Near to the airport, BUT far away from everything else...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Kobie1
Reviews.Content: Nothing but problems with this hotel. We arrived at LAX and rang the hotel to request an airport pick up, and were rudely told that they come every 20 minutes and just wait, as they have no idea when they arrive. The bus eventually arrived and was packed. We just fitted on, but unfortunately I had to stand, which was difficult due to the driverâ€™s inability to drive at a reasonable speed and safely. Once we arrived at the hotel, I waited approximately 10 mins to be served. This is while 3 people were served after me in the executive check in area and 2 staff members were helping 1 person in the regular check in. Once in the room we found that the view was of a wall, meaning the room was very dark. We then requested another room, which was basically the same room (facing a wall), but in a different area. I then request another room and was given a room on the executive levels. That night we went for a walk to another hotel close by and on the way back observed 2 valet staff members smoking pot. I was appalled to see that valet staff members who were "high" were driving guest cars. I reported this to management, but I have no idea if anything happened. When we checked out we were not asked if we had a good stay, just paid and left. I would avoid this hotel, even with its nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Mammothmtn_girl
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Hilton LAX on a Park Sleep and Fly website. When we arrived at the Hotel at 11:45 PM, the line for checking in was half-way back to the Lobby and there were 2 maybe 3 front desk representatives. Each transaction took an extreme amount of time. Most of the time the Front Desk Staff was in the back. After about an hour waiting, we were informed that despite the prepaid room, they did not have any clean rooms to issue, "would we mind waiting another 45 minutes?" We asked what the holdup was, and they were having computer issues. What irritated us most was: 1. There was no one in management, or any other guest service representative communicating with these guests. 2. The fact that our reservation was not honored. Hilton books out more rooms then they have as many international travellers come in and check out at all hours. 3. Once issued a room (after the long wait- 1:30 AM at this point) we straggled up the elevators and found ourselves in super unclean room. We beseeched the housekeeping staff and helping them we turned our room over. 4. The walls were very thin and our room was happily situated next to a very squeaky elevator. For the price, the value and service at this Hilton was very poor. Be very cautioned. I understand computer issues every minute a person has to wait without at least some explanation just makes that person more angry. I understand trying to maintain overhead, but there is no excuse for not having enough clean rooms for the amount of travellers who had booked their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Alright airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrickf88
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday for early Saturday flight. Leaving car for week in underground parking. The signs for self-parking are confusing but the good news is for extended parking (greater than 3 days) the fee is only $11 per day. Tax included. That's a better deal that the "Parking Spot" which is right next door. Only complaint is that shuttle to/from LAX is every 15 minutes. The shuttle service is provided for by a third party which means that the shuttle also stops at Four Points Hotel. In my opinion, 15 minutes is a long wait considering that the airport is only 1.5 miles away. The room was pleasant but nothing special. It wasn't noisy at all, which was a surprise since the Hotel is actually close to the runways. Directly across the street is United Airlines Cargo building with the runway right behind it. You can watch planes take off and land from the upper floor rooms. Since this is an airport hotel, there really isn't anything within walking distance interesting to see or do.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Place”
Reviews.Author: cre8tive921
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline for a reasonable price. The room was a bit small with low ceilings. So watch out if your tall. Parking is cramped as well. But overall the place is comfortable and the staff is very nice and helpful. The room was very accommodating. I stayed for almost a week. And would saty again. Modest accommodations. Enjoy the bistro it stays open 24hours for a quick late night snack. Housekeeping & Guest services excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: DizDave
Reviews.Content: This is a good airport hotel, comfortable clean rooms and very convinient location for the airport. You would not want to stay here any more than a couple of nights because there is nothing around it. But if you want a reasonably priced room, somewhere to get your head down for a few hours then this hotel is fine

Reviews.Title: “what a mess”
Reviews.Author: nightpanda
Reviews.Content: I have to say unfortunately that I had a terrible experience here. The room itself was very nice but there were a host of problems. The key card didn't work (twice), all the elevators except one were broken. After a long pacific flight and jetlagged, i needed roomservice. Well, they were doing renovations on the hotel that night and didn't inform me until after i'd checked in and paid for my room. That meant no electricity during the night (when i was wide awake), so no shower, television or food. When i asked what i could do they suggested the fast food restaurant down the road. No effort was made to make amends for all this frustration so I have to say I'd never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlamesa
Reviews.Content: I was at LAX for a connecting flight and because of a long delay elected to stay in LA and catch a flight the next morning. The United Rep gave me a card for hotel discounts and stayed at the Hilton for $79. The free airport shuttle runs every 15 minutes. There was some sort of labor unrest outside. While the lobby was very noisy due to the protestors outside, you couldnt hear them from the rest of the hotel. The hotel room looked like it had seen some wear and tear, but I was happy to have a comfortable bed for the evening. Would recommend it if you need a hotel convenient to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: VesselofHonor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles Airport for 2 months on business and I must say my stay was excellent. The room was always clean, the pool fantastic, the jacuzzi personable and the service was impeccable. The staff was friendly and gifts were placed in my room weekly thanks to Hilton Hhonors. I flew in weekly and after 2 months of staying at this Hotel the service was the same on the last day as it was on the first - immediate, friendly, and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: egatrop
Reviews.Content: My business trips occasionally allow me to stay at upscale hotels, like the Hilton LAX. Staff was nice. Facilities are in good shape. The real highlight of my stay was the bed. King size super comfortable mattress, comfortable pillows, and great down comforter. I didn''t want to get out of bed. Guests on the east side are awaken to sounds like the neighbors are closing doors. Not real loud, but very regular. It took me a while to figure out what it was. It is the sun warming the east side of the building and it creaks (the building, not the sun) as it warms. Might not occur during the summer. No real complaints. The hotel is expensive for what you get. I call it upscale, but you don't really get the upscale perks one might expect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last one on our trip. We had flown in at around 9pm and organised a kangaroo check out which means you dont have to check out until 6pm the following night. They had a courtesy shuttle to the airport and a 24 hour cafe and a really nice restaurant - (the restaurant was a little pricey but the food was great) The room had a great view watching all the planes land and was very clean, the only downfall was the small size of the double?? beds...we were too tired to notice... good for stopovers

Reviews.Title: “Day room great to stay at after long flight”
Reviews.Author: cher1969
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton LAX day room for our arrival after flying from Sydney. After the rude treatment of custom workers at LAX, we were happy the shuttle bus came quickly. We had a delicious breakfast and great service in the hotel restaurant. Even though we arrived at the hotel at 8a.m, the reception desk handed us the key to our room right away. The room is older but the beds were heaven. We got in a 3 hour nap before getting back on our shuttle to catch our flight home to Calgary, Alberta. I would recommend this hotel for short stay while waiting for connecting flights.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Typical large busy airport hotel. Good well appointed room, with very comfortable bed. Own room had cleanliness problem, that may conceivably not have been typical (bathroom surfaces grimey, sink seriously crazed, room carpet stained.) Heavily stained carpets in corridors rather let down the overall ambiance and are clearly due for thorough cleaning or general replacement. Overall not up to the standard expected of the Hilton brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after trans-Pacific flights, as part of package booked by travel agent. Pick-up from the airport was generally quick and easy. Vans come on a regular basis 24 hours a day (at least in theory). We were able to get early check-in both times. Rooms are nothing to shout about, but comfortable, and wife said the bed was the most comfortable she'd ever been in. Food at all of the hotel's many places, from carry-away place to dining room, definitely on the high side in terms of price. "Business center" was a small automated center operated by a concesionaire; Internet 49 cents a minute. Hotel has lots of events (e.g., high school reunions seemed particularly popular when we were there), so the front entrance area can be jammed with vehicles, thus delaying the airport shuttle van (at times they go to the side entrance due tothis congesion; be sure to ask). Not much within walking distance. There is a Carl's Jr. (hamburgers, etc.) across the street. May hear some jet noise from your room (you're within sight of the LAX runways; may get interesting views of the lines of approaching planes), as is true anywhere in the area. We'd stayed at one other LAX area hotel (Holiday Inn) a few years ago. Hilton was a notch above.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when you get off a plane”
Reviews.Author: keznscud
Reviews.Content: Flew into LA from New York. arriving at 2-30am NY time. The Hilton shuttle picked us up within 10mins of arrival. Check in was easy and quick. Lovely, spacious and clean room. Staff were friendly and helpful. Arranged a tour for the next day without fuss. Would stay there again when in LA next.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay but that's all”
Reviews.Author: UKcritic
Reviews.Content: Glitzy entrance and public areas but a bit worn and tried on the bedroom corridors. Better choices at LAX than this.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: RoscoeLaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business conference, which was held at the hotel. The good: Beautiful place, clean rooms, friendly bar staff. I didn't like the chicken marsala but the rest of the food I ordered was OK. The bad: My employer had faxed them the payment information early, but they said they needed more in order to charge their card, so I ended up paying for the hotel. Got reimbursed. Other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: davidf37
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I've stayed in this hotel and both times I booked through Hotwire and got a very good rate. 1st time I stayed was in April this year and got a bigger room with a much better view. My 2nd trip was for Labor Day weekend and it may hav been because of demand for rooms but I ended up on a lower floor in a room all th way at the end of the hall that was significantly smallr than what I was able to get in April. Be aware, I payed the same price both times. Also had a leaky AC which left wet spots on the carpeting near the entrance to the bathroom. This hotel is VERY close to Manhattan Beach and not far from Venice either. Bverly Hills and Hollywood are about 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “The Airport Hilton gets six out of five stars!”
Reviews.Author: cdfs
Reviews.Content: Just what you want before a 4 am wakeup call! Quiet, lovely restaurant, extremely comfortable room with every amenity possible. No airport noise. Exceptionally helpful and considerate staff. Worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall, but not great value”
Reviews.Author: jrccih
Reviews.Content: This particular Hilton is your standard Hilton hotel, with all the amenities that a business traveler could want, nice comfortable beds, reasonable broadband internet access ($9.95), reasonably good if not average breakfast bar, and well-appointed bathrooms. I did feel that the $225 price tag (incl taxes) was a bit steep, so it receives low marks from me from a value basis. I might instead stay at the nearby Embassy Suites (always a good stay). I stay at this Hilton for single overnights when arriving from Asia and before I travel back to the East coast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four night stay on business. Not bad, but nothing special. Pros: Adequate facilities, good buffet breakfast though expensive, nice enough room. Cons: Plane noise in early hours, terrible evening restaurant food, amateur bar staff. This hotel lacks class in location, rooms and especially staff training.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well reviewed the online hotel guide online and figured the lax hilton looked like a great place. Having a friend fly in from Germany for the Christmas holidays, figured close too airport so booked a suite for a week after asking the front desk the y sugested the top floor lower noise level.... ok said I lets book it Well arrived at hotel first off they tell us sorry the upper floor bar and lounge is closed till after the ho;iday, but if you wait here for a while ill fill out some breakfast coupons for you ? even though the suite area is quit a bit more expensive ok I said hey its not the end of the world no problem, well went up too the room, and yes you guessed it airplane noise over top off head ok, well its a airport hey what do you expect lets move rooms. So we moved rooms well the matress in this room was a joke you could almost sink in the middle moved again well the tv in this room did not work so they sent up a maintence person too fix it 3 hours later he could not figure it out so he called a tecin and then went home leaving us with a tec from the cable company all day while they tried to figure it out.Well they could not figure it out so they decided too check the other tv well after a long day with a tv technician we were a little upset at the sevice they were providing I could continue on but I think you get the general idea...... Funny thing is management never appoligised or tried to componsate us after speanding over a thousand dollars at there hotel..so ifyou are planning on staying at the lax hilton you may want too think again. I would hate to see any body go through what we went through.. but on the bright side they did send up a fruit basket ...... welll that a small version of our story customer beware

Reviews.Title: “Excellent featherbeds, BAD concierge service, parking $14self $18valet $10others”
Reviews.Author: lifespace1000
Reviews.Content: THE BEDS ARE SUPER!! Hilton offers WONDERFUL comfortable FEATHERBEDS. Nice room, excellent noise barrier, nice pool, 4 whilpool spas, room service staff is kind and helpful. Rooms have iron and iron board, hairdryer and coffee maker, but NO FRIDGE. Internet access is EXPENSIVE and you pay for all local calls. RECEPTION and CONCIERGE are NOT nice not friendly not helpful. You get no greeting, no hello, no smiles, no welcome, no courtesy. Unfortunately our room did not have enough towels for 3 persons had to ask from housekeeping who are too happy to help. Hotel Management knew from reservation how many people are staying but did not prepare the room accordingly. We could NOT take a bath (small child) only shower for 2 days - bath tub plumbing had to be fixed. Concierge won't allow you to use the baggage trolley - only bellhops can use it. When you are in a hurry you can not wait for a bellhop to come at his convenience. They charge MORE for paying guests than non-guests for parking !! If you are a paying guest at the hotel, you pay $18 for valet parking per day, $14 for self parking, and only $10 for non staying outsiders !!! We asked for the reduced rate parking but reception said its for NON STAYING GUESTS ONLY. This really upset me. HILTONS KNOW BETTER than this. I think this location needs new management, people who know how to make everyone feel welcome. I am a world traveller and i know it is not unreasonable what i am asking.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but one of the best hotels I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: luckyduck7
Reviews.Content: I am a student who went to L.A. to look for a job. I got my room from Priceline for $55 and at that price, this was an exceptional deal. This was probably the cleanest hotel room I've ever had. The bedspread was white and there was nary a stain to be found. I requested a room with a single, king-sized bed. The room was gigantic and was poolside on the third floor, so all I had to do to get to the pool was to open the window. I didn't expect to stay in my room as much as I did, but the room was so comfortable, that I only left in order to let the maid clean up. The hotel is located a block away from the airport, which is good if you want to fly out, but it is also located in Inglewood, and in spite of being within 10 miles of Hollywood/downtown, it takes half an hour or more to get there when there is traffic. Other than that, the only real drawback is that you end up paying for things that mght be free at other hotels. Wireless internet costs $10 a day, and parking is $13, so figure that into your hotel budget when making plans. I have stayed in better, more luxurious rooms, but this stay was pretty special if only because I've never been less paranoid about the cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was expecting worse from this hotel based on previous reviews... Its really not that bad as far as airport hotels go. The room was small and the bed along with other furnishings looked a little tired. But this was made up for by the HHonors Gold upgrade which allowed access to the exec lounge where there was plenty of free food being served. In the morning an excellent continental breakfast of cereal, bread, juice, coffee, fruit etc was served. In the evening there was small snack foods which were enough for me that i didnt have to buy a meal. Also after 8pm desert was served which consisted of cookies and other delicious items.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand
Reviews.Content: I never expect much from any airport hotel. So, since I had to attend a conference at this hotel I was stuck. I did not have much hope. Boy was I wrong! Check in was perfect and quick. The rooms are truly beautiful. The beds and bedding were luxurious. And they were nice and spacious rooms too. The view was not great, but I was there to sleep and work. The lobby is gorgeous and elegant and the staff worked hard to make this Expo successful. I was very pleased. Incredibly, the restaurants were really good and so was room service. I ordered breakfast every morning and tried the restaurant twice. Sometimes the service was slow but the food was very good. I would definitely choose to stay here when flying in and out of LAX. OH! The one real downer here is their parking structure. What a mess. We had to go down 6 floors to get to any parking. Now, I know this is because of the Expo, but it was really inconvenient. Otherwise it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice...”
Reviews.Author: Girish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good one with all the amenities you would expect of a 4 star property. The rooms were big enough and the accepted all our requests for 2 beds, non smoking and high floor. Its a good option for people transiting thru the airport or even seeing LA. A car is must in LA coz whereever you stay you would be travelling quite a bit. So you might as well stay a little further and save $$$. We got this hotel for $60 against a rack rate of $149 thru priceline (name your price) There's a hertz counter right there in the hotel. I'd stay here again....esp for those prices.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great port in storm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and the begining and end of a holiday travelling around California. We had booked a king, smoking room which was unavailable on arrival, we accepted the offer of a double,non smoking room, which we were then informed would not be available for another 2 hours!! Tired as we were we accepted and retired to the bar for a non complimentary drink! Having finally secured our key from the unapologetic and uninterested reception team we found the room to be clean and functional with a tiny bathroom. The shuttle service to the airport was fine, but on our return, an airline crew were waiting to board and the driver, under pressure, had my boyfriend help him lift off all the suitcases from the bus with neither a please nor thank you. On arriving to our room, we found it already occupied. Again the staff were totally unapologetic and unconcerned. My letter of complaint has so far been ignored. Weary travellers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillDen
Reviews.Content: Considering that this is right by LAX, I think it is one of the nicest airport hotels I have stayed in. However, we did have a problem during check in. I booked and guaranteed a king non smoking room; however, when we arrived, all that they had was two doubles. Also, there were no wash cloths in the bathroom. The bathroom wasn't that fancy either; however, it was clean. Other than that, the room was nice and the beds were very comfortable. There was a great view of the runways and you couldn't hardly hear the noise from the planes. I've stayed near LAX before and this is by far the best hotel I have encountered. I would probably stay here again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good stay”
Reviews.Author: Htown_Buck
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 nights at the Hilton LAX. I had read a couple of bad reviews here and was wary. Fortuneatly those fears were dashed as soon as I opened the door to my room on the 13th floor. My room was spacious and very clean. Yes, the bathroom is small, but I was travelling by myself so that was not a concern. The bathroom was clean and showed no signs of wear and tear. The shower put out a nice steady stream of hot water which is always a plus to me. The king side bed was terrific. A little on the soft side which I prefer. The only negatives I had: The maid neglected to put face cloths in the bathroom 2 nights in a row. The other, I ordered a pizza and a couple of slices were burnt. I would have sent it back, but I wasn't that hungry anyway and couldn't have finished those slices. I highly recommmend the chick and rice soup. I had that 2 nights in a row and it was delicious. Another post mentioned the elevators from the parking garage. They are NOT scary and work just fine. Just a little on the slow side perhaps, but they only service about 4 floors so it's really no big deal. My company booked this room through Priceline at just $60 a night. A GREAT bargain, in my opinion. I've already told my boss to book me there again the next time I travel to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Their bathoom are as good as a cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: rareTraveller
Reviews.Content: You would expect a Hilton hotel to be good.. however this is one is worst. I got a standard room. The bathroom is is very much comparable to an old cheap motel. Its small, sink, facutes are old dirty and worn out. Cracks in sink.. floor tiles.. Feels like i must have booked this room for $30. The lift from paking level 5 to lobby is really scary.. it works like a 1950-60s lift and is ugly. seriousy needs replacement. btw Parking is $13/day Sincerely I would have been better of getting a some other 2-3 star hotel for a lesser price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for one night. We booked through hotwire for $65.00 per night. Be advised, the hotel charges $13.00 for parking. The front desk help was excellent and the lobby was very nice looking. The room was large and the bed was beautiful. It had a white down comforter, white sheets and lots of white pillows. The bathroom was very small and we had trouble with the water temperature in the shower. (It literally took 2 minutes for the water temperature to change once you made an adjustment.) Overall, the hotel was nice for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ebayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 night at a priceline rate of $51. Couldn't have asked for more! Priceline rates this hotel a 3* but it should be at least a 4*. We got a 12th floor room with views of the LAX runway and the noise, although noticeable, was minimal. Rooms recently remodeled so everything was in top shape. Bottom line: Wish I could get this hotel on my next 3* priceline bid for LAX.

Reviews.Title: “One night at LAX”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very impressive looking hotel with stunning atrium. Long queues at checkin but no-one at the HH line so we were checked in in minutes. Also within walking distance of the Avis lot if you are dropping a hire car. Bedroom was large and the decoration very new - also very comfortable and large bed. But the bathroom! - it was dirty and the gold plated shower screen looked about twenty years old. The Executive Lounge is not very large for the hotel size. The food selection was very poor and unlike Hiltons outside the US drinks are not free - $16 for two very small glasses of very average wine. Not worth vistiting IMHO. Rooms very quiet and also shuttle bus to LAX was very good - we walked straight onto a bus and we were in the terminal in ten minutes. Also very expensive for an overnight airport hotel - and we did book a couple of months in advance - not good value and would try Embassy Suites next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Los Angeles Airport twice when going and coming back from Kona. The hotel was nice, but the shuttle bus service was terrible. Very long wait, about 30 minutes. Once the bus came it was full and the driver refused to take us. We had to wait for another 10-15 mintuts. Total about 40 minute wait. The second bus was empty, we waved at the bus, the driver obviously saw us, the bus stopped but the driver did not open the door. So we wait at the door, eventually I knocked at the window and he eventually opened the door. He did not help with the luggage. When we complained at the front desk they said that they are a big hotel so the bus gets full. Somehow other hotels were able to figure out better ways to operate their shuttle service, since a number of them passed us a many times when we waited for the Hilton shuttle. The front desk clark promised that the manager would contact us about it, but nobody from Hilton ever called us. I guess they don't care. I don't think we'll be staying at that hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay, Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel at the beginning of our overseas early morning flight out of LAX. We got a Stay, Park and Fly rate when calling the hotel, could not find one on their website or on the hilton website. But for $169 you got 1 night stay and 7 nights parking in their garage. This included Self or Valet parking. They also run 24 hour shuttles to LAX. It is a very nice hotel and suited for business travelers. The room was very comfortable and we did not find the airport noise distrubing at all. Since we arrived late, we valet parked and then decided to do room service, since we didn't want to get out of sweats to go down to eat or venture out to one of the local resturants. Room service was prompt and delivered on a rolling table. Food was good. Only complaint was that we ordered some plain pasta for a child and they charge the same rate a full meal with Shrimp and veggies. Kind of expected it. Like I said it was a business hotel and not really geared towards families or kids. We had 2 double beds for 3 people. Which they would have had 2 Queens. Down comforters and Plush pillows. Small, clean bathroom with premimum soaps. at 5:30am, 3 shuttles were waiting to take people to the airport. When one left full, the next one was right behind. They were very prompt on getting us to LAX. On our return at 9pm, seemed like it too forever for the shuttle to arrive at our pickup place. We saw several other shuttles come by multiple times for other hotels. (Haciendia hotel came by 3 times,). About 1/2 hour later it came and we quickly got our car from valet. I would recommend, but try to see if you can get a deal on the rate for Park and Fly. Found other hotels Haciendia on their website offered some good deals with Stay, Park and Fly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay-Hilton's the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had such a good time at the hilton. My kids had a great time swimming in the pool, and the courtyards are so peaceful that you forget you're at the airport. We just loved the new Suite Dreams Beds and the newly renovated rooms are beautiful. The color scheme is fantastic. Everyone was so nice and very accommodating. When my children requested something that was not on the menu, they went out of their way to get it. I highly reccommend staying at the Hilton LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for an overnight and found it very nice and a great value for the money. It was clean and the service was very good. I ordered room service and it was on time and very good.

Reviews.Title: “No Issues here”
Reviews.Author: Tom2002a
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here before a early morning flight to the east coast. Clean, comfortable and no complaints. This is not a resort. It is a large airport hotel catering to business travellers. The bar is packed with people that are by themselves or in small groups - and is a good place to grab a sandwich. There are 2 restuarants and a coffee shop/pizza combo with take out. There is a continios shuttle to the airport and a Hertz kiosk - very convient for dropping off the rental. My only regret is not requesting a runway view.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Happy_hour_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Doing a one night stop-over in LAX on my trip from Hawaii to Switzerland (Europe), the Hilton Airport was a good choice. The airport shuttle drives all 15 minutes, the check in procedere was fast an friendly, the room was clean, nice and the king size bed had a very good mattress. There is a in room Internet LAN access for arround 10 USD aviable, also a WLAN acces for the same amount. For an excellent rate, i miss a free WLAN Access.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk has improved”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review back in March - and was disappointed with the service and room location. I returned to the property, at the invitation of an assistant manager, to find many improvements in check-in. The service was quick, friendly, and well managed. The staff honored my request for a Towers Room, and were generally very affable. Room service is expensive, but no more so than any similar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a fine place to stay for the airport”
Reviews.Author: whateverintexas
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for a night before catching an early flight, and i found it fine. my room was facing east, on the 13th floor, in one of the towers. i had a view of two runways and the sunrise. the room was clean and i could not hear other people in their rooms, nor noise in the hall. the sound proofing for the planes was also fine. the bed was comfy and the shower worked well. the bathroom is a bit small, but the room was spacious. one of the best things was that i was able to get into a free wifi connection (TLAX) and that saved me $10 (the cost of their internet service.) i found the check-in people friendly, too. all in all, i'd say that this is a good place to stay, if you need to stay at the airport. shop around, though----i got a good deal online, but there are probably better places around that are also cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 13_jane
Reviews.Content: My family (8 of us in total) stayed at this hotel on 3rd April 05. Our rooms were fantastic - huge big beds, ultra white bedding, soo clean! "One of the best nights sleeps I've ever had" was the comment from all of us! (just dont wear false tan!! my Mother-in-Law had tanned herself before we departed the UK and left her mark on the white bedding!! hehe!!) The common areas were beautiful - all marble!! We were staying here before we went on a cruise the next day, and 3 coach loads of us arrived from LAX and the hotel had every door key ready for us and we had to wait a max of 5 mins to get our door key!! The porters were great bringing our cases to our rooms, and again the next day they collected all our cases and had them arranged in one of the fantastic ballrooms for our departure. One of the couples in our party accidentally left her duty free cigarettes in the room, and only realised when we got to San Pedro!! One of our reps rang the hotel and the cigarettes were located and brought to the dock within an hour!! now thats what I call good service! We ate at the hotel for dinner and then breakfast the next morning - again very pleased with everything. Before we headed off to San Pedro we had a morning free and decided to head off to explore a bit of Santa Monica - the doormen were most helpful in getting us taxis, they even arranged to get us a special taxi to accommodate my mother-in-laws scooter!! On our return trip, our cruise line had arranged for us to use the facilities at the hilton before we headed off to LAX for our flight. When we arrived they had a beautiful buffet of hot and cold food waiting for us. Outstanding!!! If I were to travel to Los Angeles again, I wouldnt hesitate to stay at this hotel, as I know the other 7 people in our party wouldnt.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for one night because we were catching a flight back to home. The location was great next to the airport. The room was terrible. I asked for a wake up call at 4:15 am and never got it. We almost missed our flight. The bathroom was so small and terrible. The sink was clogged and there were so many cigarette burns on them. After going up to our room we had to come back down because are keys didnt work so they had to re-program it. We came in at 10 pm so there were no waiting to check in. The bellmen was the best part of the stay they were very prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was assigned to me when I bought a Tournament of Roses package and I have no idea what the room cost. The lobby was impressive. My room was okay. It was clean and that is what is most important to me as well as being quiet. Quiet, it was not. The noise from the planes DID NOT bother me as I am used to hearing trains come through near my home at night. It was the "people" noise that was unbearable. I was on the 13th floor and I believe they ran out of insulation when they got to that floor. You could hear people talking, sneezing and coughing like they were in the room with you. There was no way I could drown out the TV noise. I could never recommend this hotel from my experience there. Other guests told me they heard lots of noises while others said their rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good - once you get past check in”
Reviews.Author: NIrishtraveler
Reviews.Content: Like the last reviewer, we waited an age to get checked in. We passed the time by admiring the lobby model of the refurbished bed rooms. They look very nice but as a hotwire customer we didn't get one. The older room was ok although there was a water leak under the sink that appearing to have been happening for so long that the tiled floor was actually water stained. Had we been staying more than one night we would have had to ask for a change of room, maybe a remodelled one! Public areas are large and bright and impressive. The pool area is small. Restaurant prices are good but they bite you with drinks prices - $3 for a small glass of coke full of ice and $4.50 for a small glass of cranberry. You don't even get charged that amount in Ireland!! Overall however we liked this hotel, it is well positioned and the room noise from aircraft was almost un-noticible. Not bad at all for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices in the area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel around a dozen times in the last few years, mostly when I can't get into the Embassy Suites down the street. As a Hilton Diamond member (their top level), you'd think I'd be treated like royalty - think again. My last trip found me on a lower floor, my room key wouldn't work to get me into the executive lounge and they didn't even provide the complimentary bottled water they promise to Diamond members. I asked at the front desk if they could send up the water and after about 10 minutes of whispering in the back room (what on earth could they be talking about?) they promised they would send it up while I was out to dinner - but of course no such luck. I even double checked to make sure they had my Hilton number on the reservation. They had handed me card when I checked in with the Service Manager's name and email address so I sent her an email asking her about these and a few other problems. Admittedly, these were fairly minor problems but when you spend 100 nights a year in a Hilton you do expect to be treated better. I got back a form letter with a promise of a better response from the "department heads" but it's been several weeks with no response. They are doing a remodel of the rooms - thank God - the old ones were very very dark and you could not read to save your life. I used to have to go into the bathroom to read anything the bulbs were so dim. The remodeled ones are nicer with upgraded bedding but are still very average in size. Location is very close to LAX but of course so are about 20 other hotels. The noise from the planes seem to be much worse here- I don't know if the construction or if small differences in location around the airport make that much difference but it's always very noisy here. The place is usually packed with people attending conventions, trade shows, etc. in their extenise meeting space. If you're not of those folks, you can do much better at other hotels in the area (Embassy Suites North, for one.)

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 has nicer rooms”
Reviews.Author: PoipuSands124
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and I could understand if people get lost on the way to their rooms. Walking down the halls to my room I could see stained carpet and dinged up doors and immediately thought that the place is overdue for a rennovation. Our room was fairly large but sparsely furnished with 20+ year old furnishings. The bathroom however was truly disgusting. The tub was discolored in many places but was covered in non stick film to hide it. It was so gross my wife wouldn't take a shower. Normally I'd complain but we were there for only 5 or 6 hours to sleep before our flight out of LAX so it wasn't a huge deal. We may have been given the Hotwire room so if you pay full rate you might do better. Parking is $13 - quite a ripoff. In any case I'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations for the Better”
Reviews.Author: sactosally
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2005. Mind you, I was fully prepared to give this hotel a horrid rating based on all the reviews I've read on the net. But surprisingly, I had a very good stay! I checked in at the Hilton Honors desk (blue card). The clerk was quite nice and didn't give me any priceline attitude. She gave me a room on the 10th floor. The hallways looked great from the recent renovations. Even so, I braced myself for the room itself. Pleasant surprise! The room was decorated in a sage/khaki/cream motif. The carpets were new and clean. The beds were lofty, piled high with a thick mattress, down comforter and 4 pillows per bed. There was an executive desk and chair, another chair by the window, coffee maker and a 25" or so Phillips television. The bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to wake up in the morning. There was definitely noise from the planes at LAX, but it wasn't intolerable. The bathroom was clean but small. Neutrogena products available. Water pressure was fine. The shower had a large dial control, which I think would be easy to manage for people with limited use of their hands. The fitness center is temporarily located 1 floor below the lobby (it will be on the 3rd floor when it's finished). It's open 24 hours. Pretty good equipment. Video terminals on every cardio machine (bring your own earphones). The front desk accomodated me for a late check out. All in all, I can't complain one bit about this stay. Granted, I might have lucked out with a great room because of the Honors card or because I checked in at 9:45pm when the crappy rooms were gone. I would have to stay at least once more before wholeheartedly recommending this hotel as a good Priceline deal.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times. The hotel itself is okay, but I always have to argue get to stay in the 16th exec. floor even when I'm paying undiscounted suite rates. Last time I stayed there in Sep/2004, they made me stay for the first two nights of my visit in a normal room and charged suite rates. Trust me, the front desk clerks are unimaginably rude at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton L.a airport is quite a convenient hotel, despite the area around the airport being a bit dodgy. We had a room on the top floor, on the corner, which was quite big and we could see most of Los Angeles in the distance, even if outside the hotel was a massive Neutrogena factory. We only stayed for a night, so didn't have breakfast in the restaurent, although have to mention that the concierge and the shop downstairs were quite helpful. But don't do what we accidentally did and stay there when there's a ballroom convention going on. It's fun to see all the dancers but they completely take up all the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: World_Quest
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel exudes oppulence. Too bad you can't spend the nights there! I was there July 24-28, 2004. The rooms were just OK as far as furnishings and content. Still, the building is definitely due for a renovation. Most rooms have a wonderful view of the rubber plastered runways of LAX. The constant roar of 747s adds to this ambiance. In what I hope was a freak occurance while I was there, the fire alarms went off two nights in a row at around 3-4AM. This was immediately followed by security guards reassuring us "everything was OK" over the loud speakers in the rooms. So between planes, traffic, alarms and announcements sleep was out of the question. Bait and Switch reigns supreme in this Hilton. Don't be fooled by the ads, you will have to pay for everything but water. There is no free parking or internet access. Do not try to get around the high speed access charge by using dailup - you will be charged by the minute for local calls. There were several other things that really --- me off about this hotel. I can honestly say this is the worst Hilton I've ever stayed at. Suffice it to say that I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outdate, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: solomentehawaii
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an examination administered at the hotel October 2004 and thought the convenience would be great. Contrary to other reviews, I found the service to be friendly. However, the rooms and facilities were subpar. The room decor was circa 1981, and I am not sure it had been cleaned since. The bathroom was tiny: the door had to be closed to access the toilet or shower. The halls were dim. The bar was okay, although other forces were at play :) But the restaurant was gross. One day when eating lunch I saw insects moving in the light fixture ( I had not recently been to the bar). Overall, I was very disappointed. I felt uncomforatable during my stay secondary to the condition of the hotel. God forbid I fail the exam, I will be staying at the Westin next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton for $55”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was kinda worried after i read all the reviews espcially the bed bugs..(eww). I got the room from Priceline for $55 (tax included). Most of the reveiws said they treat priceline customer like dirt. However, upon check-in at 1 am, the japanese girl at the front desk was fine. Showed her my AMEX and HHonor card, got a room on the HHonor floor (1239). The sheet was clean. The shower head wasn't a low-flow model. The room was clean. However, the faucet at the sink was not working well. I could hear the water dripping. The noise from the airplane is noticeable but bearable for me. I will still prefer Marriot next door cuz it's much bigger and the parking is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel, even to airport hotel standards and certainly to Hilton standards. Room was very dark, not very clean and rundown. I found the fact that the floors are a maze and directions are poor (I had a room on the third floor on 26 October 2004) really terrifying. Front desk clerk was rather rude. I did not visit the restaurant or used other facilities. Shuttle from LAX to hotel took ages to come. I believe this hotel is now in the process of refurbishment, but I doubt this will change much. The concept is just out of date. For less money the HoJo LAX is at least as good, although with less facilities. For the same money the Marriott LAX and the Sharaton LX are much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JKWD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and so as the room. We stayed at the Executive floor which should have been better but we still do not find the room appealing. The executive lounge is ok but is sometimes crowded. The food are expensive but not so tasty. The service is just ok. Free shuttle to/from the airport is nice but do not expect much help with the luggage. For a hilton hotel, it is a bit disappointing.
